Description:
Jump: Welcome ! - Donations - Rules - Specs - Terms



Welcome !

This is a Mastodon instance oriented around Retrocomputing and everything that rotates around this theme.
Of course any other topic is allowed, but you will find probably more retro tech stuff around there!
We don't have language restrictions, but please write your reports in english for the admin.

It's run by the person you see on the right (that's me!) and for now, that's all.
There might be more admins and moderators later if the needs come but alas not yet.
We run Mastodon Glitch Edition.

I hope this instance works okay for you, and that you can find a nice and welcoming community here! Feel free to hit me up if you have any questions or requests, be it about this instance, how to make your own instance, or other things not related to Mastodon.

I am actually the only sysadmin of this instance and I can't work full-time on oldbytes.space so, I will do whatever I can in a reasonable time to make it works the best it can.

Donations

The instance is hosted on a dedicated server (AX41-NVME) by Hetzner (Helsinki), backups are also hosted at Hetzner in the same zone.
The medias are hosted by Wasabi in eu-central-2 (Frankfurt).
You can donate to me at https://ko-fi.com/dashie_the_otter for the running costs.
As of 28/11/2022 I am getting 80‚Ç¨/month.

Rules

This instance has some rules, of course.
First, the usual : no sexism, no racism, no hate speech, no LGBTQphobia, no nazis, no spam, no public unflagged porn, no climate change denial, etc...
Then, I also believe it's important to remind you that this server was made and is being run by a queer activist.
This server thrives to be inclusive, and I will ban without much regret.
People are encouraged to use the report function as they see fit, and can be confident that their complaints will be heard and dealt with in some way. I want everyone to feel safe here, and if that doesn't sound like something you like, you should probably find another server.
No scam content allowed regarding cryptos, and other wallet magic money back things. Links to profiles for donations only are ok, invites are not.

There's also a pretty important activism aspect of this instance.
If you're a marketer, or a #digital #influencer, this is not the place for you. Not only do I feel you should not feel welcome, I intend to make you feel definitely NOT welcome.
This instance, and this entire social network in my opinion, is dedicated to reclaiming social media, decentralizing, and generally creating better and more engaging communities.
The three categories of people I mentioned earlier are not, in my opinion, working towards this goal, pretty much the opposite, and they are not welcome on this server.
Please report them if you see them.
We also block Nazis, techbros and RMS.


Terms

The server is hosted in Helsinki (Finland), backups too. Hosted by Hetzner (Germany).
The only logs created are the ones from: nginx, mastodon (nodejs, puma web server, sidekiq) and minio (assets).
There is no retention currently in place except the by-default on Debian.

Emojis

We have drgn emojis from https://volpeon.ink/projects/emojis/drgn/, Neocats from https://volpeon.ink/projects/emojis/neocat/ and Old Man Yells at from https://tooters.org/@victor/111179689804699576.
Short:
Full of old bytes. Please don't demagnetize the core memory, thanks.
Do you like old hardware ? Do you use them ? Perfect you're welcome here !

[FR] Quelques infos en +

  • Cette instance est h√©berg√©e par Aquilenet, FAI associatif, local et militant en Aquitaine. Elle est administr√©e et mod√©r√©e par des b√©n√©voles sous leurs propres responsabilit√©s et non celle de l'association.
  • L'acc√®s est ouvert √† tou‚ãÖte‚ãÖs (et toots), mais la cr√©ation de compte est soumise √† approbation pour limiter le spam.
  • La mod√©ration sera intransigeante avec les cas de mauvais comportement sur l'instance, √† savoir la publication de propos ou contenus offensants (sexistes, racistes, LGBTQI+phobes, validistes, ou jug√©s oppressifs sous toute forme) et les cas de harc√®lement cibl√© envers un‚ãÖe utilisateur‚ãÖice.
  • Les publications confusionnistes ne sont ni admises ni tol√©r√©es.
  • Le pros√©lytisme, sous quelque forme qu'il soit, √©tant une forme particuli√®rement pernicieuse de violence envers autrui, il n'est pas tol√©r√©. Quelles que soient vos croyances, convictions ou choix personnels, abstenez vous de les imposer √† autrui.
  • Les contenus √† l'origine de nuisances publicitaires seront sujet √† avertissement et/ou suppression des contenus et/ou du compte, sans pr√©avis.
  • Les comptes parodiques ainsi que les bots doivent imp√©rativement le mentionner explicitement dans le profil ou seront supprim√©s sans pr√©avis.
  • Les publications crois√©es (cross posting) sont extr√®mement mal per√ßues ici, elles sont proscrites si automatiques.
  • La publication se fait en Fran√ßais ou en Anglais (√©ventuellement en Espagnol), nous ne comprenons pas d'autres langues et ne pouvons donc assurer la mod√©ration. Merci de choisir une instance √† m√™me de vous accueillir convenablement.
  • L'usage du cw est requis pour tout contenu qui pourrait √™tre per√ßu comme choquant (nudit√©, porno, violence, sang, phobies classiques, etc). Dans le doute il est pr√©f√©rable d'en mettre un. Si quiconque vous en fait la demande, veuillez supprimer le contenu incrimin√© et le republier avec un cw.


Aquilenet applique sur son instance un code de conduite. Tout‚ãÖe membre de l'instance se doit de respecter celui-ci afin que tout se passe bien pour tout le monde. Merci de prendre le temps de le consulter.

De plus, tout contenu manifestement ill√©gal ou publicitaire sera sanctionn√©.

Si une instance refuse son devoir de mod√©ration et que la mod√©ration estime trop grand le risque de harc√®lement cibl√©, de propos injurieux envers les membres de l'instance ou de diffusion de contenu r√©pr√©hensible, elle pourra choisir de silencer (ne pas afficher le contenu de l'instance par d√©faut dans les flux de l'instance d'Aquilenet) ou bloquer l'instance (couper toute communication entre l'instance d'Aquilenet et l'instance incrimin√©e).

Vous pouvez contacter les administrateurs de l'instance √† tout moment, √† savoir :

  • @aquilenet@toot.aquilenet.fr

Mais aussi (surtout ?) sur leurs comptes personnels :
  • @cyphergoat@toot.aquilenet.fr
  • @MicroCheapFx@toot.aquilenet.fr
  • @Tagada@toot.aquilenet.fr
  • @redsilk@toot.aquilenet.fr


Avertissement : Vous suivez automatiquement le compte Aquilenet de l'instance lorsque vous cr√©ez un compte. Pensez √† l'unfollow s'il ne vous int√©resse pas !

Si vous souhaitez nous soutenir, le plus simple est d'adh√©rer √† l'association (√† prix libre, prix indicatif de 15‚Ç¨/an).
Pour un don ponctuel ou r√©current, merci de contacter par mail tresorier@aquilenet[.]fr

Bienvenue parmi nous \o/ !

[EN] Some more informations

  • This instance is hosted by Aquilenet, an associative, local and militant ISP in Aquitaine. It is administered and moderated by volunteers under their own responsibility and not that of the association.
  • The access is open for everyone, but account creation is subject to approval to limit spam.
  • The moderation will be strict about cases of bad behaviour on the instance, which includes publishing offensive words or content(sexist, racist, LGBTQI+phobic, ableist, or judged as oppressive in any way) and the cases of cyber-harrassment towards an user.
  • Confusionist posts are not allowed or tolerated.
  • Proselytizing in any form is a particularly pernicious form of violence against others and is not tolerated. Whatever your beliefs, convictions or personal choices are, refrain yourself from imposing them on others.
  • Content causing advertising nuisance will be subject to warning and/or deletion of content and/or account, without notice.
  • Parody accounts as well as bots must imperatively mention it explicitly in the profile or will be deleted without notice.
  • Cross posting is extremely badly perceived here, it's prohibited if automated.
  • Publication here is in French or English (possibly in Spanish), we do not understand other languages and therefore cannot ensure moderation. Please choose an instance that can accommodate you properly.
  • The use of cw is required for any content that could be perceived as offensive (nudity, pron, violence, blood, classic phobias, etc). If in doubt, it is best to put one on. If anyone asks you to, please remove the offending content and repost it with a cw.


Aquilenet applies on its instance a code of conduct. Every member of the instance has to respect it so we can get along together. Thank you for takind the time to read it.

Moreover, any content manifestly illegal (based on the french and european laws) or advertising will be punished.

If an instance refuses its moderation duty and if our moderation team estimates the risk of harassment, insult towards our members, or objectionable content diffusion is too big, they can decide to silence (don't display the instance contents by default on Aquilenet's timelines) or block that instance (shut down any form of communication between Aquilenet's instance and the incriminated instance).

You can contact the administrators of the instance whenever needed, at :

  • @aquilenet@toot.aquilenet.fr

But also (overall ?) on their personnal accounts :
  • @cyphergoat@toot.aquilenet.fr
  • @MicroCheapFx@toot.aquilenet.fr
  • @Tagada@toot.aquilenet.fr
  • @redsilk@toot.aquilenet.fr

CAUTION : You will automatically follow the Aquilenet account of the instance whenever you open an account. You might want to unfollow it if you're not interested !

If you want to support us, here is the simplest way : join the association (free price, indicative price 15‚Ç¨/year).
For a gift, recurring or ponctual, please write by mail to tresorier@aquilenet[.]fr

Welcome among us \o/!

Description:
Languages: English, Fran√ßais, Nederlands

Welcome

Welcome on the Mastodon instance hosted by the Pirate Party Belgium (PPBe).

We host this instance so that people who feel they are Pirates can have a nice space for them in the Fediverse. You don't have to agree with everything in our basic text, but it will give you a good overview of what a Pirate is and what our values are.

Please read our Code of Conduct before joining us. It might sound harsh, but there are thousands of other instances and you can even host your own.

The instance server is paid with PPBe money and is maintained by the ITSquad. As for any IT service, the expenses are publicly displayed on our wiki page. The people running this instance are volunteers, so please do take it into account before complaining. Do not hesitate to contribute if you appreciate what we do!

There will be a lot of politics, free software and rainbows on your timeline if you decide to join us üåàüåàüåà

Code of Conduct

v1.0, 13th June 2020

If you want to contribute to this Code of Conduct, you can contact the @ppbe account with what you would like to change. You can also join us at our monthly Pirate Lab!

This Code of Conduct aims to define some guidelines so that this Mastodon instance stays a pleasant place to be. It's not a rulebook, as things are rarely black & white anyway. We expect you to agree to this Code of Conduct and, with time, to grow trust in the moderation team who has to make it a concrete reality with your help.

First thing to know is that each user has their own moderation tools. If you have an issue with another user (from whatever instance) or with a whole other instance, you can discuss with them, mute them or block them.

It's a good idea to report the problematic behaviour only when you think they disrespect the guidelines below. The moderation team will then consider taking actions against them, and can either discuss, warn, mute or block them to prevent them from interacting with anyone from our instance (see section "How is moderation handled?").

Changes to this Code of Conduct will be announced on the @ppbe account. Users who want to discuss about the moderation can send a message to the @ppbe account. New users on our instance are following that account automatically to be informed.

Guidelines

Users from our instance and users who are interacting with us are expected to follow these basic human decency guidelines:

  1. No illegal stuff according to Belgian law
  2. No spamming, which includes using our instance for referencing
  3. Be respectful to other people. For example:
    1. No bully / no harassment
    2. Respect people's gender / pronouns
    3. Assume good faith
    4. Respect their privacy (no scraping the timelines, don't post private/direct messages public, ...)
    5. Avoid posting graphic violence and porn in public timelines without content warning.

In addition, by creating an account on our instance, we strongly recommend that you agree with these guidelines specific to our instance:

  1. Bots and community managed accounts are tolerated as long as you don't post on the public timeline (i.e. followers-only or unlisted). If you plan to publish on the public timeline, please contact us first;
    1. Pirate Party related accounts who wish to publish on the public timelines can also consider checking with one of the other instances run by Pirates
  2. Crossposting from Twitter is tolerated, but we recommend to:
    1. Avoid crossposting retweets (it's unreadable anyway),
    2. Use the followers-only mode if you post often on Twitter, so you don't flood the public timeline;
  3. Use, when possible, an alternative to publishing links to surveillance capitalism websites (like Facebook, Twitter...). Also please try to clean the URL you publish (e.g. don't use URL-shorteners, remove things like "?fbclid=") so you don't become complicit of surveillance.

Being a member of the Pirate Party or contributing to the Pirate Party does NOT absolve you to respect these guidelines.

How is moderation handled?

First, the moderation team discuss about which action should be taken regarding the problematic account. Usually, they try to contact the person in order to explain what is the problem, and to clarify if needed. Once a consensus is reached within the moderation team, they can decide whether to block or mute the account.

In the case of spamming, harassment, bullying, porn without content warning and, in some case, illegal stuff, a moderator can decide by themself to block or mute the account. However, this action will be reported to the moderation team. A discussion may follow to see if this was the right action to take.

The moderation team can decide to block or mute a whole instance when they feel the community is problematic. For example, they would mute any dedicated porn instance where users don't use content warnings. They would block instances that don't respect users privacy, or that are dedicated to bullying, fascism, etc. If they have solid information about that instance, they might react preventively (e.g. a known fascist community opens an instance).

Whenever an instance is blocked or muted, a public statement is made with the PPBe account. The list of moderated instances (blocked or muted) can be consulted at the bottom of this page.

Who is a moderator and how can I contact them?

The list of moderators of our instance is made available : on this pinned toot

What if I don't agree with the decision?

The moderation team works in good faith and tries to take the best decisions using the current guidelines. If you think we made a mistake, don't hesitate to tell us.

If eventually, you still disagree with the moderation team's decision, please remember that there are many other available Mastodon instances.

I want to help!! How can I become a moderator?

The instance members who wish to become moderator can apply to join the moderation team. This application will be considered by the moderation team.

As there must be a good vibe within the moderation team, it is up to them to decide whether to include a new member or not (co-optation).

Langues : English, Fran√ßais, Nederlands

Bienvenue

Bienvenue sur l'instance Mastodon du Parti Pirate de Belgique (PPBe).

Nous h√©bergeons cette instance afin de permettre aux personnes se d√©finissant comme Pirates d'avoir un espace agr√©able pour elles sur le Fediverse. Vous ne devez pas √™tre d'accord avec tout ce qui se trouve dans notre texte de base, mais cela vous donnera un bon aper√ßu de ce qu'√™tre Pirate signifie et quelles sont nos valeurs.

Veuillez lire notre Charte avant de nous rejoindre. Cela peut sembler s√©v√®re, mais il y a des milliers d'autres instances, et vous pouvez m√™me cr√©er votre propre instance.

Le serveur qui h√©berge l'instance est pay√© avec l'argent du PPBe et est g√©r√© par l'ITSquad. Comme pour tous nos services informatiques, les d√©penses sont publi√©es sur notre page wiki. Les personnes qui g√®rent cette instance sont toutes b√©n√©voles : merci de bien vouloir prendre cela en compte avant de vous plaindre. N'h√©sitez pas √† venir nous aider si vous appr√©ciez ce que nous faisons !

Vos flux seront peupl√©s de politique, logiciels libres, et arcs-en-ciels si vous d√©cidez de nous rejoindre üåàüåàüåà

Charte

v1.0, 13 juin 2020

Si vous d√©sirez contribuer √† cette Charte, vous pouvez contacter le compte @ppbe avec vos changements. Vous pouvez √©galement nous rencontrer lors de nos Pirate Labs mensuels!

Cette Charte a pour but de d√©finir quelques r√®gles de bonne conduite, ceci afin que cette instance Mastodon reste un endroit agr√©able. Ce n'est pas un texte de Loi, les choses n'√©tant jamais simples de toute fa√ßon. Nous attendons de vous que vous soyez d'accord avec cette Charte et, avec le temps, que votre confiance grandisse en l'√©quipe de mod√©ration qui a la t√¢che, avec votre aide, d'en faire une r√©alit√© concr√®te.

La premi√®re chose √† savoir est que chaque membre de l'instance dispose de ses propres outils de mod√©ration. Si vous avez des soucis avec une autre personne (peu importe son instance) ou avec une instance enti√®re, vous pouvez discuter avec elle, la masquer ou la bloquer.

Il est conseill√© de ne signaler le comportement probl√©matique d'une personne que si vous pensez qu'elle ne respecte pas les r√®gles ci-dessous. L'√©quipe de mod√©ration envisagera alors les actions √† prendre √† ce sujet et pourra en discuter avec la personne en question, l'avertir, la masquer ou la bloquer afin de l'emp√™cher de continuer √† interagir avec quiconque sur notre instance (voir aussi la section "Comment la mod√©ration est-elle g√©r√©e ?").

Les changements √† cette Charte seront annonc√©s via le compte @ppbe . Les personnes qui veulent discuter de la mod√©ration peuvent envoyer un message au compte @ppbe. Toute personne qui nous rejoint sur l'instance suit automatiquement ce compte, ceci afin de rester inform√©¬∑e.

R√®gles de bonne conduite

Il est attendu des personnes utilisant notre instance et de celles qui interagissent avec nous qu'elles respectent ces r√®gles de bonne conduite permettant de pr√©server une dignit√© humaine de base :

  1. Pas de contenu ill√©gal selon le droit belge
  2. Pas de spam, y compris le fait d'utiliser notre instance pour du r√©f√©rencement
  3. Soyez respecteux¬∑se envers les autres personnes. Par exemple :
    1. Pas d'intimidation/pas de harc√®lement
    2. Respectez le genre/pronoms des autres personnes
    3. Supposez la bonne foi
    4. Respectez leur vie priv√©e (pas d'extraction des donn√©es des flux (scraping), pas de publication des messages priv√©s/directs,...)
    5. √âvitez de publier des images de violence explicite et du porno dans les flux publics sans avertissement pr√©alable (content warning)

De plus, en cr√©ant un compte sur notre instance, nous conseillons fortement que vous suiviez les r√®gles suivantes, sp√©cifiques √† notre instance :

  1. Les bots et les comptes g√©r√©s par un ou des community managers sont tol√©r√©s tant que vous ne postez pas dans le flux public (par exemple en "abonn√©¬∑es uniquement" ou "non list√©"). Si vous avez l'intention de publier dans le flux public, prenez contact avec nous au pr√©alable ;
  2. Le crossposting √† partir de Twitter est tol√©r√©, mais nous conseillons de :
    1. √âvitez de crossposter des retweets (c'est illisible de toute fa√ßon) ;
    2. Utilisez le mode "abonn√©¬∑es uniquement" si vous postez souvent sur Twitter, ainsi vous ne noierez pas le flux public ;
  3. Utilisez, si possible, une alternative √† la publication de liens vers des sites web du capitalisme de surveillance (comme Facebook, Twitter...). Essayez aussi de nettoyer les URL que vous publiez (par exemple n'utilisez pas de raccourcisseurs d'URL, supprimez les choses comme "?fbclid="), ainsi vous ne devenez pas complices d'une soci√©t√© de surveillance.

√ätre membre du Parti Pirate de Belgique ou contribuer au Parti Pirate ne vous dispense PAS du respect de ces r√®gles de bonne conduite.

Comment la mod√©ration est-elle g√©r√©e ?

Tout d'abord, une discussion au sein de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration a lieu pour savoir quelle action devrait √™tre prise au sujet de la personne qui pose probl√®me. En g√©n√©ral, l'√©quipe essaie de contacter la personne afin de lui expliquer le probl√®me et de clarifier la situation si n√©cessaire. Lorsqu'un consensus est atteint au sein de l'√©quipe, celle-ci peut d√©cider de bloquer ou masquer le compte.

En cas de spam, d'intimidation, de harc√®lement, ou de porno sans avertissement pr√©alable (content warning), et dans certains cas, de contenu ill√©gal, un¬∑e mod√©rateur¬∑ice peut d√©cider seul¬∑e de bloquer ou masquer le compte. Cependant, cette action sera rapport√©e √† l'√©quipe de mod√©ration. Une discussion pourra s'ensuivre afin de savoir si c'√©tait la bonne mesure √† prendre.

L'√©quipe de mod√©ration peut d√©cider de bloquer ou masquer une instance enti√®re quand elle estime que la communaut√© pose probl√®me. Par exemple, l'√©quipe masquerait une instance d√©di√©e au porno dans laquelle les utilisateurs n'utilisent pas d'avertissement pr√©alable (content warning). L'√©quipe bloquerait des instances qui ne respectent pas la vie priv√©e des utilisateurs, ou d√©di√©es au harc√®lement/√† l'intimidation, au fascisme, etc. Si l'√©quipe a des informations cr√©dibles sur une telle instance, elle peut agir pr√©ventivement (par exemple si une communaut√© fasciste notoire ouvre une instance).

Quand une instance est bloqu√©e ou masqu√©e, une d√©claration est faite sur le compte du PPBe. La liste des instances mod√©r√©es (bloqu√©es ou masqu√©es) peut √™tre consult√©e en bas de cette page.

Qui fait partie de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration et comment entrer en contact ?

La liste des mod√©rateurs se trouvent sur ce message √©pingl√©

Et si je ne suis pas d'accord avec la d√©cision ?

L'√©quipe de mod√©ration fait de son mieux pour prendre ses d√©cisions. Si vous pensez que nous avons fait une erreur, n'h√©sitez pas √† nous le dire.

Si malgr√© tout, vous n'√™tes pas d'accord avec la d√©cision de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration, n'oubliez pas qu'il existe plein d'autres instances Mastodon

Je veux vous aider !! Comment puis-je faire partie de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration ?

Les membres de l'instance qui souhaitent rejoindre l'√©quipe peuvent √©videmment poser leur candidature qui sera √©tudi√©e par l'√©quipe de mod√©ration.

Il doit y avoir une bonne ambiance entre les diff√©rents membres de l'√©quipe de mod√©ration, d√®s lors la d√©cision d'inclure un nouveau membre revient √† l'√©quipe (co-optation).

Èï∑ÊØõË±° (Mastodon) ÊòØÂÄãÊúâË®±Â§öÁî®Êà∂ÁöÑÂàÜ‰ΩàÂºèÁ§æ‰∫§Á∂≤Ë∑Ø„ÄÇ‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®Êú¨Âú∞ÂíåË∑®Á´ôÊôÇÈñìËª∏Ë£°ÁúãÂà∞‰∏ñÁïå‰∏çÂêåÂú∞Êñπ‰∫∫ÂÄëÁöÑÂ∞çË©±ÔºåÊñ∞Áî®Êà∂Âç≥‰ΩøÊ≤íÊúâËøΩÈö®ËÄÖ‰πüÂèØ‰ª•Á´ãÂç≥ÂèÉËàáÈÄôÂÄãËàáÂà•‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÁ§æ‰∫§Á∂≤Ë∑Ø„ÄÇ

Êú¨Á´ôÁî±ÂÄã‰∫∫Âª∫Á´ãÔºåÈù†Á§æÁæ§Ë¥äÂä©Á∂≠ÊåÅÈÅã‰ΩúÔºåË´ãÊÑõÊÉú‰ΩøÁî®ÔºåÊúâÈ§òÂäõÁöÑË©±‰πüË´ãÂπ´ÂøôË¥äÂä©‰º∫ÊúçÂô®ÈñãÊîØ„ÄÇ

Funding

mastodon.org.uk does not show ads, and does not do personalized tracking. It can only exist if people help fund the instance. You can be a Patreon through patreon.com/mastodonorguk. More Patreons equals a better/faster experience and more redundancy in case of failures.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodon.org.uk; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
    4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France and/or the Netherlands, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Description:
This instance is run by @eriner@noagendasocial.com for producers of the No Agenda Show podcast by @adam@noagendasocial.com and @johncdvorak@noagendasocial.com.

It can be used by anyone 18+, but admins reserve the right to suspend or silence.

Pretty much anything related to the No Agenda Show Podcast goes, and that is a lot :-)

Parody accounts are usually silenced, not suspended. Unless you're actually funny.

Content is not guaranteed to be preserved.

You are liable for all posts you make.

You must be 18+ to use this website.

Description:
Your staff

Chitter is run by:

  • Violet, owner, design, moderation
  • codl, tech, moderation
  • bug, moderation

Etiquette pointers

Many on the fediverse are trying to make social media kinder, more personal, and more accessible. Here are some things you can do to help.

  • Use content warnings liberally.

    Commonly tagged subjects include:

    • Common phobias, and triggers (spiders, blood, gross stuff, trauma, etc)
    • Politics (often: “pol”)
    • Hot takes (opinions delivered on the spot with little thought, often worded in a provocative and generalising manner)
    • Selfies
    • Public displays of affection, affectionate subtoots (often: “pda”)
    • Food
    • Money
    • Family
    • Health
    • Mental health in particular (often: “mh”)
    • Negativity
    • Negativity about oneself in particular (often: “self neg”)

    Additionally, when a lot of people are talking about one subject, it’s polite to tag that subject, using the CW as a subject field of sorts. It is also polite to tag long posts and threads similarly.

    Content warnings are invaluable in letting people decide if and when to deal with subjects that may be harmful or exhausting to them.

    It is helpful to augment a CW, indicating if it is positive (+), negative (-), a joke, a shitpost, etc. More context is always better.

  • Strive for accessibility

    You can add a caption to images or videos you upload. This helps people with sight impairments get the context of your post. Writing a good, concise caption is an art but any caption is better than none!

    Another practice that helps is spelling hashtags composed of several words #LikeThis with capital letters, as opposed to #likethis. This helps screen-reader software read them correctly.

    It’s also polite to CW posts that won’t make any sense to screen-readers at all, like ASCII art or posts spelling out things in üí∂‚ìÇÔ∏èüÖæÔ∏èüå∂Ô∏è‚ùó

  • Avoid using a crossposter.

    These programs or services broadcast your posts from one network to another and back, usually between Twitter and a fediverse server like Chitter. They are controversial across the fediverse. A common criticism is that it feels like the person is “not really there,” reacting to things happening on another network entirely, and broadcasting Twitter culture, which many have come to the fediverse to avoid.

    If you want to use one despite this, it is polite to set it not to post remote posts as public, and even to set a CW on them indicating where the posts originated.

It is up to each one of us whether we want to follow these guidelines, but administrative action may be taken against members behaving counter to them to the point of disturbing others, and continuing to do so after being asked to change their behaviour.

Supporting Chitter

Chitter has a Patreon and a Liberapay team. Donations of any amount are greatly appreciated and will go towards keeping the servers running.

Third parties / Data location

Chitter and all of its data are hosted with Hetzner in Falkenstein, Germany.

Database backups are also stored at codl's home, in France.

DNS for the chitter.xyz domain is hosted with Route 53 from Amazon Web Services.

Chitter's status site at status.chitter.xyz is hosted with Netlify. Your browser will also contact updown.io for live status data, and S3 from Amazon Web Services for admin notices.

Keep in mind also that, depending on your post privacy settings and on who follows you, your posts and interactions may be shared with many third party instances hosted all over the world.

(Maintained by Sujitech, LLC)

Description:
Help keep Mastodon.nu going!

Welcome!

The team running this Mastodon server is committed to bring you the best possible experience of Mastodon, we do this with top quality renewable hosting, awesome Ko-Fi supporters and a dedicated administration and moderation team following sound rules. This server is hosted in Sweden and welcomes everyone following our rules and code of conduct, our users are primarily from Scandinavia.

If you have the means please consider supporting us on Ko-Fi

We expect all users of this service to adhere to our transparent rules and code of conduct.

If you represent a commercial entity and are looking for a Mastodon-server for your brand and organization, we recommend you turn to our very skilled partners and consider their Mastodon hosting solutions here.


Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodon.nu, they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:    
    1. Excessive advertising  
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions 
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:    
    1. Racism or advocation of racism   
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism 
    4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof  
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism   
    6. Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:    
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Sweden  
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:    
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.    
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.   
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted.

Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted



Donations | Donationer

This Mastodon server is hosted and moderated without annoying ads or selling any data, any donation will go a long way to keeping the lights on. There are several methods to choose from, we recommend Ko-Fi and a recurring plan since it helps us cover the recurring costs and gives us tools to give back to supporters in the form of behind the scenes content and helpful tips.

Det finns flera s√§tt att hj√§lpa oss ekonomiskt, vi rekommenderar Ko-Fi l√∂pande d√• det b√§st hj√§lper oss med v√•ra l√∂pande kostnader och ger oss en chans att ge tillbaka i form av information om vad som h√§nder bakom kulisserna och andra tips.

We post the same content on Patreon and Ko-Fi but we recommend Ko-Fi which doesn't take any fees.

Description:
Help!

For information about Mastodon and how to use it, the documentation section of joinmastodon.org is a great place to start.

To report bugs or issues with the Mastodon software, or to suggest features/improvements, go to the Mastodon projects page on GitHub.

For any questions about the mastodon.scot server send an email to trumpet@mastodon.scot or visit our helpdesk (free registration required).

We have a page showing uptime and server status at status.mastodon.scot

Donations

We run mastodon.scot as a free service because we love Mastodon, but it costs us lots of money! If you'd like to donate towards our running costs you can contribute by buying Trumpet a donut. Or lots of donuts! Trumpet loves donuts.

Moderation

Moderation of this server is carried out by our volunteer moderators on a best-efforts basis, based on interpretation of content posted to the server against our published rules.

Our server block list is based on but not identical to the Tier 0 blocklist.

Do luchd na G√†idhlig

Cuiridh sinn f√†ilte chridheil air a' Gh√†idhlig aig mastodon.scot ach nam b' fhe√†rr leat frithealaiche le barrachd G√†idhlig ann, mholamaid ailbhean.co-shaoghal.net.

Supporters

We are very grateful to dotScot Registry who have kindly provided our mastodon.scot domain name.

Follow them on mastodon.scot at @dotscotregistry!
Short: A server intended for (but not limited to) users in Scotland or who identify as Scottish.

Description:
Bonn.social ist eine Mastodon-Instanz f√ºr Bonn, Rhein-Sieg und f√ºr alle, die Bonn und die Region m√∂gen. Diese Instanz wird von Bonn.digital, einer Social-Media-Agentur aus Bonn betrieben. Hier findest Du unsere Hausregeln. ‚ù§Ô∏è

F√ºr die Registrierung w√ºnschen wir uns ein paar S√§tze, was du an Bonn und der Region magst und warum du genau auf Bonn.social aktiv sein m√∂chtest. Je eher wir erkennen, dass du das hier gelesen hast, um so eher schalten wir deinen Account frei (und sind sicher, dass du kein Spam-Bot oder Troll bist). Die Freischaltung erfolgt im Regelfall am selben Werktag, kann aber auch mal etwas l√§nger dauern. ‚è∞

Wenn Du m√∂chtest, kannst du Bonn.social finanziell unterst√ºtzen!. Das motiviert uns und hilft uns die Kosten f√ºr den Betrieb zu decken. Im besten Fall k√∂nnen wir die Angebote im Fediverse sogar ausbauen.

Wir haben versucht die Hausregeln so einfach wie m√∂glich zu halten, damit sich jeder bei uns sicher und wohlf√ºhlen kann. Deswegen behalten uns vor unser Hausrecht zu nutzen und bei Bedarf die Regeln anzupassen.

Pflichtangaben: Impressum & Datenschutzerkl√§rung

SPAMSCHUTZ-Ma√ünahme: Da in letzter Zeit massiv Spam-Accounts aufgetreten sind, die f√ºr alle richtigen Nutzer v√∂llig unn√∂tiges Zeug posten, muss vor√ºbergehend in dieser Form jede Registrierung genehmigt werden. Du musst keinen "Grund" nennen, sondern einfach nur irgend einen sinnvollen Satz (mit mitteleurop√§ischen Schriftzeichen) schreiben. Freischaltung erfolgt dann kurzfristig.

Rules ¬∂

You can find our instance rules here.

Remember to also read our TOC and privacy policy.

Resources ¬∂

We post news, user guides, moderation and admin documentation as well as financial updates on meta.chaos.social.

Imprint ¬∂

chaos.social is run by chaos.social e.V.. You can find the full legal details here in English and here in German (Impressum).

We (@leah and @rixx) are maintaining this instance on our spare time, hardware and nerves. Don't push either of those.
(If you need to reach us, please contact us via @ordnung or email.)

Description:
PLEASE READ BEFORE JOINING:

mastodon.art is a safe space instance. We have strict federation policies that protect our most vulnerable members first and foremost, which means we block any instances that host or platform hate (racism, transphobia, etc.).

Mastodon‚Ä¢ART ‚Äî an inclusive community for creators that prioritises the safety of our marginalised members. We welcome all kinds of creativity: illustration, design, 3D modelling, gamedev, photography, music, writing, performance art, ceramics, typography, sculpture, fibre arts, and more! You're welcome to make ‚Ä¢ART your main home on the Fediverse and are welcome to go 'off topic' to post your daily thoughts, witty banter, and friendly communication.

Please read ‚Ä¢ART's Code of Conduct (below) and terms of use before signing up. Click here for a list of suggested Mastodon mobile apps. We strive to make ‚Ä¢ART a safe and supportive community for everyone with a strong zero-tolerance stance on hate and bigotry. ‚Ä¢ART has no ads or algorithms to mess with chronological timelines, and doesn't track you or profit off your data. Brands wishing to make an account here must be respectful by engaging with the local community. Accounts made solely to advertise will be suspended.

‚Ä¢ART is run by members of the community and is not a company trying to profit off of your life and art with ads. As such, your support via LiberaPay, Ko-Fi or Patreon to help pay for hosting and operating costs is greatly appreciated.

Mastodon.ART General Information

Mastodon.ART (‚Ä¢ART) is an independent community-run instance and is not affiliated with the joinMastodon.org (tootsuite) organization. The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administrators and moderators of ‚Ä¢ART. They are listed here to provide you with an insight into the site and our moderation policies.

.ART's emoji credits can be found here

Moderation Team

  • @Curator (Instance Admin)
  • @TapiocaPearl
    • Ko-Fi: TapiocaPearl
  • @Eyeling
  • @L.J.Writes
    • L.J. would like to direct supporters here instead:
    > Support links for Indigenous disabled game dev & graphic designer evel: Ko-Fi, and Patreon
    > Support links for Black disabled artist Moo: Linktree and moneyyy.me
  • @Acolyte/Camilla
  • @Birdsong
  • @Aru
    • Ko-Fi: Queeroctopus
  • @ArtistMarciaX
    • LiberaPay: ArtistMarciaX

General Notice

  1. The following is not allowed on ‚Ä¢ART: Unapproved bots, username squatting, registrations of famous trademarks/names (unless proof of identity is given). To be certain that your account isn't removed due to inactivity, be sure to upload an avatar and post at least once. Accounts without avatars or any activity may be deleted to free up registration space on the instance.
  2. Do not use ‚Ä¢ART as a permanent back up or repository for your information, statuses, or media. Please keep an original copy of your work on your local machine, as Mastodon downsizes large file sizes. We cannot guarantee perpetual storage of your toots, information, or media on our servers. Please make a periodic local backup of your account to safeguard against possible data loss.
  3. You may move your account to another instance at any time by using the "Move to a different account" setting at the bottom of your Edit Profile page in your Preferences. You can also export your follow and block lists from the Import & Export page and import them into your new account to make the transition easier.
  4. You may delete your account at any time using the "Delete account" option at the bottom of the Edit Profile page. Keep in mind that federation of your statuses to other servers or search engines is beyond ‚Ä¢ART's control ‚Äî statuses, media and federated copies of your profile may remain elsewhere. Deleting your account is permanent, cannot be undone, and your username/content cannot be reinstated.
  5. We block or suspend many instances that do not adhere to ‚Ä¢ART's ToS and CoC. Also, instances are intermittently and temporarily silenced during report investigations or when other instance moderators are not monitoring their users for any of the behaviours against our ToS/CoC.
  6. Please support the community by regularly boosting and positively interacting with other members.
  7. Mastodon.ART has a LiberaPay Account, a Ko-Fi and a Patreon if you'd like to support the operation and maintenance of our artistic community.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of Mastodon.ART. These guidelines are here to provide you with an insight into the site and moderation policies because all members are guests here.

See our Cultural Appropriation Policy for handling reports of cultural appropriation in creative works on .art.

  1. All users, local and remote, are expected to adhere to the following principles:

    1. If you post someone else's work, you must credit the original artist/author, and must include some form of analysis or opinion on the work posted.

    2. Posting the same or similar content on multiple different instances (Fediverse servers) in order to spam local and/or federated timelines is not permitted.

    3. Respect other users' boundaries. Be respectful and sincerely apologize if someone informs you that a boundary has been crossed. Give people space if you accidentally push past a boundary.

    4. If you find yourself involved in a conflict and are worried about the situation escalating, contact @Curator or any of the mods listed above.

    5. Tag sensitive content such as violence/blood, graphic nudity, lewd content, and other potentially upsetting or triggering topics and hide them under a Content Warning (CW). CWs are a big part of the culture of the Fediverse, and CWing potentially upsetting content is how we keep our community and the wider Fediverse safe and supportive for everyone. (We also recommend people CW political posts, but we will not mandate it.)

  2. All users, local and remote, will be considered in the wrong if they participate in the following:

    1. Microaggressions ("not all men", white/man/cis-splaining etc.), ableism, deliberate mis-gendering

    2. Demanding education on problematic behaviour from a non-admin/moderator

    3. Skirting the lines of being a troll, or directly trolling

    4. Sharing DM screenshots or quotes from DMs or private communications publicly without all parties' permission

    5. Creating memes about someone without their permission

    6. Ranting or engaging in long rambling tangents on public timelines about a particular user without explicitly naming them (also known as "subtooting")

    7. Not tagging potentially sensitive or triggering toots

    This is not an exhaustive list, and all moderation decisions are ultimately left up to the discretion of our mod team. If any of these don't make sense, please speak with anyone on the mod team. We are more than happy to help you understand the problems with these kinds of behaviours.

  3. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

    1. Corporate advertising and spam (does not include sharing links to your art-related income sites! You are allowed and encouraged to share your shop links, commissions info, donation sites, etc.)

    2. Unapproved news bots, post bots or follow bots

    3. Untagged/non-content-warned sensitive content (violence, gore, sexually explicit, etc.)

  4. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service (please also note that .art does not allow those known for harassing marginalised people off-platform to have an account on .art):

    1. Racism, sexism, or advocation thereof

    2. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof

    3. Ableism; discrimination against those who are neurodivergent, physically disabled, or mentally ill; fatmisia

    4. Xenophobia and/or violent nationalism, or advocation thereof

  5. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

    1. Sexual depictions of minors, real or fictional

    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism

    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

  6. ‚Ä¢ART has a zero-tolerance mandate for harassment or bullying ‚Äî your account will be immediately suspended.

  7. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from using the service, degrade the performance of the service, or incite others to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.

    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called "doxing") will be considered harassment.

    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called "brigading" or "dogpiling") may be considered harassment.

  8. Please do not flood the local timeline. We define "flooding" as posting mutliple posts in quick succession to the local/public timeline (but the definition is flexible; judgements on flooding will be made in context). Flooding drowns out other users and annoys instances we federate with.
    • You can reply to the toots of others and banter back and forth as much as you want, as replies aren't shown on the local/public timelines.
    • Please avoid posting many pieces of art/media all at once. Sticking to one post per ten minutes (with one-four pictures attached) is a good baseline to follow. Please respect others' content and statuses so that they can discover other artists in the local timeline.
    • If you'd like to post long threads of many toots, consider marking the first toot as "public", and the rest in replies marked as "unlisted". This will allow users to click through the first toot to read the rest of the thread without flooding the local/public timelines.

  9. Regarding nudity/lewd/explicit content:

    It's considered good form to put nudity behind a CW as a courtesy for other users in the fediverse at large, and we encourage this practice. Recognizing the subjectivity of the matter, we consider this a recommendation rather than a hard rule where very light nudity with no genitalia showing is concerned, and we will approach any reports or complaints on a case-by-case basis.

    • Illustrative nudity and body/anatomy studies with very visible genitalia, and titillating / erotic imagery intended for mature audiences, are allowed on ‚Ä¢ART, but only if tagged appropriately (ex. #lewd, #nudity, etc.) and marked as sensitive or placed under a descriptive content warning.
      • Tags are required so people have the opportunity to filter such content from their timelines altogether.
      • Descriptive text is required so that people can make an informed decision about whether to engage with the content behind the CW/image blur.
      • If you're unsure whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning, consider the following hypothetical questions: Is it something you'd be comfortable viewing in a white collar work situation? Is it something you'd be comfortable being viewed by a minor? Would you happily show it to your parents? A no to any of these questions may require it being CWed/marked as sensitive. If you're still unsure, marking it as sensitive/CWing it is a good bet.
      • Another way to decide whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning is to remember the Three B's: If your work features any Boobs, Butts, or Bits (genitals), hide that sucker!
    • Loli or sexual content with characters of questionable age, as well as 'ageing up' characters from fandoms that are minors in order to depict them in sexual situations, is expressly prohibited ‚Äî your account will be suspended. (This includes cub porn.)
    • Nude photographs are only allowed if done in an artistic spirit ‚Äî however, it still needs to be tagged and CWed/marked as sensitive. Erotic photography, pornography, or photography that puts too much emphasis on the genitals is not allowed, even if marked "Unlisted"/"Followers Only".
    • We understand that these things are subjective, but final interpretation of these rules are up to our moderation team.

  10. Gore, vore, and blood violence must also be placed under a descriptive content warning or marked sensitive.

  11. No NFT content. No advertising NFTs, no selling NFTs, no linking to off-platform NFTs or NFT content, no images connected to NFTs.

  12. AI-generated imagery (images generated by a neural network that has been trained using other people's work without their consent) is not allowed at all. Sharing links to external articles discussing AI imagery is fine, but if the article will place a preview of an AI-generated image in your toot, please place it behind a content warning.

  13. ‚Ä¢ART's administration team reserves the right to refuse service to anyone, as well as to remove your data at any time due to inactivity of any duration (to help against future unmonitored accounts from being hacked and becoming spam bots), unethical use, or usage against ‚Ä¢ART‚Äôs CoC/ToS. This includes repeatedly skirting the lines of rules in bad faith without explicitly crossing them, or without attempting to understand and respect the spirit in which these rules were written.

Copyright

All original content is copyrighted by the artist and cannot be distributed or used without prior permission by the artist. Do not repost or disseminate our artist's original content anywhere without their express permission.

Mastodon.art cares about your privacy and doesn't monetize or profit off of your personal information or art ‚Äî your information is never for sale.

Federation Policy

  1. Federating with Mastodon.ART is not guaranteed. Links between federated instances are temporary and may change or disappear at any time.

  2. Other instances may not disseminate our users' original content or toots without credit and proper licensing.

  3. Other instances may not use automated means to analyze any derived work for publication or profit without ‚Ä¢ART's users' consent. This includes serving ads next to copyrighted content originally submitted on ‚Ä¢ART.

  4. Public toots are derived works that are protected by copyright.

  5. This instance honours noindex/nofollow and search engines are not allowed to index content from such users.

  6. Crawling the content of the instance and creating a database of its posts and content for the purposes of archiving, searching, or analyzing is prohibited. We value our users' privacy and their ability to control how their data is utilized.

  7. We will block, suspend, or silence any instance which permits any of the content or behaviour prohibited by this instance.

Hosting Information

‚Ä¢ART is fully hosted and managed by Masto.host.

An explanation of terms on our blocklist

Alt-Fedi - used when an instance federates with, associates with, and shares the culture of, instances that don't moderate (and in many cases, actively support) things like harassment, bigotry, hate speech, trolling, far-right ideologies, and generally abusive behaviour.

DNI - 'Do Not Interact'; instance hosts illegal content such as CSAM, loli, pedophilia, etc. If you want to verify these blocks, proceed with caution; use a VPN or an anonymous browsing service like Tor, and purge your cache afterwards.
Short: Mastodon.ART ‚Äî Your friendly home on the fediverse for all things creative, all on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free. NO AI OR NFTs ALLOWED.

Wait what, business?

Feel free to report users or content that should not be here.

Admins of this site reserve the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

A note on federation

This is a regularly federated instance. Keep in mind that CW/NSFW tags are necessary not to get blocked by other servers.

Be thoughtful of the people who might be reading / seeing your content on their federated timelines.

Acknowledgments

We import a number of custom emoji, for instance Mutant Standard by Dzuk (CC by-nc-sa), thank you to the creators!
Short: kinky.business is a Mastodon instance for the kink community. Safe, sane, consensual.

Description:
Welcome to The Wandering Shop!

The Wandering Shop is a Mastodon instance initially aimed at the science fiction and fantasy community, but open to all. We want our 'local' timeline to have the feel of a coffee shop at a good science fiction convention: tables full of friendly conversation on a wide variety of topics.

Supporting the Wandering Shop

Accounts on the Wandering Shop are free for all users, but the reality is a small collective of volunteers invests time and money in running this instance for all our users. Single or subscription donations are much appreciated. Our one-time or subscription donations links are here:

Flexible Donation

Monthly Subscription - Configurable

The Wandering Shop Code of Conduct

We want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone.

Unacceptable Behavior

The following behavior is not welcome anywhere in The Wandering Shop:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion
  • Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism
  • Promotion of fascist, white supremacist, or hateful ideology or symbolism, including in the choice of a user name or avatar
  • Deliberate, targeted, or persistent misgendering or deadnaming, or promotion of so-called "conversion therapy" and programs of similar intent
  • Threats of violence
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Publishing any individual's address, phone number, or other private identifying information without consent
  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Unwelcome sexual attention, including sharing sexual content with specific users without consent
  • Gratuitous sexual images, textual descriptions or behavior without a content warning
  • Non-consensual distribution of intimate material, graphic or textual, including that generated or augmented by AI programs. If sexually explicit material depicts, names, or simulates an identifiable person as its subject, it shall only be present with the full consent of the subject
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like ‚Äú*hug*‚Äù or ‚Äú*backrub*‚Äù) without consent or after a request to stop
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Continued communications with someone who's asked that you leave them alone
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment

The following behavior is not allowed on the public timeline:

  • Graphic violent or sexual content without a content warning
  • Gratuitous or excessive advertising or spam. It's fine to promote your work, but it shouldn't be the bulk of what you share
  • Fully automated/unattended crossposting or backfilling from any other instance or social media site/application.

Refusing Service:

At our discretion, the admins may ban or silence someone if we believe their presence will be disruptive or create an unpleasant or unwelcoming atmosphere, even if they have not violated the rules of the Wandering Shop. We encourage people to individually mute, block, and/or report accounts they don't want to see, but at our discretion, we may take the additional step of blocking or silencing someone instance-wide if we believe they will undermine the safe and welcoming space we're trying to maintain, wreck the vibe, or give the admins a headache.

Reporting

The current Instance Admins or Owners are:

  • Annalee
  • Johannab
  • Chris R (offby1)
  • Phildini
  • Edebill
  • Shuttermonster

The current Moderators are:

  • Eriophora
  • MikeOfMany
  • Q_Aurelius
  • Eilatan

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, you may reach out to Proprietor or to any Moderator or Admin. They'll respond as promptly as they can.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we‚Äôve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the admins may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from the wandering shop and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom we've received complaints.

Be aware that not every user or post you see in your timeline is a member registered on The Wandering Shop. Users of The Wandering Shop itself are expected to adhere to this Code of Conduct. Users from other instances are not bound by our Code of Conduct, but we may silence or suspend them (thus limiting their visibility on the shop) if they are not contributing to the welcoming and inclusive atmosphere we wish to maintain.

Credits and License

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy.
Short: Wandering.Shop aims to have the vibe of a quality coffee shop at a busy SF&F Convention. Think tables of writers, fans and interested passers-by sharing drinks and conversation on a variety of topics.

Description:
MSTDN+ is a general-purpose instance open to everyone!

Important Information

Note: NSFW content is prohibited on this instance. Alternatively you may use mstdn.party.

Status Updates: https://status.jonaharagon.net/status/fediverse

Moderation Information: see mpp.bus-hit.me

Donations

This instance is generously supported by our contributors, if you use this instance to interact with the Mastodon network please make a monthly contribution on Open Collective, all support is immensely helpful!

Legal

MSTDN+ is operated by Fediverse Communications LLC, a Minnesota (USA) company, and is hosted on servers operated in Germany and Finland. All content on this server is expected to be legal in all of these jurisdictions. If you have any copyright, trademark, legal concerns, please email us directly.

  • DMCA Complaints: dmca@fediverse.us
  • Trademark Complaints: trademark@fediverse.us
  • Abuse Complaints: abuse@fediverse.us
Short: MSTDN+ is a general-purpose Mastodon instance. Welcome to the fediverse!

Description:
About the rules

Our rules are simple, right?! We will keep this simple.

We welcome everyone on LR, regardless of race, religion or orientation. We welcome debates and conversations, but we do not tolerate personal attacks. The core belief is that we should learn from each other's differences and ideologies. First and foremost, we are all on this instance for one thing: and that is the love for GNU+Linux and Open Source/Free Software.

The people here on LR are a very friendly laid-back group, and we have lots of fun. So come join us! From admins to gamers, from photographers to athletes; we all use GNU+Linux! So bring your hobby or profession, and let's hear about it.

Even the one-eyed one-horned flying purple people eater is welcome here... As long as it uses GNU+Linux...

If you're using GNU+kFreeBSD, GNU+Hurd, BusyBox+Linux, GNU+Linux-Libre or another variant of the GNU system, you're still welcome!

Notice on registration and accounts acceptance

Due to a large amount of spam bots, all registration must be approved. Registration requests without a reason to join may be rejected due to being harder to confirm legitimacy.

Other LinuxRocks Servers

  • PeerTube: https://peertube.linuxrocks.online/
  • XMPP: xmpp://linuxrocks.online (Registration allowed)
  • Jitsi: https://jitsi.linuxrocks.online/ (Registration through XMPP bridge.linuxrocks.online)

If you'd like to donate to LR

  • https://www.patreon.com/linuxrocks
  • https://paypal.me/linuxrocksonline

Code of Conduct

  • Act like an adult.
  • If you want a bunch of legalese to tell you how you should act then maybe we are not a good fit. We are good with being the internet rebels, truly we are. We are happy and we have fun.

Linux geeks doing what Linux geeks do...

Description:
https://mastodon.sdf.org is a an open and federated instance.

It began life as a StatusNet instance in 2010 and was converted to Mastodon in May 2017.

Daily maintenance window is from 0500 - 0700 UTC. During this time the instance may be unavailable. In the event that there is extended maintenance, please see https://mastodon.sdf.org/status.html for details as well as history.

We host a daily VoIP chat/improv on (929)299-1269 0200 UTC
A few of our members are artists/DJs and have shows on https://aNONradio.net
OpenMIC is open to all daily between 0300-0600 UTC
We host a weekly Amateur Radio NET Mondays at 0000 UTC echolink TECHLINK node 9229
Are you fun and creative? Join us!

Use of the word "Mastodon" has been explicitly granted to SDF by Mastodon gGmbH
Short: "I appreciate SDF but it's a general-purpose server and the name doesn't make it obvious that it's about art." - Eugen Rochko

Description:
Terms of Service
*Subject to US laws where this node is hosted.

  • Since 2002, Ashcroft v. Free Speech Coalition established that two overbroad provisions of the CPPA of 1996 was struck down by the US Supreme Court because they abridged "the freedom to engage in a substantial amount of lawful speech."
  • The Court found the CPPA to have no support in Ferber since the CPPA prohibits speech that records no crime and creates no victims by its production.
  • Furthermore, district court Judge James E. Gritzner ruled in United States v. Handley that two parts of the PROTECT Act of 2003 criminalizing "a visual depiction of any kind, including a drawing, cartoon, sculpture, or painting" was unconstitutional.

Although there is a focus on creators of uncensored art, registration is open to everyone. It is advisable to mark NSFW uploads for sensitive content as a courtesy to others, but is required specifically for guro or explicit gore content.



Instances that block baraag.net
While we do not defederate from any remote instances, we do reject media from other servers at our discretion.

Local accounts will be silenced if found posting art that they do not own the permission to share, or for flooding the public timeline with more than 4-5 posts at a time.

Please refrain from spamming content as well as unauthorized reproduction of others' work here at baraag.net

We reserve the right to silence at our discretion accounts that post AI generated content.

The landing page illustration is by the wonderful artist, @OcaWorld

Last updated October, 2023
Goal to cover annual server cost for all of 2024:

Description:
Abajo podr√°s encontrar normas del servidor que establecen algunos criterios o pautas generales para favorecer y promover una buena comunicaci√≥n y convivencia virtual. Si alguna de ellas te parece excesiva o no est√°s de acuerdo, siempre puedes elegir otra instancia de Mastodon cuyas normas se adapten mejor a tus principios.

Acerca de la convivencia

Esta instancia est√° administrada por personas comunes que tienen trabajos, familias y otros quehaceres, por lo tanto la aprobaci√≥n de cuentas puede demorar algunas horas como mucho y es la √∫nica forma que tenemos para lograr un lugar libre de SPAM. Aqu√≠ intentamos crear un espacio de convivencia pac√≠fica, pero no sin debates o intercambio de ideas. La base es siempre el respeto hacia las dem√°s personas y el respeto por las normas del servidor. Los insultos y publicaciones agresivas hacia otras personas o grupos, ser√°n considerada discurso de odio y ser√°n penalizadas. Este NO es un espacio para venir a descargar la ira, insultar o agredir.

Registro de cuentas

La creaci√≥n de cuentas en esta instancia es por aprobaci√≥n para evitar el SPAM. Para registrarse es necesario que cada usuario complete un formulario explicando de forma clara sus razones para unirse al servidor. Las personas que deseen registrarse en esta instancia deben ser mayores de 18 a√±os. No se aceptar√°n cuentas de partidos pol√≠ticos, instituciones p√∫blicas, empresas privadas y medios de comunicaci√≥n privados. S√≠ se aceptar√°n cuentas de medios de comunicaci√≥n comunitarios o autogestionados, cooperativas, organizaciones sociales y/o civiles sin fines de lucro y/o cuyos prop√≥sitos est√©n de acuerdo con las reglas de la instancia. Actualmente recibimos muchas solicitudes de cuentas que son dif√≠ciles de diferenciar de cuentas bot y trolls. Este es un servidor comunitario donde fomentamos el uso de herramientas libres, descentralizadas y federadas. Por eso esperamos que quienes quieran sumarse a esta instancia, las valoren o prefieran. Una vez completado el formulario de registro, recibir√° una notificaci√≥n por correo. Por favor revise la carpeta de SPAM. Es recomendable registrarse con un correo independiente, o en su defecto GMail. Servidores de correo como Hotmail.com, AOL.com, Outlook.com, Yahoo.com no est√°n permitidos. Nos reservamos el derecho de admisi√≥n.

Penalizaci√≥n de cuentas

Las cuentas locales que violen alguno de los √≠tems del 1 al 4, podr√°n ser eliminadas sin previo aviso e inmediatamente y las cuentas que violen alguno de los √≠tems 5 y 6 ser√°n notificadas e instadas a remover el contenido. De no hacerlo, ser√°n eliminadas. El bloqueo o silenciamiento de cuentas ofensivas de instancias externas es responsabilidad del usuario. Las personas que administran esta instancia se reservan el derecho de intervenir en cualquier situaci√≥n que reporten o sea reportada por otros usuarios y tomar las medidas pertinentes. Los datos de las cuentas suspendidas son borrados permanentemente.

Cuentas inactivas

Las cuentas nuevas y vac√≠as que nunca hayan hecho un login, ser√°n eliminadas a los 30 d√≠as y las cuentas con m√°s de 1 a√±o de inactividad (1 a√±o desde el √∫ltimo login), ser√°n consideradas cuentas abandonadas y ser√°n eliminadas con previo aviso por email.

Federaci√≥n con otras instancias

Se suspender√°n (bloquear√°n) aquellas instancias que promuevan cualquiera de los √≠tems del 1 al 4 y ser√°n silenciadas (ocultas de las l√≠neas temporales p√∫blicas) aquellas que promuevan o permitan flood de los √≠tems 5 y 6

Acerca del servidor

Esta instancia fue inaugurada el 25 de abril de 2017 y funciona en un servidor autogestionado, esto es, que no depende de corporaciones multinacionales o empresas, es el resultado del activismo por parte de su operador y las personas que lo administran. Cuando se realizan tareas de mantenimiento, actualizaciones, etc, eventualmente puede figurar como ca√≠do durante unos minutos. Siempre dichas operaciones ser√°n anunciadas con cierto grado de anterioridad por la cuenta @admin. En los momentos donde el servidor est√© caido, podes aprovechar para leer un libro, pasar tiempo con alg√∫n ser querido o salir a caminar y respirar el aire de afuera, que ya volvemos.

Caracter√≠sticas del servidor

  • 8-core Unlocked AMD FX-8350 CPU @ 4.0GHz Black Edition
  • 32 GB RAM DDR3 @1600MHz
  • 13 TB SATA III RAID-1 crypto-LUKS redundant array
  • 800/300 Mbit/s Downlink/Uplink

Caracter√≠sticas adicionales

  • PgBouncer
  • Full-text search: ElasticSearch
  • Traductor: LibreTranslate

Consumo y gastos fijos

Este servidor insume costos fijos de electricidad, DNS, dominios y hardware que espor√°dicamente se reemplaza. Son los gastos de mantenimiento, no de mejoras o ampliaciones, es para que pueda funcionar as√≠ tal cual est√° y son valores aproximados.

  • Electricidad (~126kWh) =~ 1250 $U/mes
  • Hardware * ~ 400 $U/mes
  • Dominios * ~ 200 $U/mes
  • Servicio DNS * ~ 100 $U/mes
  • Conexi√≥n de Fibra ~ 2500 $U/mes
  • Respaldo Remoto ~ 700 $U/mes
Costo total mensual =~ 5150 $U/mes * Costos promedio mensuales

Huella de carbono por usuario activo = ~0,4 kgCO2/mes (oct 2023)

Estad√≠sticas del servidor


Colaboraci√≥n

Si te interesa el proyecto y quer√©s colaborar desinteresadamente con los costos del dominio, servidor, conexi√≥n, etc, te invitamos a colaborar por cualquiera de estos medios o por otros medios, enviar un correo a [ mastodon arroba buzon punto uy ]



Ko-fi.com

Ko-fi (perimte suscripci√≥n mensual)



Cuenta BROU:

CA (PESOS) 000687387-00005


Mercadopago Suscripci√≥n Mensual


Mercadopago QR: Donaci√≥n √önica Vez


Liberapay: Bot√≥n de donaci√≥n


PayPal: C√≥digo QR (monto definido por el usuario)
Short: Nodo de Uruguay en servidor autogestionado y libre de corporaciones. Registro abierto, sujeto a revisi√≥n. Leer las normas, completar el formulario y esperar confirmaci√≥n por mail (puede llegar a spam)

Description:
Zie ook Mastodons privacybeleid.

Je financi√´le bijdrage is welkom via Opencollective: https://opencollective.com/mastodonnl, via Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/systeemkabouter of via de bunq link: https://bunq.me/mastodonNL. Je kunt ook (gepland) overmaken naar bunq account NL32BUNQ 2079 4787 96 t.n.v. E.M. Maljaars

Mastodon.nl rules

  • no content that is racist, hate speech or otherwise deemed offensive (ultimately to be decided by the admin)
  • no things that are illegal in the Netherlands
  • no advertising and no spam
  • respect each other
  • hide sensitive texts and media when there is a reason to do so (see CW and little eye)

See also Mastodon's privacy policy.

Your financial contribution is welcomed via Opencollective: https://opencollective.com/mastodonnl, via Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/systeemkabouter or via the bunq link: https://bunq.me/mastodonNL. You can also make a (re-occurring) payment directly to bunq account NL32BUNQ 2079 4787 96

Description:
Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of lgbt.io; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
    4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children, such as loli.
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
  5. Crossposting from other services is currently permitted, with certain conditions:
    1. If crossposting from Twitter, those toots must be posted as Unlisted or Followers-only.
  6. Accounts on lgbt.io are expected to be created with the intention of interacting with the community in some way. Accounts which demonstrate being used primarily under automation or for crossposting may be suspended.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

-- Code of Conduct (obtained from mastodon.social and modified by lgbt.io) last updated on 10th December 2020.

Staff

In addition to the site's owner, @self, lgbt.io's moderation staff include:

  • @codeawayhaley
  • @porsupah
  • @eclectic
  • @mordremoth
  • @celesteh
-- If you are interested in becoming a moderator on lgbt.io, feel free to contact @self.

Support Us

Our server currently costs us ~$80 per month. You can support us on Patreon, LiberaPay or PayPal Me.

Our Supporters

+ @codeawayhaley@lgbt.io
+ Iliana W.
+ @porsupah@lgbt.io
+ Dana R.
+ @Yuki
  • @bootblackCub@lgbt.io
  • @nelson@lgbt.io
  • Thomas B.

  • @sky@lgbt.io

  • Thanks to all current and existing patrons! ❤

-- Our Supporters last updated on 9th October 2020.
