Description:
Welcome

mstdn.ca is a Mastodon instance for Canadians and is administered and hosted in Canada.

Funding

A reminder that you can support the ongoing maintenance of mstdn.ca. This instance is run by volunteers and it needs your help to continue. All proceeds go directly to server costs. You’ll find the most updated breakdown of costs here.

News

Check out the latest mstdn.ca news on our blog!

Having issues with mstdn.ca? Check our status page.

Registration eligibility

We accept registrations from any person aged 18+. Our user base is primarily based in Canada, and our moderation team members are fluent in either English, French, or both. While we do not require the use of any particular language, moderators may use automated translation services to spot-check posts and ensure adherence to our Code of Conduct.

Mastodon Server Covenant Commitment

We're committed to the Mastodon server covenant which includes the following:

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia including targeted misgendering, deadnaming, or promotion of so-called "conversion therapy".
  • Daily backups of user data.
  • At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure.
  • Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down.

You can read more information here.

Our mission

  • We have a mission to make mstdn.ca a safe and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of their gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, age, mental or physical disability, political views, and personal appearance.
  • We are resolute in protecting the mstdn.ca community from harassment and malicious content from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

The principles that guide us

Our Code of Conduct is our north star. It lays out our expected standards of conduct and behaviours that all mstdn.ca users must follow while using this platform.

  • We believe that freedom of expression is not freedom of reach. You may say whatever you want, but we reserve the right to keep you from using our platform to say it. Bullies, trolls and disruptors are not welcome in mstdn.ca and neither are users that engage in name-calling, ad-hominem attacks, or other uncivil behaviour. These activities will be actioned accordingly based on our Code of Conduct.
  • This is a voluntary community and you choose to be here. By joining and using this service, you give your tacit agreement to our Code of Conduct and agree to follow it, or risk losing your privilege to access this platform.

Code of Conduct | Our server rules

  • No toxic and hateful speech. We have a zero-tolerance policy on toxic and hateful speech. This includes attacks against anyone’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, age, disability, personal appearance, or socio-economic status. Discussions related to these topics can be difficult because we don't have similar lived experiences. If you choose to discuss these topics, empathy and kindness are a must, and if you’re not able to do so, just mute and move on.
  • No incitement of violence and no promotion of misleading or violent ideologies. You may not make specific threats of violence or physical harm, death, or disease to an individual or group of people. This includes, but is not limited to, threatening or promoting misleading information that may lead to physical harm. You also may not affiliate with organisations that — whether by their own statements or activity both on and off the platform — use or promote violence against civilians to further their causes.
  • No harassment, dogpiling, or unwanted advances. You may not continue to engage with a user who has explicitly requested that you stop. This includes consistent baiting, bad-faith gaslighting, unwanted sexual advances, etc.
  • No doxxing of other users. Unauthorised requests for or distribution of any personal information or data is not allowed. Please treat personally identifying information with respect and privacy.
  • No content illegal in Canada or copyrighted content that you don't own rights to. Illegal or copyrighted content is not allowed to be stored, posted, or discussed on mstdn.ca 
  • Sexually explicit or violent media must be marked appropriately. Posts and images with sexually explicit or violence must be flagged as sensitive and contain a content warning noting either ‘NSFW’ or ‘Violence’ when posting. Users may not have sexually explicit or violent media as a profile photo or header image. There are also types of sensitive media content that we don’t allow at all, including violent sexual conduct, gratuitous gore, and hateful imagery. We prohibit violent sexual conduct to prevent the normalization of sexual assault and non-consensual violence associated with sexual acts. We prohibit gratuitous gore content because research has shown that repeated exposure to violent content online may negatively impact an individual’s well-being.
  • No spamming. Excessive posting, boosting, advertising or mass-marketing posts will be actioned accordingly and based on intent.
  • Be yourself. Accounts intended to impersonate or parody are not permitted, and those found to be directly misrepresenting themselves as another person or entity will be actioned accordingly. General parody accounts like Beaverton or CBC Pitchbot are allowed as they are not impersonating a person or entity.

Community guidelines | Our norms

The list below is a collection of norms and behaviours that will help us build a community that we all want to participate in. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule (it’s all about intent).

  • We are not an advertising platform. If you are here only to sell your products or services, you will be removed. Occasional posts of commercial links are acceptable, but if the vast majority of a user's posts are commercial in nature, we will regard the account as a spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of spam on a case-by-case basis.
  • Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our Code of Conduct. For other posts that you find distasteful or don’t like but don’t violate the rules, use the mute, filter, or block functionality. Let the moderation team focus on the real problematic posts.
  • Be considerate. In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of:
    • Content warnings (CWs) are a kind way to let people choose to opt-out of potentially disturbing or controversial topics like spoilers or triggering/traumatic posts. CWs are also mandatory on posts containing gore, violence, or NSFW. If in doubt, err on the side of caution. 
    • Alt-text captioning of media files can help our vision-impaired community members join in on the discussion. Alt-text is needed for those who rely upon screen readers to read what's on their screen. Without this, screen readers can't describe images to those who can't see them.
    • #CamelCase use of hashtags can help screen readers read the hashtags properly.

  • Give credit where it’s due. When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Don’t be a creep. Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment.
  • Be respectful. In discussions, please remain civil, and do not insult the person you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings. Criticize ideas, not people.
  • Boosts are endorsements. You are responsible for what you boost. If you boost content that doesn't comply with our rules, moderators may take action.

Moderation Principles and Commitment

Coming soon!

Appeals process

Upon receipt of an appeal request, the instance operator, along with 2 moderators will review the appeal and make the final decision to uphold or overturn based on a vote.

Intent to make a fair and transparent appeals process 

The team

@chad - Instance Administrator | he/him/il | EN
@codebam - System Administrator | they/them | EN
@rcjcarr - Moderator | he/him | EN

Bot account policy

  • The account must have checked the profile option "This is a bot account".
  • Posts from the bot account must be "unlisted".
  • Must enable "Automated post deletion" with a maximum age threshold of one month, with the exception of pinned posts and direct messages. Exceptions based on interactions are not eligible.

Bots that do not follow the above policy will be suspended.

Truth and reconciliation

The mstdn.ca team acknowledges that the areas where we work, live, and play, span across many Territories and Treaty areas and we are exceedingly grateful for the traditional Knowledge Keepers and Elders who are with us today, those who have gone before us, and the youth that inspire us. 

We recognize the land and the benefits it provides all of us, as an act of Reconciliation, and as recommended by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission’s (TRC) 94 Calls to Action, and give gratitude to those whose territory we reside on, work on or are visiting.

We are committed to continuing to learn, evolve and grow to ensure we are aligned with Indigenous-led Reconciliation frameworks.

What is Mastodon?

Open-source social networking

Follow friends and discover new ones among more than 4.5M people. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, and video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

Mastodon isn’t just a website, it is a federation—think Star Trek. Thousands of independent communities running Mastodon form a coherent network, where while every planet is different, being part of one is being part of the whole.

Mastodon comes with effective anti-abuse tools to help protect yourself. Thanks to the network's spread out and independent nature there are more moderators who you can approach for personal help and servers with strict codes of conduct.

Convenient sharing

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can edit the post or even delete & redraft it for quick corrections.

Mastodon for all

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume the content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic — you decide who you want to see!

Questions? Comments?

Email hello@mstdn.ca or call/text +1 (780) 800-7298.

Credits

Hosted by DigitalOcean in their TOR1 data centre located on Treaty 13 land at 45 Parliament Street, Toronto, ON, M5A 2Y5. Media is replicated to caching endpoints around the world.
Short: A community for Canadians, First Nations, Metis, and Inuit Peoples of the great white north.

Description:
English

Instance Rules

A few rules we adhere to on this instance:

  1. Treat others respectfully: Refrain from any form of insult, bullying or discrimination, including but not limited to racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, anti-Semitic and misogynistic remarks or actions toward others.
  2. Use an appropriate tone: Use a respectful and friendly tone, even if you disagree with someone.
  3. Respect the privacy of others: Do not share personal information without explicit permission and respect the privacy rights of others.
  4. Compliance with applicable law: Do not post illegal content.
  5. Avoid misinformation: Do not share false or misleading information.
  6. No spam posts: Refrain from posting unsolicited advertisements or similar content that does not fit the community.
  7. Mark sensitive content (CW): Please mark any content that may contain common triggers, is sexually explicit or violent as sensitive (CW) to ensure the safety of other members. Note: Accounts that exclusively post such content may be limited or banned.
  8. You must be older than 16 years: According to European law, you must be at least 16 years old to use this instance.

We also follow the Mastodon Server Covenant

Important!

Notwithstanding these rules, the moderation reserves the right to delete posts or block an account for any reason. This also includes content on other websites (linked Twitter/blog).

If you see any violations of the rules or are not sure if, use the report function, or send us an email.

Help is Available

If you or a loved one is facing a crisis, remember that you are not alone. There are people ready to help you through this difficult time.

For a comprehensive list of helplines in different countries, addressing a range of issues, visit https://findahelpline.com/

Support

Help us fund the servers for this instance by making a donation through the Open Collective. Your financial support is welcome, but not a requirement to use this instance.

Staff

Description:
Normas de la Instancia TKZ.One

¬°Bienvenido(a) a TKZ.One! Somos una instancia de Mastodon en Espa√±ol enfocada en el mundo Gaming, Geek y de hobbies, incluyendo, pero no limitados al anime, manga, videojuegos, c√≥mics, tecnolog√≠a, cine y series, literatura, viajes, gastronom√≠a... Valoramos la diversidad de contenido y la de los usuarios, creando as√≠ un espacio seguro para cualquier colectivo donde poder compartir estos temas sea cual sea tu identidad de genero, sexo, raza, orientaci√≥n sexual.

Nuestra prioridad es centrarnos en mantener una comunidad unida y con buen rollo donde compartir estos temas desde el respeto y manteniendo un tono pol√≠tico bajo o nulo en medida de lo posible.

A continuaci√≥n, te presentamos nuestras normas en detalle para garantizar un ambiente positivo, agradable e inclusivo para todos los usuarios:

Contenido Tem√°tico

  • La mayor√≠a del contenido en tu perfil debe estar relacionado con la tem√°tica de la instancia (anime, manga, gaming, tecnolog√≠a, cine, series, etc.).
  • Si bien no censuramos otros tipos de contenidos, es importante que la esencia de tu perfil est√© alineada con nuestros intereses principales.

Convivencia y Respeto:

  • Fomentamos un ambiente amable, cordial y de buen rollo entre todos los usuarios.
  • No toleramos comportamientos que generen mal estar o rompan las normas b√°sicas de convivencia.
  • Cualquier cuenta que perturbe la armon√≠a de la comunidad podr√≠a ser invitada a abandonar la instancia o ser suspendida.
  • Esto incluye pero no se limita al racismo, sexismo, homofobia y transfobia.

Idioma Oficial:

  • El uso del espa√±ol es obligatorio en esta instancia, incluyendo los dem√°s idiomas usados en Espa√±a como el catal√°n, valenciano, gallego, euskera, entre otros.
  • Se puede escribir en otros idiomas pero la cuenta debe ir enfocada mayoritariamente a estos idiomas.
  • Se permite el uso del lenguaje inclusivo a gusto de cada uno.

Contenido Sensible:

  • Est√° prohibida la publicaci√≥n de pornograf√≠a infantil, lolicon, as√≠ como cualquier contenido que incite a la violencia o promueva ideolog√≠as violentas.
  • No se permite contenido ilegal bajo las leyes espa√±olas en nuestra instancia ni promover dicho contenido.

Responsabilidad Personal:

  • Cada usuario es responsable de sus comentarios y publicaciones. Este servidor de Mastodon no se hace responsable de las opiniones individuales de los usuarios.

Ideologias y Activismo Pol√≠tico:

  • No permitimos cuentas centradas en el activismo reivindicativo ni en la pol√≠tica institucional.
  • Aunque est√° permitido abordar temas pol√≠ticos, sociales y econ√≥micos, es importante que la cuenta no tenga una finalidad propagand√≠stica ni haya sido creada con fines de activismo reivindicativo, social o pol√≠tico. Adem√°s, los temas tratados deben relacionarse con la tem√°tica principal de la instancia y ser abordados dentro del contexto apropiado.
  • Las cuentas que promuevan el nazismo, intolerancia racial, antisemitismo, racismo o supremacia est√°n estrictamente prohibidas.

Respeto a la Dignidad:

  • Queda terminantemente prohibido cualquier comportamiento que atente contra la dignidad de las personas debido a su raza, sexo, orientaci√≥n sexual, identidad de g√©nero, situaci√≥n personal o riesgo de exclusi√≥n social.
  • Las faltas de respetos, insultos reiterados, o cualquier otro comportamiento que atente contra el bienestar de la comunidad est√° prohibido y es amonestable. En caso de reiteraci√≥n se puede suspender al usuario.

Veracidad Informativa:

  • Evita compartir informaci√≥n falsa de manera intencionada. No contribuyas a la difusi√≥n de bulos.
  • Si has compartido algo y se ha verificado ser un bulo, por favor, ret√≠ralo lo antes posible.

Contenido para Adultos:

  • El contenido para adultos, como desnudos exceptuando pornograf√≠a expl√≠cita, violencia y gore, solo se permite en forma de creaciones art√≠sticas de autor√≠a propia (FanArts, ilustraciones, dibujos, etc.), siempre que se relacionen con nuestra tem√°tica y se utilice la etiqueta CW.
  • El equipo de moderaci√≥n tendr√° siempre la √∫ltima palabra para valorar este contenido.

Cuentas Fantasma y Comportamiento Abusivo:

  • No permitimos cuentas que solo utilicen el crossposting entre redes sociales sin interactuar con la comunidad.
  • Nos reservamos el derecho de suspender cuentas que consideremos que abusan de esta pr√°ctica.

Prohibici√≥n de Spam y Actividades Da√±inas:

  • Las cuentas de SPAM, phishing y las centradas en la promoci√≥n de criptoactivos de dudoso origen o actividades econ√≥micas que puedan ser perjudiciales para los miembros de la comunidad est√°n estrictamente prohibidas.

Es obligatorio leer y aceptar estas normas al registrarte en nuestra instancia.

Recuerda que si tienes alguna duda o piensas que hay algo incorrecto o que pueda llevar a errores, puedes contactar directamente con nosotros. La comunidad la hacemos entre todos. ¬°Esperamos que disfrutes de tu estancia en TKZ.One y contribuyas a crear un espacio seguro para todos los frikis doonde compartir nuestros temas favoritos!

If you're not spanish and you can't understand the rules that doesn't mean you don't have to respect and accomplish them.

SPENDEN & TRANSPARENZ

Wir stellen die Angebote der Fediverse Foundation werbe- und trackingfrei ehrenamtlich in unserer Freizeit zur Verf√ºgung. Wir bieten unsere Services f√ºr alle Nutzer kostenlos an. Wenn ihr uns unterst√ºtzen m√∂chtet, dann k√∂nnt ihr das in Form einer freiwilligen Spende tun. Mit dem Geld werden prim√§r Domain-, Server-, Strom- und Hardwarekosten gedeckt.

Vielen Dank f√ºr Eure Unterst√ºtzung!

DAS REGELWERK

Das Regelwerk findet ihr etwas weiter unten im Reiter "Serverregeln" oder direkt in unserer Wiki im Bereich der Serverregeln unserer Instanzen (de/en).

Altersgrenze / Minderj√§hrige

Um unsere Dienste verwenden zu d√ºrfen, musst du das 14. Lebensjahr vollendet haben. Siehe dazu auch das Datenschutz-Anpassungsgesetz 2018.

Keine AI / ML Regelung

Es ist untersagt, Daten oder Inhalte von den unten angef√ºhrten Instanzen f√ºr das Training oder die Entwicklung von Modellen der k√ºnstlichen Intelligenz oder des maschinellen Lernens zu verwenden, ohne die ausdr√ºckliche Zustimmung des Urheberrechtsinhabers einzuholen. Jede unbefugte Nutzung von Daten oder Inhalten f√ºr KI/ML-Zwecke wird als Versto√ü gegen das Urheberrecht betrachtet und kann rechtliche Schritte nach sich ziehen.

Moderierte Sprachen

Unsere Moderatoren versuchen, unabh√§ngig von politischer Ausrichtung, alle Posts gleichwertig und objektiv entlang unserer Serverregeln zu moderieren. Nat√ºrlich ist das nur f√ºr Sprachen m√∂glich, die wir auch verstehen - daher sind als Sprachen auf unseren Instanzen nur Deutsch und Englisch m√∂glich. Wir behalten uns das Einschr√§nken oder L√∂schen von Nachrichten in anderen Sprachen im Zweifel vor.

DATENSCHUTZ

Unsere Offenlegung bez√ºglich Datenschutz entnehmt bitte ebenfalls unserer Wiki dem Bereich Datenschutzerkl√§rung (de/en).

F√∂deration mit Meta (Facebook) / Instagram

Unsere Server haben die F√∂deration mit threads.net pr√§ventiv blockiert. Diese Regel k√∂nnte in Zukunft ge√§ndert werden, wenn wir wissen, wie threads.net die F√∂deration √ºber ActivityPub implementiert und wie sie auf Berichte aus dem Fediverse reagieren.

TECHNISCHE UND ORGANISATORISCHE MASSNAHMEN

Die Angebote der Fediverse Foundation werden als gemeinn√ºtziger Verein und in unserer Freizeit betrieben. Wir erzielen keinerlei Einnahmen mit dem Angebot und finanzieren uns aus Spenden und Eigenmitteln. Wir behalten uns vor, den Dienst jederzeit aus rechtlichen, technischen oder finanziellen Gr√ºnden einzuschr√§nken oder zu beenden.

Ansonsten gilt folgendes:

  • Dieser Server h√§lt sich an die Vereinbarungen f√ºr Mastodon Serverbetreiber: Server Covenant
  • Unsere technischen und organisatorischen Ma√ünahmen k√∂nnt ihr ebenso in unserer Wiki im Bereich f√ºr technische und organisatorische Ma√ünahmen (de/en) nachlesen.

Comme en tout endroit civilis√©, les r√®gles de courtoisies et d'√©ducations √©l√©mentaires s'appliquent ici. Les r√®gles seront amen√©es √† √©voluer si n√©cessaire.

Mod√©ration

Nous mod√©rons activement h4.io afin d'√™tre un endroit accueillant. Chaque personne doit pouvoir se sentir accueillie et en s√©curit√© ici, et nous ferons tout pour que √ßa reste le cas.

Tout comportement allant √† l'encontre de ces valeurs, d√©nigrant des minorit√©s, tenant des propos racistes, fascistes, homophobes, sexistes (etc) o√π ne respectant pas nos r√®gles sera sanctionn√©.

Vous disposez de la possibilit√© de migrer votre compte sur une autre instance si vous n'√™tes pas en phase avec cela.

Cross-postage

Nous avons d√©cid√© de bloquer le cross-postage, aka le fait de publier sur Twitter et que cela soit √©galement publi√© sur notre instance Mastodon.

La raison est que bien souvent, les comptes utilisant ce proc√©d√© finissent par ne poster que sur Twitter, ne lisent pas les r√©ponses et n'ont aucune interactions avec le reste de l'instance.

Informations techniques

Nous sommes h√©berg√©s en France, chez Scaleway, sur diff√©rentes machines virtuelles :

  • C≈ìur de Mastodon : instance DEV-L (8 Go de Ram / 4 vCPUs X86 64bit)
  • Base de donn√©e : instance PostgreSQL manag√©e
  • Stockage : Object Storage de Scaleway
  • Cloudflare en tant que CDN
  • Mailgun pour l'envoie des emails

Nous partageons ces informations car elles ne pr√©sentent pas un risque de s√©curit√© particulier, parce que nous souhaitons √™tre transparent avec l'infrastructure g√©rant vos donn√©es mais aussi pour renseigner et aider les administrateurs d'instances cherchant √† s'informer sur ce sujet.

Enfin, nous maintenons gratuitement cette instance Mastodon qui est une porte d'entr√©e sur le Fediverse, cependant nous vous recommandons d'exporter r√©guli√®rement vos donn√©es. Nous sommes -comme tout le monde, comme notre h√©bergeur- sujet √† des soucis techniques exceptionnels, nous ne pourrons √™tre tenu responsables en cas d'indisponibilit√© ou perte de donn√©es.

Description:
Bolha.us About

Read in your browser here.

Leia esse about em seu browser aqui.

English

This is a Brazilian instance hosted in Canada, initially created for those who speak Portuguese and English. If you want to join our instance, but you don't speak Portuguese or English, you're also welcome, and you can use our universal libretranslator :)

This place was built by people of the Brazilian TECH community that believes we can change our Country; we seek to live in a fair country, without misery, racism, corruption, homophobia, hunger, inequality, a place to include, a humanized space, with human rights for all humans. These are our values.

Here we like to talk about IaC, CI/CD, Dev, Ops, Network, Platforms, Software Engineering, DevOps, GitOps, Containers, Kubernetes, Cloud, and Cloud Native.

This is a Fediverse corner for Geeks, Nerds, Otakus, and tech enthusiasts. Besides the TECH topics, we also like to talk about life, the universe, and everything else.

This is a moderated instance. Our space intent to include everyone, especially minority groups. We are a feminist, anti-fascist, anti-nazi, anti-racist, anti-colonialist community. We are pro-science and pro-LGBTQIA+ and will try our best to be a warm, safe and inclusive space.

Our core values are democracy, social inclusion, digital inclusion, open standards, and the use of open-source software.

We love open-source and prefer to use it, but we also talk about other kinds of tech with different licenses and scopes.

To keep this place safe and healthy, all users should follow our rules, code of conduct, and anti-harassment policy.

Our moderation will work to keep this space safe. Depending on the severity, if they found any post offending our rules, the author could be silenced or suspended.

Visit our site Bolha.io to find more about our community.

Visit our status site status.bolha.us to find more about our services.

Need help to understand what's Mastodon? Then visit mastodon.help to find more about it.

We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Do you need help? Send a message to help@bolha.us or talk with us at matrix on the channel #help:bolha.chat

Fundamental server rules

  • Treat everyone with respect.
  • Treat everyone with kindness.
  • Treat everyone politely.
  • Be excellent to each other.
  • Don't break the laws (Canadian and Brazilian)
  • Don't share protected material, especially software, music, books, photos and videos
  • No fascism.
  • No nazism.
  • No white supremacy.
  • No racism.
  • No colonialism.
  • No nationalism.
  • No religious extremism.
  • No xenophobia.
  • No homophobia.
  • No transphobia.
  • No homophobia.
  • No capacitism.
  • No harrassament.
  • No violence or hate speech.
  • No sexism or misogyny.
  • No LGTBQIA+ Disrespect, this is a safe place for everyone.
  • No Neurodivergent (ADHD, Autism, etc.) Disrespect, this is a safe place for everyone.
  • No SPAM or Flood
  • Please use the tag #aiart and add the tool name in another tag, like #midjourney, when posting IA generated images. In the ALT use the prompt.
  • No explicit sexual content without content warning (CW), use the tag #NSFW, always
  • No nudes that are not of your own body, use content warnings (CW) and tag #NSFW, always
  • If the content is not safe for work, always use sensitive for images, content warning (CW), and the tag #NSFW

Follow our Rules and Conduct Code to be part of our collective or be suspended.

Conte√∫do e Leis

Responsabilidade civil

C√≥digo de Conduta

Respeito √†s leis brasileiras

N√£o ser√° permitido o uso desta inst√¢ncia para cometer ou incitar crime, de acordo com a constitui√ß√£o e as leis brasileiras.

O uso da inst√¢ncia para cometimento de crime, al√©m do banimento, ocasionar√° denuncia para as autoridades competentes, com oferecimento de toda evid√™ncia dispon√≠vel nos servidores desta inst√¢ncia.

Comportamentos inadmiss√≠veis em nossa inst√¢ncia

Contas que engajarem nos seguintes padr√µes de comportamento ser√£o suspensas ou banidas sem recurso.

Publica√ß√£o de conte√∫do ilegal, ou nocivos ainda que sem defini√ß√£o legal concreta, como:

  • Conte√∫do que fetichiza menores de idade (i.e. lolicon, shotacon).

  • Publica√ß√£o, reprodu√ß√£o ou refer√™ncias para material protegido como √°udio, v√≠deo, imagens ou software. (pirataria)

Discurso de √≥dio ou inflamat√≥rio, como:

  • Comportamentos e discursos discriminat√≥rios de qualquer tipo, incluindo e n√£o limitando, discursos racistas, sexistas, mis√≥ginos, homof√≥bicos, transf√≥bicos, capacitistas, xenof√≥bicos, islamof√≥bicos, gordof√≥bicos.

  • Apologia a governos totalit√°rios.
  • Xenofobia ou nacionalismo extremista.
  • Promover desinforma√ß√£o.
  • Questionar a legitimidade do processo eleitoral Brasileiro.
  • Questionar a autoridade ou promover a desarmonia entre os tr√™s poderes constitu√≠dos.
  • Pedir golpe militar no Brasil.

Esse tipo de discurso √© infra√ß√£o grave com suspens√£o direta e imediata.

Charlatanismo ou pr√°tica ilegal de profiss√µes de sa√∫de:

  • Indica√ß√£o de tratamentos por pessoas n√£o qualificadas ou fora dos limites da regula√ß√£o da profiss√£o
  • Promessa de cura ou indica√ß√£o tratamento por meios n√£o qualificados como religi√£o ou simpatia
  • Indica√ß√£o de medica√ß√£o controlada ou incita√ß√£o a auto-medica√ß√£o
  • Qualquer outro tipo de discurso que possa colocar em risco a sa√∫de ou ao coletivo da sociedade

Publica√ß√£o, ou amea√ßa de publica√ß√£o de conte√∫do privado, como:

  • Informa√ß√µes pessoais identific√°veis (pr√°tica conhecida como "doxing").
  • Conversas privadas, como mensagens privadas ou diretas, sem o consentimento da outra parte, sem que haja como finalidade den√∫ncia criminal ou garantia de direito.

Atitudes invasivas ou intimidadoras, como:

  • Fazer coment√°rios ou perguntas invasivos (tais como "qual √© o seu nome de registro?" ou insistir em saber a localiza√ß√£o de determinada pessoa).
  • Insistir em continuar uma conversa ap√≥s a outra parte expressamente pedir para que ela se encerre (ass√©dio).
  • Aten√ß√£o sexual indesejada. Isso inclui piadas ou coment√°rios sexuais; e avan√ßos sexuais indesejados.
  • Intimida√ß√£o deliberada, persegui√ß√£o (stalking).

Falsidade ideol√≥gica, como:

Criar contas para se passar por outras pessoas, celebridades ou marcas. Contas par√≥dia ou contas de f√£ s√£o permitidas mas precisam estar devidamente sinalizadas.

Comportamentos desencorajados

Os comportamentos a seguir s√£o desencorajados. A reincid√™ncia, ap√≥s advert√™ncia, tamb√©m ocasionar√° em suspens√£o.

  • Flood (postar repetidamente ou pequenas mensagens sem intervalo) nas timelines p√∫blicas (local e federada).
  • Spam (mensagens indesejadas ou n√£o requisitadas).
  • Venda ou promo√ß√£o de produtos ou cursos na timeline.

Pol√≠tica de aviso de conte√∫do

O uso de aviso de conte√∫do √© obrigat√≥rio em postagens que:

  • Mencionam assuntos traum√°ticos (por exemplo: estupro, viol√™ncia). Contenham enredo de s√©ries, jogos e filmes (por exemplo: 'Spoilers de Star Wars Andor S01E01').
  • Contenham nudez, conte√∫do sexual e imagens de viol√™ncia (mesmo que em representa√ß√µes art√≠sticas).
  • Descri√ß√µes expl√≠citas de sexo ou conte√∫do sexual em postagens p√∫blicas.
  • V√≠deos com movimentos r√°pidos e luzes intermitentes.

O uso de aviso de conte√∫do n√£o √© obrigat√≥rio, mas sugerido, em postagens envolvendo os seguintes assuntos ou imagens relacionadas:

  • Comida
  • Futebol
  • Religi√£o
  • √Ålcool, cigarro e outras drogas
  • Aranhas, r√©pteis e outras coisas que podem causar desconforto em pessoas que possuem fobias
  • Retratos de si (selfies), principalmente aquelas com contato ocular direto, que podem ser gatilho para algumas pessoas neurodivergentes

Discuss√µes, ideias, debates e an√°lises pol√≠ticas construtivas, progressistas, com coer√™ncia e conte√∫do s√£o bem vindas sempre. Aqui tamb√©m √© um espa√ßo de luta!

Uso de Crossposters

Crossposters s√£o ferramentas utilizadas para postar a partir de outras redes (como Twitter ou Tumblr) para o Mastodon ou do Mastodon para elas. O uso destas ferramentas √© permitido, mas temos algumas recomenda√ß√µes:

  • Retweet, quotes (retweets com coment√°rios) ou reblogs n√£o podem ser postados com privacidade p√∫blica.
  • Posts vindos de outras redes, como o Twitter, ainda precisam obedecer √† outras regras desse c√≥digo, tais como avisos de conte√∫do.
  • Se possivel use tags para filtar oq voc√™ deseja enviar para twitter ou mastodon.

Uso de Bots

Se quiser subir bots use instancias feitas para essa finalidade.

Outras Informa√ß√µes

Como reportar uma viola√ß√£o do c√≥digo de conduta

O Mastodon possui ferramentas internas de den√∫ncia. Qualquer post ou perfil que voc√™ acredite que esteja em viola√ß√£o dessas regras pode ser denunciado utilizando a ferramenta interna do Mastodon e ele ser√° enviado aos moderadores.

Caso a sua den√∫ncia seja relativa a um dos moderadores, voc√™ pode reportar a viola√ß√£o atrav√©s de mensagem direta √† um dos outros moderadores.

Voc√™ pode fazer uma den√∫ncia mesmo que a sua situa√ß√£o n√£o seja diretamente coberta por essas regras, caso a situa√ß√£o lhe cause desconforto. A modera√ß√£o ir√° avaliar cada situa√ß√£o individualmente.

Respondemos de maneira privada √† todas as den√∫ncias que recebemos, fazendo um esfor√ßo para que a primeira resposta seja dada nas primeiras 24 horas.

Caso queira, pode entrar em contato pelos e-mails abaixo

Entre em contato caso precise de ajuda:

  • denuncia at bolha.us
  • abuse at bolha.us
  • violacao at bolha.us

Esses e-mails s√£o aliases para uma mesma conta.

Entenda os n√≠veis de privacidade

No Mastodon cada status pode ser postado em quatro diferentes configura√ß√µes de audi√™ncia. √â importante ter isso em mente porque certas regras s√≥ se aplicam a algumas configura√ß√µes e n√£o a outras:

  • P√öBLICA: A publica√ß√£o aparece no feed dos seus seguidores, na p√°gina p√∫blica do seu perfil, na busca por hashtags, no feed local (compartilhado pelos demais membros da inst√¢ncia) e no feed federado (compartilhado por todas as inst√¢ncias federadas).
  • N√ÉO LISTADA: A publica√ß√£o aparece no feed dos seus seguidores e na p√°gina p√∫blica do seu perfil. Por√©m, n√£o √© listada (n√£o aparece) em buscas por hashtags, nem no feed local, nem no feed federado.
  • SOMENTE SEGUIDORES: A publica√ß√£o aparece apenas no feed dos seus seguidores. Por√©m, n√£o aparece na p√°gina p√∫blica do seu perfil, nem em buscas por hashtags, nem no feed local, nem no feed federado.
  • MENSAGEM DIRETA: A publica√ß√£o aparece apenas no feed das pessoas marcadas por voc√™.

ATEN√á√ÉO: Mensagens diretas n√£o devem ser confundidas com mensagens privadas, pois o Mastodon n√£o √© uma ferramenta projetada para a troca segura de mensagens criptografadas de ponta a ponta.

Os moderadores da inst√¢ncia podem acessar todas as mensagens publicadas a qualquer momento e o far√£o em casos de den√∫ncias. Leia a nossa pol√≠tica sobre mensagens diretas mais adiante.

Sobre mensagens diretas

Mensagens diretas n√£o s√£o mensagens privadas.

O Mastodon n√£o √© uma ferramenta projetada para a troca segura de mensagens criptografadas de ponta a ponta. Tenha em mente que os moderadores podem acessar a qualquer momento todas as mensagens publicadas na inst√¢ncia, inclusive as mensagens com audi√™ncia reduzida (mensagens diretas), e o far√£o sempre que houver alguma den√∫ncia.

Os moderadores da Bolha pactuam dois compromissos com a comunidade em rela√ß√£o √†s mensagens com audi√™ncia reduzida (mensagens diretas):

Os moderadores da Bolha acessar√£o o conte√∫do de mensagens diretas sempre que e exclusivamente nos casos em que algum dos usu√°rios citados em uma mensagem direta denuncie a publica√ß√£o ou seu autor.

Os moderadores da Bolha n√£o acessar√£o o conte√∫do de mensagens diretas em nenhum outro caso, sob pena desta a√ß√£o ser analisada pelos demais moderadores podendo ser punidos com suspens√£o ou at√© banimento por quebra de confian√ßa.

N√£o recomendamos que voc√™ utilize o Mastodon para transmitir informa√ß√µes sens√≠veis ou sigilosas, esse n√£o √© um espa√ßo para isso.

Caso voc√™ tenha a necessidade de trocar mensagens com privacidade e seguran√ßa, recomendamos o uso de ferramentas e de protocolos abertos que tenham sido desenvolvidas com software livre e que sigam o estado da arte dos protocolos criptogr√°ficos p√∫blicos. Tais como o mensageiro instant√¢neo Signal ou o utilit√°rio de criptografia OpenPGP.

Inst√¢ncias amigas

Agradecemos aos times e comunidades das inst√¢ncias

  • ursal.zone e
  • masto.donte.com.br

Es especial por nos ajudarem muito com dicas para configurar a inst√¢ncia, bem como, nos acolhendo e ensinando sobre a cultura do mastodon e do fediverso.

Nosso muito obrigado tamb√©m por permitirem que a bolha use partes do c√≥digo de conduta, regras e dicas de suas inst√¢ncias, nos inspiramos muito em voc√™s :)

Description:
eupolicy.social is a privately run Mastodon instance for the EU policy bubble. It is open to users on a voluntary basis. Our team of admins and moderators currently consists of:

  • @Gerben@eupolicy.social
  • @ilumium@eupolicy.social
  • @PaulNemitz@eupolicy.social
  • @RRiemann@chaos.social

This instance is funded through voluntary donations. Please help us pay the server bills by donating via Liberapay. Thank you for your support!

Terms of service

Use of eupolicy.social is subject to a set of server rules designed to enable a friendly and open atmosphere for all its users. If you wish to join this instance, you are expected to act without malice and in good faith. Doing otherwise may lead to removal from the service, independent of whether a user violates any of the server rules outlined below.

Our moderators may remove accounts who spam the server or are suspected of camping just to reserve an account name.

Content on eupolicy.social must not be used for the purposes of machine learning or other research purposes without the explicit consent of the users concerned.

Content on eupolicy.social beyond this page must not be archived or indexed wholesale by automated means by any user or service except for what is necessary for the normal functioning of other ActivityPub-powered instances that eupolicy.social federates with. Active users may export their following lists and posts through the export provided on their settings page or the API.

Attribution

These terms as well as our privacy policy are free to be adapted and remixed under the CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International) license.
Short: This is a Mastodon instance for the EU policy bubble. We aim to be a friendly and respectful discussion space for people working in EU policy and to contribute to the growth of the Fediverse.
topic: EUpolicy.social - A Mastodon server for the EU bubble

  • Bewerbungen f√ºr regional beschr√§nkte Angebote bezogen auf Regionen jenseits des Gro√üraums Berlin/Brandenburg
  • Bewerbung und Verlinkung auf externe Angebote einzig zum Zweck der Suchmaschinenoptimierungen (SEO) jener Angebote
  • die Bewerbung und/oder die Verlinkung von externen Angeboten, welche Aktivit√§ten und Inhalte anbieten, die gegen diese Regeln versto√üen

Wir sch√§tzen die Meinungsfreiheit. Doch diese Instanz ist kein √∂ffentlicher Raum. Es steht jedem frei, selbst Serversysteme zu betreiben, um Beitr√§ge nach eigenen Regeln zum Mastodon-Fediverse beizutragen.

berlin.social is a decentralized alternative to the centrally managed Twitter.

This service is hosted on servers solely located in the EU and it is provided by Berlin-based cepharum GmbH based on its General Terms and Conditions for Hosting Services. The specific data protection terms for this service as well as the data protection terms of cepharum GmbH apply. As a user of this offer, you become a customer of cepharum GmbH within the meaning of the aforementioned terms and conditions.

The offer can be used free of charge. cepharum GmbH is free to adjust the offer at any time and in any way or to discontinue it completely. There is no right to continue the service without a separate written agreement with cepharum GmbH. These freedoms are limited by the following restrictions:

  1. The offer remains free of charge for users.
  2. An abandonment of the offer will be announced at least 3 months in advance, so that users have the possibility to transfer their account to another server.

cepharum GmbH does not collect any usage data of this instance to finance this offer. All costs are booked internally as advertising costs and cross-subsidized from cepharum GmbH funds.

As the operator of the offer, cepharum GmbH reserves the right to moderate, block or delete content and user accounts if they violate German law or the terms and conditions mentioned above. This includes, but is not limited to, the publication of posts or user profile pages with the following content:

  • discriminatory, insulting or otherwise derogatory statements
  • hostility against dissidents or against religions or their followers
  • call for or reproduction of criminal offences
  • pornographic content or the mediation of sexual contacts
  • mass contributions for commercial or political advertising purposes
  • promotions for regionally restricted offers related to regions beyond the greater Berlin/Brandenburg area
  • promotion of and linking to external content for the sole purpose of search engine optimization (SEO)
  • advertising and/or linking to external offers that provide activities and content that violate these rules.

We respect the freedom of speech. But this instance is not a public space. Everyone is free to operate servers themselves in order to contribute to the Mastodon-Fediverse based on their own rules.
Short: Alles rund um, √ºber, aus & f√ºr Berlin

Description:
sciences.social is an online community for social scientists. Users here can connect with one another and the millions of other Mastodon users who have opted for social media that is ad-free and actively moderated to keep bad actors at bay. Here's how to get started.

1. Create an account

Create an account to get started. You'll be asked to agree to some ground rules. You can post about almost anything on sciences.social, but we don't allow sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia, casteism or abusive behavior.

Once you confirm your email you'll be online. Come on back to this page (sciences.social/about) for next steps.

2. Get an app

Ice Cubes for iOS and Tusky for Android are very good and free. Mona and ivory are excellent apps for iOS/Mac users with a few dollars to spare.

Mastodon also works well from a web browser on laptops and desktops. A browser extension like Graze (chrome, mozilla) or FediAct (chrome, mozilla) will make following folks from other Mastodon servers seamless. Highly recommended.

3. Follow lots of folks

Thousands of social scientists are active on Mastodon, and you can follow anyone regardless of which server they call home. There's no algorithm to fill your feed with content so it helps to follow liberally. Our companion site find.sciences.social makes it easy to find and follow academics from many different disciplines including Sociology, Communication and Media Studies, and Political Science. Followgraph finds folks who are popular among the people you already follow.

You can also follow hashtags like #ASA2023 to see what people are posting about the conference. Or follow #rstats for hints on R and #AcademicChatter for - you know. Or maybe just #NaturePhotography for some pleasant views.

4. Start Posting and Boosting

Introduce yourself with your first post, and include an #introduction hashtag. Post about whatever you want, and use hashtags to make finding your posts easier. If you see a post you like, boost it. There's no algorithm to amplify selected voices here so we rely on boosting to see what's interesting.

More about us

sciences.social welcomes all social scientists, including professors, grad students and anyone with a graduate degree in the social sciences (sociology, anthropology, political science, communications, economics...), including people who are doing qualitative and quantitative work inside or outside academia. We want this to be a comfortable place for social scientists from all backgrounds, including those who are from marginalized or racialized groups, sexual minorities, people with disabilities and others who may not feel welcomed in some academic spaces.

sciences.social is collectively funded. It was started by Mark Igra (@markigra), a PhD student who earned enough money to start the site in a previous career. While Mark will continue to ensure sciences.social is funded, donations have helped pay for the rapid growth of the site. We encourage you to donate through our Open Collective fundraising page, which shows all of our spending. Donations through that page are tax deductible for U.S. taxpayers thanks to fiscal hosting from the Open Collective Foundation.

Mark runs this site with the help of a crew of moderators (Pratik, Kristian, Simon and Javier), with valuable advice from folks like Emily and Pamela. Let us know if you would like to help out.

Policies

At the moment, the official rules are deliberately minimal, but they have important implications. First, if you don't understand that "treat people with respect" means no sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia or casteism and precludes abusive behavior and doxxing, then you don't belong on this site. Second, you must use your real name in your profile and we strongly encourage using your full name as your display name. While there are plenty of good reasons for anonymity on the internet, for our purposes being able to link online reputation to real-world reputation is important.

Post Visibility

Public posts appear on the local timelines and federated timelines of sciences.social and all other mastodon instances that host your followers. Consider using Unlisted for posts you want your followers to see, but would prefer not to appear in public timelines. Using Unlisted for replies is strongly encouraged.

Posts expressing racism, homophobia and the like are not allowed with or without a content warning or with any level of visibility.

Sensitive Media

You must mark media as sensitive if it contains violence or sexual content. We also request that you mark media as sensitive if it might trigger common phobias including arachnophobia (fear of spiders) and Ophidiophobia (fear of snakes).

Getting along

Folks come here from different academic, ethnic and national cultures, so there are likely to be some mismatches in tone when we talk to one another. People might be more blunt than you are used to, or you might think someone is frustratingly obtuse when they are just trying to be polite. It's best to presume that folks here are acting in good faith. Mastodon has good tools for filtering or blocking posts you don't want to see. However, if you think someone is deliberately violating the rules or negatively affecting the community as a whole, you can report them as described below.

Reporting bad behavior

One of the great strengths of Mastodon is the ability to restrict access to bad actors. sciences.social already blocks posts from dozens of sites known to host trolls and nazis, but there'll be other bad behavior. If you use the "Report" action on someone's post the moderators can review it and take action to restrict that account. Reporting helps even for people who make their home on other servers.

Content Warnings

Content warnings are an important part of both the technical infrastructure and the culture of the Mastodon online community. They aren't just used for "triggering" content but also are often treated as a ‚Äúheadline‚Äù that allows people to choose whether they want to read the whole post. Click the CW link on your post to set one.

We strongly encourage the use of content warnings for posts that you think might be triggering or of limited interest, for example mentions of death or violence, and political debates centered on one country or locality.

While expressions of racism, casteism, homophobia, and transphobia are off-limits, we do not require content warnings for posts about those topics and their effects on people, whether academic or otherwise. Use your own judgment about using content warnings on these topics.

Site Visualization

The current header image is a public domain visualization from W.E.B. Du Bois exhibit at the 1900 Paris Exhibition. Expect changing visualizations over time
Short: Non-profit, ad-free social media for social scientists. Join thousands of social scientists here and across the fediverse.

Description:
Sciences.Re souhaite offrir un espace de partage, de collaboration et de discussion en ligne pour la communaut√© scientifique, acad√©mique, √©ducative francophone.

Cette instance est destin√©e aux communaut√©s li√©es √† l'enseignement et √† la recherche francophone, sans coloration th√©matique. Si vous travailler dans une universit√©, un labo de recherche, un lyc√©e, une pr√©pa, une grande √©cole, cette instance vous ouvre ses portes ! Si ce n'est pas le cas, une liste d'autres serveurs pouvant probablement vous accueillir est disponible √† cette adresse.

Cependant, aucune limite n'est impos√©e concernant le contenu des discussions ayant lieu sur cette instance ; il n'y a pas de ¬´ off-topic¬†¬ª ou de ¬´¬†on-topic¬†¬ª, c'est aux personnes qui utilisent l'instance d'en faire ce qu'elles veulent (dans la limite des r√®gles de l'instance, bien √©videmment). Il serait en effet difficile (et probablement contre-productif) de lister les sujets de discussion autoris√©s ou interdits.

Cette instance ne restreint pas son indexation par des moteurs de recherche.

R√®gles concernant la f√©d√©ration

Le mode de fonctionnement de Sciences.Re est une f√©d√©ration ouverte par d√©faut, avec une liste d'exclusion √† deux niveaux :

  1. Les serveurs ¬´¬†limit√©s¬†¬ª voient l'ensemble de leurs comptes limit√©s : un compte limit√© est cach√© √† tous les autres utilisateurs de l'instance, √† l'exception de ceux qui le suivent. Tout le contenu est toujours pr√©sent et peut √™tre trouv√© par le biais de la recherche, des mentions et du suivi, mais le contenu est invisible publiquement.

  2. Les serveurs ¬´¬†suspendus¬†¬ª voient l'ensemble de leurs comptes suspendus : un compte suspendu n'appara√Æt plus dans les recherches, sa page de profil a disparu, tous ses messages, ses t√©l√©chargements, ses followers et toutes les autres donn√©es sont supprim√©es. Cependant, cette suspension n'est effective que dans un sens : le serveur suspendu peut encore acc√©der au contenu non priv√© de ce serveur.

Un serveur pourra √™tre limit√©, par exemple, si il ne respecte pas les r√®gles sur l‚Äô√©tiquetage de la pornographie et de la nudit√© comme ¬´¬†NSFW¬†¬ª, ou l‚Äô√©tiquetage des contenus sensibles/choquants avec un ¬´¬†Content Warning¬†¬ª appropri√©.

Un serveur pourra √™tre suspendu, par exemple, si ses membres, de mani√®re syst√©mique, harc√®lent d‚Äôautres utilisateurs ou utilisatrices, incluant, sans s‚Äôy limiter, les menaces de toute sorte, les insultes, les blagues et le langage discriminatoires, les attentions sexuelles importunes, la publication d‚Äôinformations d‚Äôidentification personnelle (‚Äúdoxing‚Äù), ou perturbent d√©lib√©r√©ment des discussions ou des membres via du trolling, du spam, du flaming, du baiting, de la recherche d‚Äôattention, de la distribution de malware, ou tout type d‚Äôattaque contre l‚Äôinfrastructure informatique du projet Sciences.Re ou de ses organisations collaboratrices.

Avant de proc√©der √† une suspension de serveur, un d√©lai raisonnable est laiss√© au serveur pour lui permettre de mod√©rer le contenu de son c√¥t√©, apr√®s une demande de mod√©ration effectu√©e par l'√©quipe de mod√©ration de Sciences.Re. En absence de r√©action au terme de ce d√©lai raisonnable, le serveur sera suspendu.

Il est possible de proposer des serveurs √† suspendre ou √† limiter aux mod√©rateurs de l'instance, joignables via le compte @contact@sciences.re ; toute demande argument√©e sera consid√©r√©e.

Soutenir le serveur financi√®rement

Envie de participer aux co√ªts financiers que ce serveur repr√©sente ? Cliquez sur l'image ci-dessous :

Description:
About toot.community

Welcome to toot.community - your gateway to the wider Fediverse! We're a generic Mastodon instance proudly hosted in The Netherlands, committed to providing an open, ad-free, and respectful environment for all our users.

Our instance serves as a platform for dialogue, connection, and shared learning, embodying the values of inclusivity and respect. We strive to maintain a welcoming atmosphere for people from all walks of life, irrespective of their race, ethnicity, gender, religion, or nationality.

By joining toot.community, you're stepping into a world where voices from across the globe intermingle. It's more than just a Mastodon instance‚Äîit's a portal to the greater Fediverse, a universe teeming with diverse thoughts, cultures, and ideas.

Supporting toot.community

Here at toot.community, we value your privacy and peace of mind over everything else. That's why we promise not to display advertisements or sell your data. Instead, we operate on the goodwill and generous contributions of our members.

Maintaining and operating a server comes with its share of expenses. Currently, these costs are entirely borne by user donations and @jorijn. If you enjoy our services and have an account with us, we kindly ask you to consider supporting us financially.

Every bit helps us maintain our independence and ensures that we can continue to provide a secure, ad-free platform for everyone hosted on this instance. It provides a measure of financial security and helps us keep this wonderful community thriving.

There are two ways you can donate:

  1. Support via Ko-Fi - Accepts payments through Credit Card, PayPal, Apple Pay, and Google Pay. As a token of our gratitude, everyone who donates through Ko-Fi receives a special shoutout on our @funding account.
  2. Support via Patreon - Accepts payments through Credit Card. Regular contributions via Patreon help us plan for the future with confidence.

Code of Conduct

We intend to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This document contains the rules and principles for participating in our platform. This is a working document, so our team may amend it from time to time.

Goals

  • Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristics.
  • Create a supportive community where people freely share their passions and are excited and optimistic about each other's successes.
  • Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content, and individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

Principles that Guide us

  • We are not a free speech zone. This CoC lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything violating these rules or principles and remain a community member. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here.
  • The Moderators are not morality or thought police. Moderators are guided by this Code of Conduct. Post what you want if what you post follows these rules, principles, and the goals outlined above. Not every community member will appreciate controversial or explicit posts, so use Content Warnings liberally. We use Content Warnings so community members themselves can decide whether they want to see or engage with a post that may be controversial or explicit.
  • Bullies, trolls, and disruptors are not welcome in our community. We will moderate accordingly.
  • This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you decide to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it.

Rules for posting

The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.

General guidance on posting and participating in this community

  • Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about provocative topics at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases. Still, posting inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning is never good.
  • Do not post any nudity without a Content Warning.
  • Regarding Spam: We are not your free advertising platform. You will be removed if you are here only to sell your products or services. Occasional posts of commercial links are OK, but when most of a user's posts are commercial, we regard the account as Spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of Spam on a case-by-case basis.
  • Do not engage in name-calling, ad hominem attacks, or other uncivil behavior. Criticize ideas, never people.
  • Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful or don't like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation.

Moderation Principles

Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it's more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from this community when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one violation can result in suspending the user account.

The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isn't explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for this community, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the moderation team's discretion, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

Server Statistics / Information

  • FediDB
  • Fediverse.Observer
  • Uptime status report
  • Blog

Contact

Your questions, feedback, and concerns are always welcome. For any instance-related queries or support needs, please reach out to our dedicated @support account.

Alternatively, you can write to us via:

Email: support@toot.community

For any other correspondence, please use our postal address:

toot.community
Postbus 465
4900 AL Oosterhout NB
The Netherlands

Thank you for being part of our community! We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you.
Short: A worldwide Mastodon instance from The Netherlands. Run by digital enthusiasts, inviting everyone, everywhere to join us in the #fediverse.

Description:
Funding



This server is currently funded through support from ATLAS Media Group as well as the very generous contributions from our Ko-Fi supporters! We are hosted fully on Superior Networks London Region.

We are also welcoming contributions towards the running costs of the server as we grow, you can do so on our Ko-Fi

You can alternatively support is through our Patreon page.

Reporting and moderation



When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to punitive action and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first-time offences, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offences.

Service Status:

You can find our real time service status on the ATLAS Media Group Status Page.
Short: UK Hosted and Managed Mastodon Instance. General communal space for discussion, everyone welcome!

Description:
Important!

Sign-ups currently require admin approval, unless you have an invite link from an existing user.

Feel free to put anything as the join reason, or just link to an existing social media account. (Funny messages encouraged, but not required!)

Most approvals will take a few hours, but if your account is still pending, feel free to reach out to @Crashdoom on Telegram.

"PAWBS ARE FUN THOUGH!"

-Crashdoom

This instance aimed at any and all within the furry fandom, though anyone is welcome! We're friendly towards members of the LGBTQ+ community and aiming to offer a safe space for our users.

We do not federate with fascist instances and do not tolerate fascist users.

pawb.fun is part of the pawb.social network!

Staff Team

  • @Crashdoom - Owner / Head Admin
  • @Natebluehooves - Administrator (SysAdmin)
  • @Doridian - Administrator
  • @itsOasus - Administrator
  • @herzenschein - Moderator

Moderation / Content Policies

Network Policy

We are part of pawb.social network. Any user or instance found to violate our content policies will be suspended from all instances within the pawb.social network.

Federation Policy

We are an open-first instance, however in cases where an instance had been identified as being, indifferent to, permissive of, or actively encouraging abusive conduct, that instance will be blocked from federation.

User Conduct Policy

In the hopefully unlikely event that a user breaks the rules, the offending content will be removed and the user suspended. For harassment, discrimination, or illegal activity, the user's account will be terminated.

User Generated Content

We ask that all profile content (avatar, header, display name, bio, etc.) are completely safe, without any explicit or suggestive content.

Illegal content, or content depicting hate symbolism or iconography, will be removed and result in termination of the offending user.

Report System

Please report posts that make you feel uncomfortable, break the rules, or you otherwise think should be brought to our attention. You will never be penalized for using the report system in good faith.

Donate

While donations are not expected or required, if you want to help towards our hosting, hardware, and upgrades, you can over at Ko-fi!
Short: This instance aimed at any and all within the furry fandom, though anyone is welcome! We're friendly towards members of the LGBTQ+ community and aiming to offer a safe space for our users.
topic: Pawb.Fun - Pawbs, beans, and all things fluffy

Description:
Welcome to Universeodon.com

Where the universe meets Mastodon :)

About

Universeodon.com is a space for all humans who have a little curiosity. The kind of person who enjoys edutainment, reads books, watches science shows and loves to connect with people who view the universe through wonder. There are no forced topics here, but I hope you will find scientists, engineers, philosophers, physicists, and connect with people who share similar interests & passions.

From exploring the universe, to exploring the world we all share - everyone is welcome here.

Whether you love music, movies, TV, sports, books or knitting or anything in between - We all live in this wonderful universe, and I hope to see you exploring your hobbies, passions, and interests with amazing people across the #FEDIVERSE - The Universe ;)

Funding & Community Support

This server is currently funded through support from ATLAS Media Group as well as the very generous contributions from our Ko-Fi supporters! We are hosted fully on Superior Networks London Region.

We are also welcoming contributions towards the running costs of the server as we grow, you can do so on our Ko-Fi

You can alternatively support is through our Patreon page.

Federated Community

This service is community driven and runs on the Mastodon open-source platform. We're fully federated and connected to the over 10 million other people on the #fediverse.

Security

  • Backed up locally and offsite
  • https everywhere


Please note: It is important that you protect your account with 2factor authentication. You can set this up after you register.
Direct Messages (DMs) - These are just direct "toots" - They are not encrypted. Please only use DMs to send anything you just don't want broadcasted but is not confidential. (The developers are exploring end to end encryption here)

Welcome to the #fediverse
Short: Be one with the #fediverse. Join millions of humans building, creating, and collaborating on Mastodon Social Network.

Description:
Urbanists.Social is a Mastodon instance for urbanists - people who are into bikes, transit, and / or walkable cities.

Want to donate to us? Check out our Open Collective here!

We generally align ourself with the policies and goals of other instances like mastodon.social, awoo.space, and icosahedron.website. We want our server to be a safe space for our users. Generally the rules boil down to "don't be a dick", but a few worth drawing attention to:

  • Any content that is illegal under US or EU law is prohibited. We're run by a small community, please don't get us in trouble.
  • No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, and any other discriminatory conduct that attacks any individual or group of individuals based on what they are or what they believe is strictly forbidden. This excludes shitting on drivers, but still try to be nice.
  • Any conduct that abuses this Mastodon instance, or any other Mastodon instance, is strictly forbidden.
  • Your user profile (including your name and display name) must be SWF. NSFW content is not banned, but please be sure to tag it appropriately.
  • Please be considerate and respectful of others. Consider adding content warnings to your posts about controversial subjects or commonly-held phobias.
  • No harassment. Harassment is any improper or unwelcome conduct that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation to another person.

Our admins on this server are @sam and @zak.

This is not Twitter. Reporting posts that make you feel uncomfortable, or that you feel should be brought to our attention, is highly encouraged. Your reports will not be ignored, and will be dealt with (usually) within a few days. It may take more than a week due to timezone differences or jobs, but you will always hear back about your report, and it won't be closed until you're happy with the resolution for the report. If your report involves a user or post on another instance, you have the choice of sharing your report with the administration of that instance as well, but the report will always be sent to us. Please include in the report whether you chose to send the report to the other instance, though.

No moderation actions are automatic whatsoever. Nothing happens without human review.

We follow the Mastodon server covenant. If we decide to close the server, we will give you minimum three months notice. Our hosting provider, masto.host, does daily backups of our database.

Defederation policy

Defederation occurs when we limit access to other Mastodon instances. We do this through domain blocks, where we silence or suspend other servers by their domain name. Silencing an instance will make all posts from all accounts on the instance invisible to anyone who isn't following them on our server. Suspending will remove all of the instance‚Äôs content and media, and will not allow you to follow any users there.

We use domain blocks to keep our server safe, to pressure other instances to moderate more effectively, and to decrease the amount of moderation of remote content we have to do. We monitor the [#Fediblock](https://urbanists.social/tags/FediBlock) for reports from users and admins for troublesome accounts and instances.

We don‚Äôt yet have a specific set of rules we follow when blocking instances, but generally this is our policy:

  • Any instance whose purpose, stated goals, or moderation rules conflict with any of our rules are immediately suspended. Fairly self-explanatory. We don‚Äôt want this content on our server.
    • Example: We do not allow promotion of crypto. Cryptodon clearly breaks this rule and it has been suspended.
    • Another example: There are multiple instances for TERFs. We do not allow TERFs or ‚Äògender critical‚Äô bullshit on our server, so multiple TERF sites have been suspended.
  • Instances that do not have adequate prohibition of hate speech or harassment are immediately suspended.
    • A large percentage of these instances are ‚Äòfree speech‚Äô servers with little to no rules. Remaining federated with these instances opens our users to a high possibility of receiving abuse from them.
    • Example: Gab does not have adequate rules against hate speech. It‚Äôs an alt-right hellhole known for harassing lots of minorities in the Fediverse. So it has been suspended.
  • Instances with admins that engage in hate speech or harassment are immediately suspended.
    • Admins that do this are not capable of moderating hate speech or harassment, point blank. We do not want our users to be subject to their users‚Äô harassment or hate speech.
    • Example: Alex Gleason is a well-known TERF who regularly posts hate speech and harassment on his servers. This behavior attracts more TERFs to his servers who engage in the same behavior. As a result, all instances Gleason runs are suspended on our server.
  • Instances that are on lots of our peers‚Äô block lists are very likely to be suspended.
    • We trust the admin work of our peer instances, especially those that are larger than our own server. As a server that hasn‚Äôt received a lot of abuse, we like to prevent it before it happens. Watching other instances‚Äô block lists is key to making this happen.
  • Instances reported on #FediBlock are very likely to be silenced or suspended.
    • If we get repeat reports about an instance on the [#FediBlock](https://urbanists.social/tags/FediBlock) hashtag, we are very likely to take action against that instance. A high frequency of these reports from multiple users usually indicates a good candidate for a domain block.
    • Example: The admin of journa.host has been the subject of numerous complaints on the FediBlock tag. As a result of this, they have been silenced. This prevents our users from receiving random harassment from their users, while also allowing our users to follow users on the server.
  • Instances with questionable moderation are highly likely to be silenced or suspended.
    • Example: c.im bans exactly one server. They‚Äôve received numerous complaints on #FediBlock due to their admin not moderating content effectively. As a result of this, we‚Äôve silenced their server.

Instances on Probation

Users have requested the following instances to be unblocked, and the admins have reviewed them and put them on a probation list. We'll take any reports against these instances seriously and we'll be more likely to block them again.

  • qoto.org (23 Nov 2022)

Description:
Note: this info below is subjected to change as time continues. Those (significant) changes will be communicated in the announcements and by @hello@mastodon.vlaanderen.

Last update: Wednesday 21 February 2024

Change of ownership and server migrations

In January 2024, the admins and sponsors of this instance declared their intention to stop this instance. In order to keep it alive nonetheless, the team behind Mastodon Belgium offered to migrate this instance to their infrastructure to keep it alive. This migration is now nearly complete.

Welcome!

The team behind this Mastodon Instance is committed to bring you the best possible experience of the decentralized Twitter alternative called Mastodon. This instance is provided mainly for those who live in the Benelux area. But others who live in other countries are welcome too! As long as they keep their public posts in Dutch, French, German, or English to make moderation easier among other things. We - the admins of mastodon.vlaanderen - want to aim for a 'localized' experience for our (Benelux) users as much as possible.

If you want more information regarding this instance, feel free to drop an e-mail to hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen.

For those who are new to Mastodon and the Fediverse in general. I can recommend those resources to you:

  • A guide to Mastodon by Jeroen Baert
  • fedi.tips

This mastodon instance is run by individuals just like you. Those are

  • Johan Silkens (Administrator/Moderator)

  • Jessica (Administrator/Moderator)

  • Gert Jan (Administrator/Moderator)

  • Bart (Administrator/Moderator)

(Financial) contributions

It's possible to contribute (financially) to this instance. This can be done by a (recurring) donation and/or becoming a moderator.

Becoming a moderator

You can discuss this with the admin @admin@mastodon.vlaanderen or by sending an e-mail to hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen

Donations

This server runs entirely on donations. We do not serve targeted ads and we do not sell your data as you can read in our Privacy Policy.

There are several ways you can do a (recurring) donation.

  • Via PayPal
  • Via a bank transfer: BE11 7351 3917 1948 with "Mastodon Vlaanderen" as the description
  • Via OpenCollective. A similar platform to Patreon but with the choice that you can freely choose the amount you want to donate. Recurring or not.

Recurring donations are preferred over one-time donations, because hosting this platform is also a recurring cost.

Code of Conduct

We expect all users that are using our instance to adhere to our rules and Code of Conduct and agree to our Terms Of Service listed below. Those guidelines are not a legal document, but they are here to provide you with an insight into our content and moderation policies. The final interpretation/decision is up to the administrators of mastodon.vlaanderen.

Guidelines for other Fediverse instances

All users that interact with our instance from another instance must also follow an "common sense" practice and the admin(s) and moderators must have a good and active moderation policy. We will limit or block an entire instance if they do not have such policies in place, hosting illegal and/or abusive material, ... etc. You can find which instances we block/limit on our about page.

If you are an instance admin and believe we unjustly block/limit your instance. Send an e-mail to hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen.

Terms of Service

Usage by (commercial) entities

Entities commercial or not are allowed on this instance. Although we recommend setting up your own instance for a variety of reasons. Setting up a Mastodon instance is not that hard nowadays since the existence of services that serves you managed Mastodon instances and do the maintenance for you. They have also better uptime guarantees and SLA (Service Level Agreement) than the average Mastodon instance that are mostly run by individuals just like this one. Which is important if your brand (heavily) relies on social media.

If you want more information about this matter. Consult the @admin or send an e-mail. We can help you out finding a good instance for you.

If you still want to join this instance, there are some guidelines/rules you must follow. To make validation easier.

  • You must have an Belgian VAT number on your website and/or being based in Belgium
  • Signup with your brand's e-mail domain like social@yourbrand.be and not with a public e-mail service like Gmail.

Usage by famous/well-known/public people

Well-known people are allowed to use this instance. But keep in mind that we can ask you to verify yourself if we suspect that the signed up account was made by an impersonator without a clear view that it is a parody account.

We can ask you to provide one of these for the verification process:

  • a government issued ID

  • a driver's license.

The verification process is done by e-mail. You will receive one form hello[at]mastodon.vlaanderen and a DM from one of the admin's that you should have received an e-mail from us. The e-mails will be permanently deleted for safety reasons when the verification process is complete.

Just like for (commercial) entities, we recommend you to host your own instance so that people can instantly verify that you are really the one that you claim to be. Which is not always guaranteed on a random instance.

Usage by bots

Bots are allowed on this instance under circumstances:

  • Excessive posting with public visibility are forbidden. This may annoy other users who want to discover stuff in the local timeline

  • The maintainer of the bot must be displayed in the bot's bio

  • When using data from 3rd party sources. Make sure you have permission to use it.

  • Follow the rules defined by this instance as well as abide by the ToS and CoC

Termination of the service

The admins of mastodon.vlaanderen have the right to suspend any account if they believe that the suspended account was not following the rules defined by this server. Or did not abide by the terms of service. The suspended account have 30 days to download their data to be used to move to another instance if they wish. Some data may be retained so that the user cannot evade suspension. The user has the right to appeal their suspension once. Like we stated above, the admins have the right about the final fate of the suspended account without any discussion.

The account can also be (temporary) freezed and/or we can block the access to our services if we believe the user was doing stuff that degrades the performance of the service and/or was involved in illegal activities.

Quality of the service

Like we said earlier we try to give the users the best experience Mastodon (and the Fediverse in general) can have. The servers are monitored and back-upped regularly. But as with any service, some downtime can occur. When that happens we will try our best to do get it back up online within a "reasonable" time.

Since this Mastodon instance is run by individuals and not as a commercial service with SLA's and similar stuff. Don't expect from us that we fix stuff in the middle of the night or during business hours with a tight deadline. Because we all have a paid job and other obligations besides running and maintaining this instance.

You can check our status page for that. Keep it as an bookmark in your browser as we will put our updates on that platform as well.

Cross-posting from other sources (such as Twitter)

Cross-posting is copying of posts from one platform to another via automatic ways. It is allowed but under the following circumstances:

  • The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person or entity. Third-party copying is not permitted
  • The (Mastodon) account is at least partially monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored.

(very) Brief server infrastructure information

  • The servers that runs the Mastodon software as well as the underlying database & media are sponsored & hosted in Belgium by Barnes & Morgan BV.
  • Our e-mails are managed and stored by a Belgian mail provider MailFence

The servers are backed-up at least on a daily basis.
Short: De Vlaamse/Belgische Mastodon instance.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable, or what content is offensive. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

I usually handle reports within 24 hours, but this may vary depending on how busy I am. Please remember that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible.

Moderated Servers

I have chosen to limit and block the servers listed on Mastodon Social: https://mastodon.social/about

Funding

You can support this server financially by donating here.
