Description:
Please read the server rules and the information below before signing up to and/or using Zirkus. If you don‚Äôt agree to all of the terms set out here, please do not use this server. By continuing to use Zirkus, you agree to be bound by the terms set out here.


Guidelines

  • Language: There are no language rules on this server. English is de facto the main language, but feel free (even encouraged!) to post in other languages.
  • Content warnings: We do not require a content warning (CW) for posts about politics, social justice, etc. However, we ask that you be kind and considerate: include CWs if you believe your post may be distressing.
  • Bots: Bots are allowed. Try to make them fun.
  • Cross-posting: Cross-posting from Twitter, RSS, etc. is fine (and even encouraged if it helps you become more active here).
  • Topics: You do not need to remain permanently "on topic". The point of this arts/humanities community is to gather like-minded people who will make posts that are interesting to each other. But that doesn't mean that everything has to be about books, art, etc. This is a community to connect people, not enforce specific topics of discussion.
  • Self-promotion: There are many writers and artists on this server, and we are more than happy for you to promote your work from your personal account. We request, however, that you do so in a tasteful and not spammy manner.
  • Industry promotion: If you are a commercial entity of interest to our community (literary magazine, publishing house, etc.), we are also happy for you to promote here in a tasteful manner. However, we request that you make a modest donation, as this is a volunteer-run server that relies on crowdfunding (see below). Please contact the admins if you have any questions.


Donations

  • You can donate to Zirkus on Patreon here.
  • We are run entirely by volunteers on a non-profit basis and are dependent on donations to cover our hosting costs.
  • We're currently hosted on masto.host and are looking to raise $420/month to support 5,500 users comfortably. We will publish new goals as necessary based on our user numbers.
  • We ultimately hope to crowdfund via Open Collective, which offers greater transparency over expenses and more flexibility for contributors. Our Patreon page is a temporary solution while we await approval from a fiscal host on Open Collective. Once we have migrated crowdfunding to Open Collective, all funds raised on Patreon will be transferred to that account, the Patreon page will be shut down and contributors will be informed of the move.
  • Every little helps a lot. We‚Äôd like to thank our community for all their support so far!


Moderation and reporting posts

  • When you report an account or server, please indicate which server rule has been broken and include any extra context or explanation, if possible.
  • We are volunteer moderators and will try to address the issue as soon as we are able.
  • You will not be notified about the result, even if it has led to punitive action, which may not be visible to the outside. The response will be proportional to the nature of the offence.


Post visibility and privacy

  • Please bear in mind that your posts ‚Äì depending on their visibility ‚Äì are public. We recommend not sharing information publicly that you do not intend to share with the whole internet.
  • When you post, bear in mind that posts cannot be hidden by locking an account. Posts can be deleted either manually or set to auto-delete within various timeframes. Please familiarize yourself with the different visibility options for posting: Public, Unlisted, Followers Only, and Mentioned People Only (i.e. a direct message).
  • The displaying and distribution of your post happens strictly according to the visibility rules you have set for the post. We will not modify the visibility of the post you have set.


Your data and privacy

  • We can see basic account and profile information that you provide when signing up to the server, such as username, email, name (real or fake) and IP address.
  • We do not share your information with any third parties.
  • The server administrators can technically access users‚Äô direct messages, but pledge not to do so. This option is also not available in the default admin UI. We strongly recommend not sending any confidential or private information via direct message on Mastodon (or equally on Twitter) because the messages are not end-to-end encrypted. WhatsApp and Signal are currently end-to-end encrypted applications.
  • We do not log information about your use of this server or run any form of analytics. Our hosting provider, masto.host, keeps a log of the IP addresses of the requests made to the server, which is auto-deleted in less than 90 days.


Liability

  • You are responsible for the content that you make available to the server, including its legality and appropriateness. Please abide by the above server rules when using Zirkus. In case of breach of rules, the administrators reserve the right to remove you.
  • In no event will Zirkus, the administrators and the moderators be liable to you or any third party for any special, indirect, incidental, exemplary or consequential damages of any kind arising out of or in connection with the server and content included on or otherwise made available to you through the server.


Moderators

  • @lexipenia@zirk.us (admin)
  • @hyoyoonkang@zirk.us
Short: Literature, philosophy, film, music, culture, politics, history, architecture: join the circus of the arts and humanities! For readers, writers, academics or anyone wanting to follow the conversation.

Description:
Social networking, back in your hands!

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic‚Äîyou decide who you want to see!

Tor access

We also offer a way to access Masto.ai via the Tor network with our own .onion URL address.

You can access Masto.ai on Tor via https://yiynyc2lymecpdexzodzr6lihlte4n3bdsi36uphe5sbkpwbwrl3unad.onion

Support the community

Since we do not serve ads and we do not sell data we rely on your support. If you like you can donate to help us out a little.

You can help out the community by donating in several ways:

  • Become a Patron
  • Support with PayPal
  • Credit Card Direct
  • Support on LiberaPay
  • Buy us a Ko-Fi

European Bank Deposit / IBAN

Stuxhost
NL53 BUNQ 2061 1682 13
BUNQ NL2A XXX

Staff

In addition to the site's owner, @stux Mastodon.ai's admin & moderation staff include:

  • @PhillyCodeHound (admin)
  • @antonioserrata (moderation)

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Mobile & Desktop Apps

Thanks to Mastodon's open API, you can use it from any of these apps developed by third-party developers.

More from

The Fediverse is more than Mastodon, we not only provide an ethical alternative for social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook but we host also some additional services.

Services

  • mstdn.social - Main Mastodon server
  • Pixelfed - Federated photo sharing
  • Misskey - Federated social network(like Facebook)
  • AllTube - Download videos from everywhere

Alternate FE

  • HyperSpace - Alternate Mastodon front-end

Server Info

This server is hosted in Falkenstein, Germany at Hetzner.

  • 16GB Memory
  • 16GB SWAP
  • 80GB Database Disk
  • Wasabi S3 Media Storage
  • Mailgun Email Delivery

  • Fediverse.Observer

Instance Relays

  • https://en.relay.friendi.ca/inbox

Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.

  • You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
  • Read more on post and account visibility here

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, you‚Äôre not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

  • United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
  • Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

Attributions

Hosted by Stuxhost.com.

Contact

You can get in touch with us by sending us a toot via the network or by sending an email:

  • @stux
  • info@masto.ai
  • dmca@masto.ai

Moderated servers

On Masto.ai we handle the same blocking / muting list as on mstdn.social. You can find the full list here.
Short: A general Mastodon server for all languages.

Description:
Welcome to Hachyderm.io

Pronounced hack-a-derm like pachyderm. (What is a pachyderm?)

Non-User Accounts Restricted

Please also see "Note for Non-User Accounts" at the bottom of this page

Many accounts for non-users are restricted and/or invite-only on this server. This includes but is not limited to: companies, businesses, business-like entities, events, publications, projects, agencies, bots, and so on. Please refer to our Account Types Documentation and reach out to the admin team ( admin@hachyderm.io ) prior to creating an account if you are creating an account for anything other than yourself for personal use.

About

Here we are trying to build a curated network of respectful professionals in the tech industry around the globe. Welcome anyone who follows the rules and needs a safe home or fresh start.

We are hackers, professionals, enthusiasts, and are passionate about life, respect, and digital freedom. We believe in peace and balance.

Safe space. Tech Industry. Economics. OSINT. News. Rust. Linux. Aurae. Kubernetes. Go. C. Infrastructure. Security. Black Lives Matter. LGTBQIA+. Pets. Hobbies.

Community Links

Learn more about our Community by looking at:

  • Community Docs
  • Blog
  • GitHub Community Issue Tracker
  • üíûüêòCurrent Emojis üêòüíû

Funding

Hachyderm is funded via the Hachyderm project GitHub Sponsor page as well as other donation sources. Please see our Funding and Thank You documentation page for more information about additional ways to donate.

Moderation and Community Safety

Hachyderm is actively moderated to protect our most vulnerable members. Our primary rule is Don't Be A Dick and all other rules are to capture common "whataboutisms" that we want to clearly state are included by Don't Be A Dick. Our server rules, including Don't Be A Dick, are explained on our Community Docs.

When making moderation decisions, our moderators abide by our Moderator Covenant. This is to both hold ourselves accountable as well as provide transparency, and build community trust, around how we handle issues that might appear to fall into "grey areas".

If you experience an issue that needs moderator action / intervention, please look at our documentation page for how to report issues to the moderators.

Reporting Hachyderm Issues and Outages

Technical issues with the Hachyderm site, including full / partial outages and features that are not working correctly, need to be reported to us via our GitHub Community Issue Tracker.

New to Mastodon?

If you're new to Mastodon in general, we recommend taking a look at Mastodon.Help's brief explainer about what Mastodon is and isn't, as well as taking a look at fedi.tips for some How To Dos.

Note for Non-User Accounts

Also referred to as Specialized Accounts in our Documentation

Although regular user accounts are only subject to regular server rules, specialized / entity / "novelty" / "focus" accounts have some additional restrictions. To learn more, please see our Account Types documentation page. A short summary of what to know:

  • Company, company-like, and/or business accounts, currently known as corporate accounts, are invite-only. Unofficial corporate accounts will be suspended.
    • Anyone looking to create an account of this type must reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Those looking to create accounts for non-profit entities should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Bot accounts are allowed with restrictions (please see our Bot Account documentation).
  • Qualifying Open Source Project accounts are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Qualifying Community Events are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Essentially: anyone interested in creating an account that is not a general user should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Large / Influencer account set ups and transfers, which is defined as more than 10k on any platform, need to reach out to the Admin team prior to transfer at admin@hachyderm.io.

For more information about all of the above, please see our Account Types documentation.

Unrecognized specialized account types will be suspended. Commonly suspended / unrecognized subtypes are:

  • NSFW / 18+
  • Fundraising
  • Unofficial company / corporate accounts

This is not an exhaustive list. If you are unsure if the specific specialized account you have in mind is allowed, please reach out to us at admin@hachyderm.io.

Our Logo

Our logo was designed by the lovely Ashton Rainbows. (website, Instagram)

Thank you Ashton!

Nivenly Discord

The Nivenly Foundation is the new (2023) parent organization for Hachyderm. You can join Nivenly's Discord here.
Short: Hachyderm is a safe space, LGBTQIA+ and BLM, primarily comprised of tech industry professionals world wide. Note that many non-user account types have restrictions - please see our About page.

Description:
Welcome to Famichiki!

Famichiki is a community-driven Mastodon server operated by a small group of foreigners residing in Japan. While we primarily have English speakers in our community, we welcome users of all languages. Our platform is designed for foreigners who currently live, have lived, or are interested in living in Japan, as well as Japanese individuals seeking to engage with the international community in our chosen home.

Join our platform to connect with an active and diverse community. Whether you‚Äôre an English speaker or prefer another language, you‚Äôll find comradeship and valuable resources for navigating life in Japan.

Volunteer Driven and Community Financed

Famichiki Mastodon is run by unpaid volunteers and our infrastructure is paid for 100% by donations from our community. While donations are not mandatory, we appreciate any contributions you can make. Donations can be one time or regular subscription payments, and even anonymously if that‚Äôs more to your liking. Contributions can be made via our Open Collective page. We‚Äôre looking at adding benefits for paying subscribers - please check @admins for further updates!

Our Team

The server is moderated by the following people:

  • @brian
  • @lukas
  • @pippa
  • @savvykenya
  • @flockofcats

All of our team are involved in the day to day operation of the server, so please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to any of us (or the @admins account) if you have any questions or need any help.

Discord

We are also on Discord! Participation on Discord is encouraged but by no means required. If the server is down for whatever reason, Discord will be the first place of contact.

Regarding Our Rules

These rules exist to ensure a positive community experience for all of our members. No moderation decision is automatic; every report is reviewed by one of our team and, where necessary, acted on in agreement with other team members. If you feel as though you have been penalized unfairly, please feel free to reach out either via an appeal or by emailing us. We do defederate from servers whose policies clearly lie against our own; please check the ‚Äòmoderated servers‚Äô list for more information.
Short: We are a community-driven server operated by a diverse group of foreigners residing in Japan. While we primarily have English speakers in our community, we welcome users of all languages.

Description: The original Pixelfed instance, operated by the main developer @dansup
Short: The original Pixelfed instance, operated by the main developer @dansup

Description:
Hi! This is a general-purpose Mastodon server. It does not have any particular topic or target audience. Everyone is welcome to sign up as long as they are willing to follow our rules set out below.

In addition to the information provided below, we also have a blog and about page at about.ohai.social.

Support

The best way to get in touch for questions and issues concerning the server is through support@ohai.social.

Donations

We accept donations toward the operation of the server through Patreon.

Moderation team

There are currently three moderators for ohai.social:

  • @dee_in_calgary (she/her) üá®üá¶
  • @lutoma (he/him) üá™üá∫
  • @silsha (he/him) üá™üá∫

Server status

You can check the current server status on our monitoring page at status.ohai.is.

Security & Backups

This Mastodon server is hosted on bare metal in a data center in the south of Germany. Two people have access to the infrastructure, and all SSH access is exclusively using hardware security tokens. We will never sell or otherwise use your data for anything other than the operation of this Mastodon server, and we certainly do not read your DMs.

All database data is backed up twice daily in a physically different location from the live data (Specifically, at BorgBase).

In the unlikely event that we will ever have to shut down the server, we intend to give at least 6+ months of notice ahead of the shutdown.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behavior that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.

  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.

  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.

  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.

  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.

  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.

  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("‚Ä¶@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.

  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of chaos.social and bsd.network. Thank you!)

Legal notice (Impressum)

Registered DMCA agent according to 37 CFR ¬ß 201.38 and information provided according to Sec. 5 German Telemedia Act (TMG):

Copyright Manager
fnordcordia GbR
U 4, 10
68161 Mannheim
Germany, Europe

Represented by:
Felix Arndt and Lukas Martini

VAT Id number according to Sec. 27 a German Value Added Tax Act:
DE292458629

These contact details are intended exclusively for legal inquiries and DMCA notices. For anything else, contact support@ohai.social.

Telephone: +49 621 18067438
Telefax: +49 621 18067437
Email: dmca-agent@fnoco.eu
Short: ohai.social is a cozy, fast and secure Mastodon server where everyone is welcome. Run by the folks at ohai.is.

Description:
Mastodon Party is a new general-purpose instance open to everyone!

Important Information

Status Updates: status.fediverse.us

Moderation Information: see mpp.bus-hit.me

Donations

This instance is generously supported by our contributors, if you use this instance to interact with the Mastodon network please make a monthly contribution on Open Collective, all support is immensely helpful!

Sponsors

If you would like to see your company's logo with a go follow link on this page, you can become a sponsor here.

New links on this page are added manually. We reserve the right to reject sponsorships if we believe the association could harm our brand. If you are not sure if your link will be accepted, reach out to jonah@fediverse.us.

Legal

Mastodon Party is operated by Fediverse Communications LLC, a Minnesota (USA) company, and is hosted on servers operated in Germany and Finland. All content on this server is expected to be legal in all of these jurisdictions. If you have any copyright, trademark, legal concerns, please email us directly.

  • DMCA Complaints: dmca@fediverse.us
  • Trademark Complaints: trademark@fediverse.us
  • Abuse Complaints: abuse@fediverse.us

Description:
Read this first

We're building a community around ethical, factual journalism and information literacy. This server is invite-only, but anyone who agrees to the rules can apply for an invite. Before applying, please read the server rules and Code of Ethics.

How to apply

Apply here. Please tell us who you are, why you want to be here, and how our Code of Ethics resonates with you. It can also help to include links to other social media profiles if you have them.

federated.press is a fiscally sponsored project of Open Collective Foundation, a 501(c)(3) public charity.

Our DMCA Registration Number is DMCA-1044790. To submit a claim of copyright infringement, please send an e-mail request in compliance with the US Copyright Office standards to dmca@federated.press.

Code of Ethics

By joining this Mastodon instance, you agree to embody the four foundational principles of ethical journalism from the SPJ Code of Ethics:

  • Seek truth and report it: Ethical Journalism should be accurate and fair. Ethical journalists should be honest and courageous in gathering, reporting and interpreting information.
  • Minimize harm: Ethical journalism treats sources, subjects, colleagues and members of the public as human beings deserving of respect.
  • Act independently: The highest and primary obligation of ethical journalism is to serve the public.
  • Be accountable: Ethical journalism means taking responsibility for one's work and explaining one's decisions to the public.

Please follow the link and read the full document to learn more.

FAQ

Do I have to be a working journalist to apply?
No! This instance is open to everyone. The only requirement is that you follow the rules.
Why was my application rejected?
This community is for journalists and others interested in information ethics. We‚Äôre accepting applications that give a good reason why you want to be here. If your first application wasn‚Äôt accepted (e.g., you can‚Äôt log in), feel free to reapply.

Funding

federated.press is a member of the Open Collective Foundation, and runs on donations. As a US 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, contributions are tax-deductible.

If you are an active member here, or if you want to support our mission to provide a thoughtful and inclusive home for journalists, researchers, and their allies, please consider a one-time or monthly donation (monthly is strongly preferred‚Äîit really helps with cashflow planning!).

Your organization can also become an official sponsor for $30/month. Sponsors get a logo and link on the federated.press/about page (that's this page).

Our current costs consist of:

  • Dedicated server ‚Äî $149/mo
  • Amazon SES (for email sending) ‚Äî $0/mo (free tier)
  • Domain name renewal ‚Äî $60/year
  • Liability coverage (provided through Open Collective) ‚Äî $425/year

Monthly funding goal: $47.85 of $200/mo üü©üü©‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è‚¨úÔ∏è

Service status

See our status page for our current service status and uptime.

federated.press is a member of the Mastodon Server Covenant.
Short: A Mastodon server for journalists‚Äîby profession or temperament. Please click "Learn more" and read our rules and Code of Ethics before applying.

Description:
About CR8R

The underlying objective of the CR8R community is to be a friendly, respectful and inclusive place for all types of creators, those who support creative freedoms and those who like to appreciate and consume those creations one way or another.

You are absolutely free to come join the instance and embark on journey into the fediverse.

We do not limit registration based on language or location, please keep in mind that this instance is hosted in the UK so your experience may vary.

For our status page: status.cr8r.gg

For information, documentation & blog: cr8r.io

As a general-purpose instance (albeit with a creator theme), we do not have heavy moderation in terms of what topics people are allowed to post about, however all users are expected to follow our rules at all times, and generally be nice and friendly on the federation.

Please report all content you see which might violate our rules for evaluation. If you are on a remote server, please forward any reports of our users to our server for our moderators to take action, we pledge that remote reports will remain confidential within our moderation team and will not be used for any form of retribution against the reporter.

Mastodon Server Covenant

While this instance is relatively new, we do intend to keep it running long-term and it follow the Server Covenant as outlined at joinmastodon.org/covenant.

  • We agree to active moderation against (by not limited to): racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia

  • We agree to daily backups to ensure your data is safe

  • We have backup administrators ready to operate this server in emergencies or unexpected absence

  • In the unlikely event this instance shuts down, we agree to give our users a 3 month period to migrate to another instance

Governance

While the day to day operations are the responsibility of the Moderation Team, the instance is governed by those who use and support it.

As the instance grows, requests/suggestions etc can be submitted to help shape our future within our own little community as well as the wider fediverse.

You can DM @CR8R, or email info@cr8r.gg

Moderation Team

  • Actively recruiting, send us a DM or email

Support The Instance

If you'd like to donate towards the instance, you can contribute by using our ko-fi page.

All funds raised will solely be used to help cover the running & upgrade costs.

The instance nor its data will never be up for sale/sold.

Chaotic Fun is a part of the Fedi.Exposed group, a non-profit organisation.
Short: A community for all types of creators, those who consume the creations & everyone else (except for automated/bot accounts, they are highly discouraged).

Description:
Welcome to SEO.chat

An open source, social network based on Mastodon, and focused on SEO. Managed by @fili@seo.chat.

This Mastodon server was created and set up for the SEO community to have a place to come together, share knowledge and test things out. Its primary service is to provide a platform for the Search Engine Optimization community.

The primary instance language is English.

Best efforts are made to keep the server up and running, but sometimes things may be outside the admin's control, such as the managed hosting provider experiencing downtime, or Google inadvertently mistaking the server for phishing.

Code of Conduct

SEO.chat aims to be a nice community of marketers, sharing and helping each other. You are welcome to join!

Basic rules:

  • Be polite and kind. Don't be a jerk. Religious speech, hate speech, discrimination, and harassment of any kind is not tolerated on this server.
  • Be respectful - even if you disagree.
  • No spam or commercial advertisements.
  • This server is intended for anyone who works in the field of Search Engine Optimization.
  • The primary language for this server is English. Although it is fine to discuss SEO examples/cases/details related to different markets, languages and locales, make sure that the primary language of your posts are in English.

And everything will be fine.

When applying to join

When you sign up to join, you will be asked to provide an answer to "Why do you want to join?". Take a moment to write down your response. If your response is unrelated to SEO and is lacking the requested information, your application to join will likely be rejected.

This server is committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant and is hosted in Germany.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behavior expected from SEO.chat users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and the moderators will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post potentially graphical content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post any advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of SEO.chat instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("‚Ä¶@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in SEO.chat community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.
  • Do not debate moderation actions in public posts. If you disagree with how a moderator enforced the rules you may direct-message the moderation team.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network and chaos.social. Thank you!)

Content not allowed

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviors and type of content that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the discretion of the instance administrators, as described in the SEO.chat Terms.

  • Any illegal content (doxing, leaking private information, under age content, etc)
  • Adult (pornography) content
  • Spam
  • Commercial advertisements
  • Racism
  • Political content
  • Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  • National Socialism
  • Nazism
  • Holocaust denial
  • Gender-critical
  • Sex and gender discrimination
  • Transphobia
  • Misogyny
  • Trolling, insulting and derogatory comments towards others using a seo.chat account
  • Spreading falsehoods, alternative facts, anecdotal evidence, prejudice or bias towards a social group, inciting violence, circular reporting, shock-provoking content, conspiracy theories, dark patterns, deepfakes, disinformation, misinformation, sensationalism, truthiness, propaganda, rumors, hoaxes, urban myths, pseudoscience, post-truth and opinion pieces or interviews that convey any of the previous.
  • Threats of Physical violence against any person, animal or institution.
  • Posts in other languages than English

The admin (@fili) is maintaining this SEO.chat instance in his spare time, finances, hardware and nerves. Please don't push any of those.

Reporting Violations

Please report behavior that bothers you. The moderators will keep your report confidential. Accounts found to be breaking the rules will be banned without a warning.

If you notice a post that violates the rules, please report it. It is easy to assume that someone else has already reported a post, but it is easy for everyone to feel that way and no one to report the post. If you feel personally uncomfortable with the kind of attention you‚Äôre receiving, please reach out to the moderation team.

The moderation team will always take a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if a problematic post isn‚Äôt explicitly called out above, yet is inappropriate for SEO.chat (not related to SEO), the post will likely be removed, and the member will be dealt with appropriately.

Copyrights

All product names, logos, and brands are property of their respective owners. All company, product and service names used in this website are for identification purposes only. Use of these names, logos, and brands does not imply endorsement.
Short: The largest Search Engine Optimization (#SEO) community on Mastodon.

Description:
üêò NYC Region Mastodon! üóΩ

‚û°Ô∏è site uptime/status: status.masto.nyc (legacy uptime page)

‚û°Ô∏è want to be a mod? üë©üèΩ‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüë®üèø‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüë©üèª‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüßë‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è Apply here!

‚û°Ô∏è art credit all goes to marykatecarney

‚û°Ô∏è Infrastructure source (GitHub warning)

Welcome, friends!

You've reached the nyc-based Mastodon instance. This is an instance meant for people residing in the greater NYC area! We hope you enjoy your stay. Take a look at our rules, and feel free to poke around. This is still a really small instance, so expect some things to change as we grow- we will notify everyone on breaking changes.

The current priority is to make this place a welcome home for its users. This means, in order of priority, we will be pursuing 1) Reliability and uptime (within budget), 2) Accessibility and 3) Usability (make this a place people want to join, with relevant content).

FAQ:

  • Q: I've never lived or worked in the greater NYC area. Can I join this instance?

  • A: Feel free to interact with us, but please don't create an @masto.nyc account. This may be technically enforced in the future, and may be used as grounds for limiting accounts.

  • Q: I've seen rule breaking content on this instance. How do I report it?

  • A: Use that report button! But please only use it for content that breaks our rules. If you think the rules need to be changed, contact us at the email above.

  • Q: What happens if this instance gets shut down?

  • A: The intent is to transfer the server to a new owner if shutting down is ever an option. Per the Mastodon server covenant, three months notice will be given prior to any move or shutdown events.

  • Q: Do you utilize any domain blocklists?

  • A: We subscribe to the oliphant.social Tier 0 blocklist as a base, and add/remove as necessary.
Short: Regional New York City üêò üóΩ instance! A place to engage with your local neighbors and friends

Description:
Code of Conduct

Note: ‚ÄúSnoot BBQ‚Äù in this document refers to the Snoot BBQ Mastodon instance at https://bbq.snoot.com. ‚ÄúThe administrators‚Äù refers to the administrators on this organization: currently @keith@bbq.snoot.com.

The Snoot BBQ is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Snoot BBQ spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.

Types of Harassment

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, immigration status, religion, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of ‚Äúdead‚Äù or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behavior in spaces where they‚Äôre not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like ‚Äúhug‚Äù or ‚Äúbackrub‚Äù) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate ‚Äúouting‚Äù of any aspect of a person‚Äôs identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication
  • Jokes that resemble the above, such as ‚Äúhipster racism‚Äù, still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
  • Microaggressions, which take the form of everyday jokes, put downs, and insults that spread humiliating feelings to people of marginalized groups

The administrators will not act on complaints regarding:

  • ‚ÄúReverse‚Äù-isms, including ‚Äúreverse racism,‚Äù ‚Äúreverse sexism,‚Äù and ‚Äúcisphobia‚Äù
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as ‚Äúleave me alone,‚Äù ‚Äúgo away,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not discussing this with you.‚Äù
  • Communicating in a ‚Äútone‚Äù you don‚Äôt find congenial
  • Criticism of racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of the Snoot BBQ, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an administrator (listed at the top of this document) directly or file a report using the Mastodon reporting system (click the ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Äù on a post and then use the reporting feature).

The admins reserve the right to exclude people from the Snoot BBQ based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Snoot BBQ spaces and behavior towards people who are not at the Snoot BBQ. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Snoot BBQ spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Snoot BBQ members or the general public.

Updates

The administrators reserve the right to update the Code of Conduct at any time at their discretion. Updates to the CoC will be communicated to users via posts from admin accounts. If you have any concerns about or suggestions for the CoC, please contact an administrator via DM.

License

This was adapted from the LGBTQ in Tech Code of Conduct and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.

Privacy Policy

The data you post here lives on a server that Keith Calder runs. He promises that he won‚Äôt look at your private data. You are just going to have to trust him on this.

This is, however, an ActivityPub federated server. This means that other people on other federated servers can find you, send you messages, etc. This also means that any information you put in posts, whether they are public or private, might end up ‚Äúfederated‚Äù ‚Äî basically, a copy of your post gets put on any server that reads your post.

If you want decent privacy (the info doesn‚Äôt leave this server), the only way to do that is to set your account to private, only accept friend requests from other bbq.snoot.com users, and only ever @ mention other bbq.snoot.com users. Once you start talking to people on other servers, all bets are off. Any private message you send to someone on another server could be looked at by the admin of a different server. This is kind of like email: if you are on a private email server, and you send an unencrypted email to a gmail account, congrats, Google now has the content of that email. But also, you do this every day, so, hey. The internet!

License

This privacy policy was written by Darius Kazemi with minor tweaks by Keith Calder, and is provided under a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.
Short: A Mastodon community for film and tv people.

Description:
Welcome Home!

Welcome to The Canadian, a Mastodon instance run by Canadians, in Canada, for everyone! Our goal is to foster lively respectful conversation on everything from sports to politics. We welcome diversity and want to be a safe space for everyone who wants make this their home in the fediverse!

Bienvenue chez vous !

Bienvenue sur The Canadian, une instance du Mastodon g√©r√©e par des Canadiens, au Canada, pour tout le monde ! Notre objectif est de favoriser des conversations anim√©es et respectueuses sur tous les sujets, du sport √† la politique. Nous c√©l√©brons la diversit√© et voulons √™tre un espace s√©curitaire pour tous ceux et celles qui veulent utiliser The Canadian comme port d‚Äôattache dans le fediverse!

Moderation Style: 

Espace s√©curis√© Fediverse

Who We Are

The server and it’s components are run by Mike Fraser the system admin. He’s assisted by a small group of volunteer moderators who are able to assist our users in both official languages which are French and English. We’re mostly Canadians but any one can be a virtual Canadian! We currently have users from different countries and we’d love to add more.

The Canadian is supported by donation. A contribution can be made here: Support The Canadian Dot Social

Qui sommes-nous ?

Le serveur et ses composantes sont g√©r√©s par Mike Fraser, l'administrateur syst√®me. Il est assist√© par un petit groupe de mod√©rateurs b√©n√©voles qui peuvent aider nos utilisateurs dans les deux langues officielles, en fran√ßais comme en anglais. Nous sommes principalement des Canadiens, mais n'importe qui peut √™tre un Canadien virtuel ! Nous avons actuellement des utilisateurs de diff√©rents pays et nous aimerions en ajouter d'autres. The Canadian est financ√© par des dons. Une contribution peut √™tre faite ici : Appuyer The Canadian Dot Social

Data Sovereignty

All of our hardware is wholly owned and operated by the system administrator of the Canadian. Our servers are hosted at tier one data centers in Kewlona and Burnaby British Columbia. All caching is done within these data center’s as well. What this means is that we can at anytime physically access our equipment and limit others from doing so. Your data never leaves Canada (unless you post it publicly).

Souverainet√© des donn√©es

L‚Äôensemble du contenu est enti√®rement d√©tenu et g√©r√© par l'administrateur du syst√®me de The Canadian. Nos serveurs sont h√©berg√©s dans des centres de donn√©es de premier niveau √† Kewlona et Burnaby en Colombie-Britannique. Toutes les mises en cache sont effectu√©es dans ces centres de donn√©es. Cela signifie que nous pouvons √† tout moment acc√©der physiquement √† notre √©quipement et emp√™cher d'autres personnes de le faire. Vos donn√©es ne quittent jamais le Canada (sauf si vous les affichez publiquement).

Mastodon Server Covenant

We follow the Mastodon Server Covenant which is a set of minimalistic guidelines to provide the best possible experience for our users.

L'engagement du serveur Mastodon

Nous respectons le Mastodon Server Covenant qui est un ensemble de directives minimales visant √† fournir la meilleure exp√©rience possible √† nos utilisatrices et utilisateurs.

Environmental Responsibility

All of our equipment runs on hydro electric power which is a %100 renewable energy source. The chill capacity at our data center is completely geo thermal which gives us a near zero carbon foot print.

Responsabilit√© environnementale

Tous nos √©quipements fonctionnent √† l'√©nergie hydro√©lectrique qui est une source d'√©nergie 100 % renouvelable. La capacit√© de refroidissement de notre centre de donn√©es est enti√®rement g√©othermique, ce qui nous permet d'avoir une empreinte carbone presque nulle. L'inscription est actuellement ouverte!

Registration is Currently Open!

If you’re new to Mastodon please consider signing up, we’d love to have you. If you’re on another instance and want to move closer to home, sign up and we can assist! Again if you're moving from another instance please let us know on the sign up form. We’d encourage you to look over our code of conduct and our server rules first, to make sure our moderating style suites your needs.

Les inscriptions sont ouvertes !

Si vous √™tes nouvelle ou nouveau sur Mastodon, n'h√©sitez pas √† vous inscrire, nous serons ravis de vous accueillir. Si vous √™tes sur une autre instance et que vous souhaitez vous rapprocher de chez vous, inscrivez-vous et nous pourrons vous aider! Encore une fois, si vous d√©m√©nagez d'une

Land Acknowledgement

We acknowledge that TheCanadian.Social is hosted on the ancesteral and unceded territory of the Halkomelem, Syilx, Secw√©pemc, and Nlaka'pamux and Skwxw√∫mesh speaking peoples.

Reconnaissance du territoire

Nous reconnaissons que TheCanadian.Social est h√©berg√© sur le territoire ancestral et non c√©d√© des peuples Halkomelem, Syilx, Secw√©pemc, Nlaka'pamux et Skwxw√∫mesh.

Code Of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of thecanadian.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person’s demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user’s access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Code de conduite

Les lignes directrices ci-dessous ne constituent pas un document juridique et leur interpr√©tation finale rel√®ve de l'administration du site TheCanadian.Social. Elles vous donnent un aper√ßu de nos politiques de mod√©ration du contenu :

1. Les types de contenu suivants seront retir√©s de la chronologie publique :

1. la publicit√© excessive;

2. les robots d'information non actualis√©s qui affichent des sources d'information tierces;

3. la nudit√©, la pornographie et le contenu sexuellement explicite, y compris dans des repr√©sentations artistiques; et

4. la violence gore et extr√™mement graphique, y compris dans des repr√©sentations artistiques.

2. Les types de contenu suivants seront supprim√©s de la chronologie publique et peuvent entra√Æner la suspension du compte et la r√©vocation de l'acc√®s au service :

1. le racisme ou incitation au racisme;

2. le sexisme ou l'apologie du sexisme;

3. la discrimination √† l'encontre des minorit√©s sexuelles ou de genre, ou son apologie; et

4. le nationalisme x√©nophobe et/ou violent.

3. Les types de contenu suivants sont explicitement interdits et entra√Æneront la r√©vocation de l'acc√®s au service :

1. la repr√©sentations sexuelles d'enfants;

2. le contenu ill√©gal en Allemagne et/ou en France, tel que la n√©gation de l'Holocauste ou les symboles nazis; et

3. tout comportement faisant la promotion de l'id√©ologie national-socialiste.

4. Tout comportement visant √† traquer ou √† harceler d'autres utilisatrices ou utilisateurs, √† les emp√™cher d‚Äôutiliser le service, √† d√©grader les performances du service, √† les harceler ou √† les inciter √† commettre l'une des actions susmentionn√©es est √©galement interdit et passible d'une sanction pouvant aller jusqu'√† la r√©vocation de l'acc√®s au service. Cela inclut, sans s'y limiter, les comportements suivants :

1. Poursuivre une conversation avec une utilisatrice ou un utilisateur qui a express√©ment demand√© √† ce que cette conversation cesse peut √™tre consid√©r√© comme du harc√®lement, quels que soient les outils de protection de la vie priv√©e utilis√©s sur la plateforme.

2. L'agr√©gation, la publication et/ou la diffusion de donn√©es d√©mographiques, personnelles ou priv√©es d'une personne sans autorisation expresse (appel√©e officieusement doxing ou dropping dox) peut √™tre consid√©r√©e comme du harc√®lement.

3. Inciter des utilisatrices ou utilisateurs √† engager une autre utilisatrice ou utilisateur dans une interaction ou dans une discussion continue apr√®s que l‚Äôon ait demand√© que √ßa cesse (ce que l'on appelle officieusement brigading ou dogpiling) peut √™tre consid√©r√© comme du harc√®lement.

Nonobstant ces dispositions, l'administration du service se r√©serve le droit de r√©voquer les autorisations d'acc√®s de tout utilisateur, √† tout moment, pour quelque raison que ce soit, sauf dans les cas limit√©s par la loi.

R√àGLES DU SERVEUR

1. Faites aux autres ce que vous pensez qu'ils voudraient qu'on leur fasse.

2. Identifiez les contenus sensibles par un avertissement.

3. Les contenus ill√©gaux tels que la p√©dopornographie sont, √©videmment, interdits.

4. La pornographie en g√©n√©ral n'est pas autoris√©e.

5. L'absence de r√®gle sp√©cifique contre un certain comportement ne signifie pas que l'on accepte ce comportement. Chacun d'entre nous dispose d'un temps limit√© dans ce monde. Ne soyez pas un imb√©cile.

6. Les discours haineux et les comportements abusifs ou mena√ßants ne sont pas autoris√©s, en particulier ceux qui ciclent un genre, une nationalit√©, une religion, une race, un √¢ge, une pr√©f√©rence en mati√®re de garniture de pizza ou une identit√© sexuelle. En revanche, on peut d√©tester Systemd √† loisir sur ce serveur.

7. La violation d'une ou plusieurs de ces r√®gles peut entra√Æner un bannissement imm√©diat et permanent, sans pr√©avis ni avertissement.

8. Il est interdit d'usurper l'identit√© d'une personne ou d'une marque sans indiquer clairement que le compte n'est pas officiel et/ou qu'il s'agit d'une parodie. Les comptes parodiques sont autoris√©s, tout comme les comptes de marques l√©gitimes.

9. L'obsc√©nit√© gratuite qui n'apporte aucun avantage pratique √† la discussion n'est pas autoris√©e.

10. Pri√®re de n‚Äôutiliser que l‚Äôanglais et le fran√ßais. Nous n'avons pas d'√©quipe de mod√©ration pour les autres langues en ce moment.

Description:
Welcome!

This is wetdry.world, a community website running on a custom branch of Mastodon (we call it Chuckya!) focused on gaming, tech, humor, and generally whatever you may be interested in. We are connected to the wider "fedisphere", a large network of thousands of interconnected social websites, which means that a single account here on wetdry.world lets you interact and chat with millions of people from across the entire web!

We host some other stuff here as well:

  • XMPP chat (provided for active members, just ask for an account!)
  • A port of the Akkoma frontend
  • A Tor hidden service
  • More soon...

We also run a sister website with a shared community, lethallava.land, which runs on the Sharkey software instead.

Mobile apps

Mobile apps are available! Any app that works with Mastodon should work, however we recommend these apps in particular because they support the custom features we have:

  • iOS: Feditext (currently in beta, message the linked account to join their TestFlight program!)
  • Android: Moshidon (fork of the official Mastodon Android app, adds many useful/missing features)

Credits

We use resources/custom emoji from the following sources:

  • Blobfox (Apache 2.0), drgn, Neocat, and Neofox (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) by Volpeon
  • Blobcats by various people, licensed under Apache 2.0
  • Mastodon Modern by Freeplay, licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0
  • so happy smiling cat by puamelia, licensed under CC BY-SA 2.0
  • Neorat by Onemuri

Donate

We don't run any ads, sell data, or charge for usage; the funding to keep this site running comes from optional monthly donations. If you enjoy this place, please consider saying thanks by leaving a tip on Patreon or Ko-fi!

Wet-Dry World, also known as Wet-Dry Land, is the eleventh course in Super Mario 64 and Super Mario 64 DS, and it takes place within flooded ruins, separated into an undeveloped uptown that the player starts in and an underground downtown further into the level. The entrance to the course is the large painting with the Skeeter on it on the Mushroom Castle's second floor. Unique to this course is the ability to raise or lower the water level based on where the painting is entered; the lower the painting is entered, the lower the water level, and the higher the painting is entered, the higher the water level. - Super Mario Wiki
Short: We are a community based around gaming, tech, entertainment, and more! Come join the Scuttlebug jamboree! (Signups currently undergoing manual review.)

Description:
The Union Place is union-oriented and intended for union members, organizations, friends, and allies. That doesn't mean all of your content has to be about unions, of course. Just follow the rules and code of conduct and you'll be in good shape!

Sign-ups are moderated ("waitlist") but we try to review and approve them quickly (see "Service Level Objectives" below). You can help us out by providing a good reason you're interested in The Union Place. If you have a connection to the labor / union movements it'll tell a much better story than "Twitter is exploding". English is preferred for sign-up reasons.

We have committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant and will provide at least 3 months' notice before ceasing operations.

Server thumbnail and mascot by @McCarrick@toot.community.

Hosting & Operations

The Union Place is owned and operated by Labor Union Networking, Inc., a Delaware corporation formed with the intent of filing for federal non-profit status (application pending). Tim Wilde, a proud AWU-CWA member, is currently the sole director of Labor Union Networking, Inc.

The Union Place is hosted on Google Cloud infrastructure. It is a personal project and is not sponsored, approved, or affiliated with Google in any way.

Donations

Labor Union Networking, Inc. is up and ready to receive (non-tax-deductible, for now) donations! Here are some options:

  • Open Collective
  • Ko-Fi
  • Directly with Stripe
  • PayPal
  • Venmo @union-place

Please reach out to @tim@union.place if you have any problems or questions.

Administration

Our administrators are:

  • @tim@union.place
  • @josh@union.place
  • @crs@union.place

Our moderators are:

  • @kabrams@union.place

You may reach out to any of our admins or moderators, use the "Report" button within the Mastodon interface, or contact the e-mail address listed under "contact" above (not repeated just to reduce spambot collection, sorry) with any administrative or moderation issues.

Service Level Objective (SLO)

We aim to review new account requests every 2-4 hours throughout the day, but are likely to do less review during the United States overnight.

We aim to review all content reports ASAP, but ask that you give us at least 12 hours to respond, particularly overnight.

‚ÄâTerms of Service &‚ÄâPrivacy Policy

Use of this instance is subject to the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.

Code of Conduct

Version: 1.3.2

Last updated: 4 November 2023

TL;DR:

The Union Place has a zero-tolerance policy for racism, antisemitism, Islamophobia, xenophobia, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, and other forms of discriminatory and bigoted conduct.

Sexually graphic and violent imagery is not permitted on The Union Place.

Harassment of other Fediverse users is not permitted on The Union Place.

Harmful content that is provably false (for example, ‚Äú5G causes coronavirus‚Äù or ‚Äúvaccines cause autism‚Äù) is not allowed, will be removed, and may result in an account suspension.

Sexual harassment is an instant ban.

Transphobic content is an instant ban.

Far-right content and expression of far-right ideologies, and/or content which advocates/encourages/incites far-right extremism are an instant ban.

We reserve the right to suspend your account at any time.

Updates to this Document

We may update this document from time to time for reasons including:

  • clarifying terms,
  • addressing new forms of harassment, or
  • addressing harmful community behaviors.

In the event of any changes to this policy, we will notify you via an announcement posted via the Mastodon administration system.

Any changes to the Code of Conduct come into effect immediately.

The Long Version

Final interpretation of the following guidelines is up to the administration of The Union Place and is at our sole discretion. They are posted here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies and procedures.

I. User Accounts

The Union Place is open to all union members, organizations, friends, and allies. Content posted on The Union Place need not be entirely, or even majority, union or labor-movement related.

Given the broad consensus among many marginalized and progressive communities that police unions are not a true part of the labor movement, police unions are not welcome on The Union Place. We will not specifically screen to prevent members of police unions from joining, but content pushing a pro-police and pro-police union agenda will be considered unacceptable. Police union locals and other directly-related advocacy groups are not eligible to maintain an account on The Union Place.

II. Unacceptable Content

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

  • Nudity that has not been:
    • Appropriately tagged, and
    • Masked behind a Content Warning.

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may be removed entirely:

  • Excessive advertising, and
  • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources.

The following types of content will be removed, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

  • Pro-police and pro-police union content,
  • Pornography and sexually explicit or graphic content, including artistic depictions,
    • We welcome labor organizing among sex workers,
  • Any gore and/or extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions,
    • We welcome documentation of current events, such as clashes that break out at protests, but require use of content warnings on both content and images,
  • Racism or advocation of racism,
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism,
  • Content harmful to the public good, examples including:
    • ‚Äú5G causes coronavirus‚Äù
    • ‚ÄúVaccines cause autism‚Äù (or, for clarity, any other anti-science and anti-vaccine content)
  • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism.
  • Content that is illegal in the United States and the Commonwealth of Virginia, or material encouraging, instructing, or soliciting others to break the law.
    • This point shall not be applied with regards to matters regarding civil rights movements, civil disobedience and labor actions, access to reproductive rights and education, LGBTQIA+ rights and education, regardless of contested status under the law.
    • We welcome discussions which remain academic, regarding past lived personal experience, or theoretical in nature, but require use of content warnings.
    • We acknowledge that there are several murky legal grey areas, and would like to remind users that Content posted on the Internet, and by extension the Instance, is never truly private.

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed, and will result in permanent revocation of access to the service:

  • Sexual harassment,
  • Content discriminating against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof, including transphobic content, *‚ÄâAbleism and discrimination against disabled individuals or people with disabilities,
  • Inappropriate content (advocating, encouraging, or inciting pedophilia, zoophilia, or other related illegal paraphilias, any material relating therein),
  • Antisemitism, Islamophobia, and xenophobia, and/or content which advocates/encourages/incites such,
  • Far-right content and expression of far-right ideologies, and/or content which advocates/encourages/incites far-right extremism,
  • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism,
    • Academic discussion criticising viewpoints such as Holocaust denialism may be had, but require use of content warnings,
    • Photographs from events and news coverage which include imagery which would be illegal in Germany and/or France may be posted marked sensitive and require use of content warnings,
    • Our servers are hosted in the United States; other content under that law will be addressed on a case-by-case basis at the discretion of the administration team with consideration for any municipalities that are directly involved, as well as whether it complies with the rest of the Code of Conduct and Terms of Service,
  • Genocide denialism, as well as material which promotes, advocates for, or encourages genocides whether past or present, and
  • Conduct promoting, advocating for, or encouraging any far-right ideology.

III. Harassment

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service and/or referral to the appropriate law enforcement agency, at our discretion.

Harassment includes the following behaviors:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion,
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment,
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of ‚Äòdead‚Äô or rejected names,
  • Simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like ‚Äúhug‚Äù or ‚Äúbackrub‚Äù) without consent or after a request to stop,
  • Threats of violence,
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to engage in self-harm or to commit suicide,
  • Deliberate intimidation,
  • Stalking or following,
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes,
  • Sustained disruption of discussion,
  • Unwelcome sexual attention,
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others,
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease,
  • Deliberate ‚Äúouting‚Äù of any aspect of a person‚Äôs identity without their consent,
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication,
  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed,
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (doxing or dropping dox),
  • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (brigading or dogpiling).

The Union Place prioritizes the safety of marginalized people over the comfort of privileged people. As a result, we will not act on complaints regarding, but not limited to:

  • ‚ÄòReverse‚Äô -isms, including ‚Äòreverse racism,‚Äô ‚Äòreverse sexism,‚Äô and ‚Äòcisphobia‚Äô,
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as ‚Äòleave me alone‚Äô, ‚Äògo away‚Äô, or ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not discussing this with you‚Äô,
  • Communicating in a ‚Äòtone‚Äô you don‚Äôt find congenial, and
  • Criticizing racist, sexist, cis-sexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions.

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a user of The Union Place, notice that someone else is being harassed, please report using the ‚ÄòReport‚Äô feature in the application.

This Code of Conduct applies to The Union Place, but if you are being harassed by a user of The Union Place outside of the Service, we still want to know about it.

We will take all good-faith reports of harassment by The Union Place members seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment that took place at any point in time. The administration team of The Union Place reserve the right to exclude people from The Union Place based on their past behavior, including behavior outside The Union Place spaces and behavior towards people who are not users of The Union Place.

Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted without response.

For reporting regarding copyright and DMCA violation, please see our DMCA‚ÄâPolicy.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Meta & Credits

Our Code of Conduct is based off of the Code of Conduct from https://cloudisland.nz with credit to Geek Feminism and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Rules based on those of https://hachyderm.io/.

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

This instance also uses Treehouse Pride Flag emoji from https://gitea.treehouse.systems/treehouse/emoji.
Short: The Union Place: a federated server for union members, organizations, friends, and allies. If you support labor and labor rights, you have a place here!

Description:
This instance is open to researchers and practitioners in computer systems, including students, faculty, and industry professionals. Systems is broadly defined here -- it includes operating systems, distributed systems, networking, databases, architecture, and more. People in adjacent fields are welcome as well.

Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and inclusion make our community strong. We encourage participation from the most varied and diverse backgrounds possible and want to be very clear about where we stand.
  • Our goal is to maintain a safe, helpful and friendly community for everyone, regardless of experience, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, or other defining characteristic.
  • Rules are detailed above. If you are the subject of, or witness to any violations of this Code of Conduct, please contact the administrators. If violations occur, administrators will take any action they deem appropriate for the infraction, up to and including expulsion.

This server is administered by Dan Ports.
Short: Discussion of computer systems research & practice -- OSes, distributed systems, networks, databases, architecture, etc -- for researchers, academics, & professionals.

Description:
This is "emacs.ch", a mastodon instance for the #Emacs community and #GNU #FOSS enthusiasts. Everyone is welcome, even #Vim users!

We share Emacs tips and news here and you'll encounter some well-known Emacs faces here.

In addition, this instance is fully integrated in Fediverse and may be used for personal and general purposes. The general tone is inspirational and encouraging. Posting about politics and religion is discouraged, but not prohibited. In general, anything that is not explicitly forbidden is allowed (see server rules). We also have some bots that keep you up to date with the Emacs community on the web (e.g. MELPA updates and various RSS feeds). You are also welcome to run your own bots as long as they are related to the theme of the server.

The whole thing is run and paid for privately by the instance owner, an #Emacs fan like you, and user donations. He expects nothing from you, except that you feel comfortable here and make a few valuable friends.

The server is currently hosted in Helsinki, Finland and has plenty of resources. There are daily backups for seven days. There is no tracking and your data will not be shared. We run the Mastodon Glitch edition with extended features and update ever 2 weeks. Should anything change in the operation of the server, we will give you at least three months notice to find a new home in Fediverse.

Please consider donating to our instance, if you feel at home here:

https://liberapay.com/emacs-ch

Questions? Please consult our FAQ:

https://faq.emacs.ch
Short: A safe and friendly Mastodon instance, operated for Emacs, Lisp and FOSS enthusiasts, developers and all open-minded humans. 5000 character limit.

Description:
√úber diese Mastodon-Instanz

Entwurf vom 25. Juni 2019

  • Impressum
  • Urheberrecht/Copyright
  • Grunds√§tze und Leitlinien
  • Vertraulichkeit und Sicherheit von Direktnachrichten
  • Verhaltenskodex (Code of Conduct)
  • Geblockte Instanzen

Impressum

Diese Mastodon-Instanz wird betrieben von

NETZBEGR√úNUNG ‚Äì Verein f√ºr gr√ºne Netzkultur e.V.
c/o Nico Ach
Heilig-Kreuz-Stra√üe 16
86609 Donauw√∂rth
Telefon +49 (0) 906 29 99 40-0
backoffice (at) netzbegruenung (punkt) de

Vertretungsberechtigter Vorstand

Stephan Clemens, Nico Ach (Anschrift wie oben)

Verantwortlich f√ºr den Inhalt nach ¬ß 55 Abs. 2 RStV

Nico Ach (Anschrift wie oben)

Urheberrecht/Copyright

Die Nutzer*innen der Plattform sind Urheber*innen ihrer eigenen Beitr√§ge. Bitte wenden Sie Sich zur Kl√§rung von Nutzungsrechten an Beitr√§gen direkt an die/den jewilige*n Urheber*in.

Sollten Sie Verst√∂√üe gegen das Urheberrecht feststellen, melden Sie diese bitte an die oben unter Impressum genannten Kontaktdaten, damit wir die L√∂schung der entsprechenden Inhalte veranlassen k√∂nnen.

Grunds√§tze und Leitlinien

Diese Mastodon-Instanz soll Mitgliedern und Gliederungen von B√úNDNIS 90/DIE GR√úNEN, der GR√úNEN Jugend, sowie von Netzbegr√ºnung e. V. die M√∂glichkeit geben, an dezentralen sozialen Netzwerken teilzuhaben. Der Betrieb einer eigenen Instanz im Umfeld der GR√úNEN soll dabei helfen, Individuen und Gliederungen wie Orts- und Kreisverb√§nde untereinander zu vernetzen und innerhalb des Mastodon- und ActivityPub-Netzwerks ("Fediverse") eigenst√§ndige Community zu schaffen.

Das Angebot befindet sich derzeit in der Erprobungsphase. Wir sammeln Erfahrungen in Bezug auf die administrativen Aufw√§nde, sowohl technischer als auch nicht-technischer Natur.

Aktuell tragen wir als Netzbegr√ºnung e. V. die Kosten des Betriebs. F√ºr Nutzerinnen und Nutzer ist das Angebot im Moment kostenlos.

Wir k√∂nnen keine Gew√§hrleistung f√ºr die Verf√ºgbarkeit dieses Angebots bieten.

Zum aktuellen Zeitpunkt k√∂nnen wir noch nicht absch√§tzen, ob dieses Angebot langfristig bestehen bleiben wird. Falls wir eine Entscheidung treffen sollten, den Betrieb einzustellen, werden wir alle Nutzer*innen informieren und die Plattform noch mindestens einen Monat lang weiter in Betrieb halten. Damit sollte allen Nutzer*innen die M√∂glichkeit gegeben sein, ihre Daten zu exportieren und ggf. einen Umzug auf eine andere Instanz zu organisieren.

Diese Mastodon-Instanz versteht sich als Angebot von Menschen f√ºr Menschen. Wir bitten daher darum, hier von Experimenten mit bots und automatisierten Postings abzusehen. Daf√ºr eignen sich Instanzen wie beispielsweise botsin.space.

Wir behalten uns vor, den Austausch mit Instanzen zu beschr√§nken bzw. zu blockieren, die aus einem Grund oder mehreren Gr√ºnden nicht mit unseren Werten und √úberzeugungen im Einklang stehen. Beispiele f√ºr m√∂gliche Gr√ºnde:

  • Verbreitung von rechtsradikalen oder menschenverachtenden Botschaften
  • Verbreitung von Bildern und Filmen, auf denen sexuelle Gewalt an Kindern zu sehen ist
  • Verbreitung von Holocaust-Leugnungen

Eine Liste der geblockten Instanzen ver√∂ffentlichen wir am Ende dieser Seite.

√Ñnderungen an diesen Leitlinien oder dem Verhaltenskodex werden sowohl per Mastdon (von TODO) als auch per E-Mail und ggf. unter blog.netzbegruenung.de bekannt gegeben.

Vertraulichkeit und Sicherheit von Direktnachrichten

Mastodon und kompatible Plattformen bieten die M√∂glichkeit, nicht-√∂ffentliche Direktnachrichten mit anderen Nutzer*innen auszutauschen. Bitte versteht diese Funktion nicht als Ersatz f√ºr sichere Nachrichten-Plattformen mit Ende-zu-Ende-Verschl√ºsselung. Zieht die nachfolgenden Informationen in Betracht, wenn Ihr entscheidet, f√ºr welche Art von Kommunikation Ihr diese Funktion nutzen m√∂chtet.

F√ºr uns als Betreiber, die Netzbegr√ºnung e. V., besteht technisch die M√∂glichkeit, Einblick in alle Nachrichten zu nehmen, die Nutzer*innen auf dieser Instanz erhalten oder senden. Das gilt auch f√ºr Direktnachrichten. Es ist jedoch Teil unseres Selbstverst√§ndnis als Betreiber von Kommunikationsinfrastruktur, dass wir niemals von dieser M√∂glichkeit Gebrauch machen werden. Gleichzeitig ist es nicht ausgeschlossen, dass wir beispielsweise in Fehlermeldungen oder Logs auch mit Inhalten von Direktnachrichten konfrontiert werden, ohne dies zu beabsichtigen.

Die gleichen technische M√∂glichkeiten, die wir auf gruene.social haben, haben auch die Admins anderer Instanzen, mit denen Ihr Nachrichten austauscht.

Verhaltenskodex (Code of Conduct)

Als Nutzer*in von gruene.social erkenne ich den folgenden Verhaltenskodex an und erkl√§re, mich dem entsprechend zu verhalten.

  • Ich achte die W√ºrde meiner Mitmenschen und Mitnutzer*innen.
  • Ich beachte die geltenden Gesetze, insbesondere das Urheberrecht, das Pers√∂nlichkeitsrecht und den Datenschutz.
  • Sollte ich Inhalte, insbesondere Ton, Video und Bild, ver√∂ffentlichen, die andere verst√∂ren k√∂nnten, beispielsweise durch Darstellung von Gewalt, verwende ich die Funktion "als heikle Medien markieren".
  • Sollte ich eine Verletzung der Regeln dieses Kodex bemerken, nehme ich das nicht stillschweigend hin, sondern informiere ich die Moderator*innen @moderation.
Short: Die Mastodon-Instanz f√ºr B√úNDNIS 90/DIE GR√úNEN, betrieben von Netzbegr√ºnung e.V.
