Description:
Staff

  • Admin: @Rusty
  • Moderator: @LeoTheLeopardNZ
  • Updates & Announcements: @Babmin

Donations

üö´ Currently Unavailable üö´

Server Banner

  • @GoodBoyLiger They donated our awesome banner and @Babmin's icon. Check out their profile!

This server aims to provide a safe space for 18+ furry ABDLs who identify with any age, be they babyfur, kidfur, teenfur, caretaker, and so on! This server is open to anyone who partakes in or is curious about the furry ABDL community. All fluffies, scalies, and humans are welcome, crinkling not required! However, expect to see many types of crinkly critters, their photos, and their art on this instance.

Please be aware that this is an ABDL/babyfur space and as such our Content Warning policy around ABDL material may be more relaxed than other furry servers.

Note: Our name is cubhub.social but cub porn is NOT allowed.

Why The Name?

I picked the name 'CubHub.social' because, despite the current negative connotation around the word 'cub', CubHubs were the first places at furry conventions I felt safe being an ABDL while also coming to grips with my furry side. For those who don't know, CubHubs are private rooms/party rooms that serve as safe spaces for babyfurs, kidfurs, diaperfurs, etc at conventions. Before ABDLs were as accepted into the fandom as they are now, CubHubs were the only place where it was absolutely safe to be yourself. So, yeah, I couldn't think of a better ethos to bring to the Fediverse. I want CubHub to be a safe space on Fedi for all fuzzy ABDLs.

Content Warnings & Moderation

Content Warnings

We require warnings on certain types of material posted in both text posts and image posts.

FAQs for Content Warnings on Media:

This list is not exhaustive. These are simply the CWs we get asked about the most. Please read the Rules Section below for a more general but comprehensive list.

No Content Warning Needed:

  • ABDL Clothing
  • Clean or Soggy Diapers
  • SFW ABDL/Furry Art
  • Fursuits
  • Pup Hoods and Harnesses if Clothed Underneath
  • Light/Cutesy Age Regression or Hypnosis
  • Diaper Pats/Play Swatting

Content Warning Needed:

  • Political Posts
  • Depictions or Detailed Descriptions of Drug/Alcohol Use
  • Nudity or Sex/Yiff
  • Leaking or Messy Diapers
  • Watersports/Wetting Through Clothes
  • Obvious Erections Under Clothing/Tented Diapers
  • Murrsuits With Genitalia Showing
  • Heavy/Extreme Bondage
  • Needles
  • Heavier Age Regression or Hypnosis (unwilling subjects, mental destruction-- use your best judgment here since it's a gray area)
  • Spanking/Red Cheeks/Impact Play
  • Every story post regardless of whether it's SFW just so users know what they're reading before they do.

Recommended But Not Required

  • ABDL/Furry Fandom Discourse
  • Photos Cropped to a Diapered Crotch/Butt

Note: You cannot use content warnings too much! If you're on the fence or you'd rather CW a post even if it's not required, we recommend that you do so. It also helps when users follow you who may not be into the same subject matter as you are!

Content Warning How-To

There is a ‚ö†Ô∏è button under your post compose box. When clicking on it, it'll open a new text box that'll let you fill out a description of the post content.

When tagging, be concise but also descriptive of the contents of the post. Examples being, don't say 'NSFW' but instead try 'Messy Diapers' or 'M/M Yiff'. Similarly, don't say 'News', try 'US Politics, Elections' to help out non-US users.

Content warning moderation isn't particularly strict. If your post is missing a Content Warning, a staff member will usually mark it as sensitive and ask that you add CW tags to it. If the user doesn't respond to the request, a moderator will delete the post and let the user redraft it with the CW's included. Repeatedly failing to use CWs will result in a time-out and your video games taken away.

Moderation

Failure to adhere to the server rules may lead to something as simple as a warning, up through content removal, silencing, and a ban. If you feel action taken against you was incorrect, you may appeal the action to the administration. However, we have a zero tolerance policy for hate speech or pro-fascist imagery of any kind, and it will result in an immediate ban with no appeal. Nazi symbols, Confederate imagery, Pro-Russian invasion of Ukraine, and Blue Lives Matter talk are all unwelcome here.

Reporting Posts

If a post violates our rules, we ask that users fill out a report for the moderation staff. Please do not confront other users directly.

Reporting Posts from Other Instances

If a post from another server appears in our federated timeline and has content that breaks our rules, please report it! If it's art that's simply missing a CW, a moderator can mark it as sensitive. If it's something more egregious, the user or even the instance can be limited or defederated from us.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please do not select the "Forward to [instance]" option in the report unless you verify that the post breaks the rules of their home server as well. Servers have different rules and what may be inappropriate here may be entirely appropriate elsewhere!

Tips & Tricks

Hashtags

Using Hashtags

Using hashtags immensely boosts the visibility of your posts! Because there are no algorithms, it's up to users to find the content they want to see. As such, using hashtags makes discoverability much easier. #FurryArt, #ABDLArt, or #BabyfurArt are all hashtags people are following and will mean your post will be seen by more users.

Following Hashtags

Mastodon allows you to follow hashtags so you can have any posts tagged with a hashtag show up in your Home timeline. To follow a hashtag, type the hashtag you want to follow in the search box then hit the follow button in the top right corner.

Roleplaying

As our community has such a large roleplaying community, we recommend users indicate whether or not they roleplay in their profile. Users looking to roleplay should check the profile of the person they're interacting with to see if they're up for it and ask if they're unsure.

Image Accessibility

When posting images, we implore all users to include a description of what is in the image by providing alt text. To add alt text, click the edit button while you're posting your picture and fill in the details under "Describe for the visually impaired" and save it. This really helps users with accessibility needs! Many Mastodon users will only boost images with alt text, so it's a good habit to get into.

Markdown In Posts

You can use Markdown in your posts by clicking the icon below the compose box that looks like a sheet of paper, then clicking Markdown. You can set your posts to default to Markdown by going into your Settings > Preferences > Other > Default format for toots and selecting Markdown.

If you're new to markdown, try this Markdown Tool here.

Federation

Any user you follow from another instance will then federate with our server. This means any and all posts they make will appear on our federated timeline, unless the server has been limited (see the Moderated Servers section below).

If a user/post isn't federated with us that you want to follow/like/boost, you can copy the link to the user/post into the CubHub search box and our server will federate it, thus allowing you to interact.

CubHub Interface Tweaks

Our server runs a version of Mastodon based on Ruffy that's a fork of Glitch-Soc. Ruffy has a two-column theme, customizable accent colors, emoji reactions, and much more.

To see all of the available options to tweak the look of CubHub, click the two cog wheels in the top right of the desktop interface, or Interface settings in the overflow menu of the mobile interface on the bottom right!

Mobile Apps

While the default Mastodon mobile app is good enough, it's missing features that are custom to CubHub. To this end, we recommend that Android users use either Megalodon or Moshidon. From there, users can go to Overflow Menu > Settings > Instance and turn on Enable post formatting, Enable emoji reactions, and Server supports local-only posting and make sure Glitch local-only mode is off.

Server Information

Transparency Pledge

We want to run this instance with as much transparency as possible. Please, if users have any questions at all, contact anyone on the moderation or administration staff. If there are any moderation questions, technical questions about the server, and so on, we'd be more than glad to answer them.

The Server's Longevity

A lot of users have concerns about admins abruptly shutting down their instances and the users losing what they've built. CubHub is completely and utterly committed to keeping the server going long-term and continuing to be a place for furry ABs, DLs, middles, grown-ups, etc to congregate. However, in the event of something catastrophic, here is our pledge:

  1. If the admin is unable to continue to administrating the server, the server will be handed over to someone the community has approved of running the instance.
  2. If a replacement can't be found, the server will remain up for at least 30 days from the initial notice of closure, so users can migrate their content and their followers to a new instance with plenty of notice.

A Note From Rusty: This is like some worst case scenario stuff, but I want people to feel safe hosting their content here and know there's a backup plan in the event of catastrophe. I love running this instance and I love this community and I really don't wanna go anywhere!

Server Costs

  • Server Host: $72.00 Monthly
  • Daily Backups: $10.00 Monthly
  • S3 Storage: ‚âà$2.00 Monthly
  • Domain Registrar: $46.16 Yearly
  • Email Server: $95.00 Bi-Yearly

Note: Our S3 storage hosts things like our pictures, videos, and other media. It tends to fluctuate and should very slowly climb in cost over time, though likely not by much.

Custom Emojis

If you would like to see a particular emoji set added, please DM the administration! Tip: You can hover the mouse cursor over or tap on an emoji in a post or profile to expand it and see it better.

Credits

Our Blobfox, BunHD, drgn, Fox, Neofox, Raccoon, and vlpn custom emoji packs are created and provided by Volpeon! Check out their profile at @volpeon@is-a.wyvern.rip

Our Blobhaj and Blobhaj Flags emojis are provided by HeatherHorns! Check out their profile at @heatherhorns@plush.city

Our blobcat emojis were provided by Nitro Blob Hub and are licensed under Apache 2.0

Hormse by VahnAndMyra

Translation Tool

CubHub has a translation button for posts that do not match your interface language. This service uses DeepL. This means that, in order for posts to be translated, they will be sent to the DeepL servers for translation. Please refer to their Privacy Policy for any privacy or data security concerns. DeepL is fully GDPR compliant.

You must have your post language set correctly in order for the translation tool to work properly. You can select your language in the compose box next to the CW button.

Description:
Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.

  • You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
  • Read more on post and account visibility here

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, you‚Äôre not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

  • United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
  • Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

Tor access

We also offer a way to access mstdn.social via the Tor network with our own .onion URL address.

You can access mstdn.social on Tor via http://ca27gi2fcsvqyi3g25f2baaycshu4ffd2tf4cnnn5nchlfw5xmjjj5id.onion/about

‚òï Coffee networking, back in your cup!

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic‚Äîyou decide who you want to see!

Be sure to check our Terms & Code of Conduct.

Support the community

Since we do not serve ads and we do not sell data we rely on your support. If you like you can donate to help us out a little.

You can help out the community by donating in several ways:

  • Become a Patron
  • Support with PayPal
  • Credit Card Direct
  • Support on LiberaPay
  • Buy us a Ko-Fi

Staff

In addition to the site's owner, @stux Mastodon.Coffee's moderation staff include:

  • @CoffeeGang
  • @catswhocode
  • @GivMeCoffee
  • @freeplay

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Description:
Welcome to VT Social!

NOTE: Please read the "Joining VT Social" section below before applying, or we may reject your application.

VT Social is a fediverse instance for VTubers run by VTubers. Our goal is to provide a space for VTubers and VTuber-adjacent content creators, so we can connect with each other and have a place for fans to discover our content.

About us

VT Social is run by Lina, a tech VTuber with a passion for VTuber technology and empowering everyone to be a VTuber. She spends most of her time working on open source GPU drivers, and also has experience with systems administration. She decided to start this instance to provide a place for all other VTubers to gather together! ‚ú®

Our instance is based on the glitch-soc fork of Mastodon, which adds things like better notification controls and the ability to use formatting in posts (our own fork is here and it's based on the Treehouse version, in case you're curious!). Over time, we plan to modify Mastodon to add better tools for VTubers to share their content and allow others to find it.

This instance is hosted on our own hardware at a data center, and we have plans for expanding it and scaling it to be able to host everyone! We know VTubers love to post images and videos, so we are especially committed to having enough storage for all of you, starting with over 10TB of space right off the bat and able to scale up! Right now the instance is still on default settings for upload limits, but we will be optimizing it and customizing it to give everyone better options soon.

The VT Social logo is based on a concept by K.O.D.A., itself inspired by the nullptr::live logo by soundflora*.

Rules and guidelines

Please see our instance rules below for the official policy, but in summary: we want VT Social to be a friendly space for all VTubers free of harassment or abuse. We're all in this together trying to have a good time and connect with fans and supporters, and we hope you are too! Here are a few guidelines to keep in mind:

  • Be friendly with fellow VTubers! Light-hearted rivalry is okay, but don't let it escalate into name-calling or attacks. We all want to coexist together, not fight!
  • Be respectful of others' identities and styles. VTubing gives us the power to be whoever we want to be - embrace it for yourself and for others!
  • Don't discuss the IRL identities of other VTubers, including speculation. This is considered on par with doxxing! Let's respect each others' privacy!
  • Don't sexualize others or make advances on them without consent. Many people aren't comfortable with that!
  • Tag all R18/NSFW content as sensitive, and add a CW if necessary (e.g. gore). Do not direct suggestive/NSFW content at minors, nor involve minors or minor-presenting personas in such content.

This instance allows R18/NSFW images, but all such content must be tagged as sensitive, and you should add CWs as necessary. The line for what counts as NSFW varies by culture, but we expect all content depicting sex acts (censored or not) or genitalia to be marked as such. We recommend that users who frequently post such content enable the "Always mark media as sensitive" option under Preferences ‚Üí Other, and accounts primarily aimed at an 18+ audience must clearly mention "18+" in the bio. If you repeatedly fail to mark media as sensitive, we will mark your account as enforced-sensitive.

We do reserve the right to use our own judgement in difficult cases, and may ask you to tone it down or remove certain content if we think it is necessary. And although we hope to never have to resort to it, if we ever have to ask someone to leave the instance, we will give them enough time to use the Fediverse migration tools to move their account and followers to another instance.

Joining VT Social

VT Social is open to all VTubers and content creators who work with them! To make sure the people on the instance are genuine creators, we ask that you prove who you are and show that you are an active content creator.

  • If you are a VTuber, you need to have at least 2 stream VODs or videos using your avatar (2D, 3D, PNG) totaling at least 1 hour of content.
  • If you are a VTuber-related content creator or illustrator, you need to have created official content/illustration work for one or more VTubers at least two times, or be actively involved in a VTuber-centric creation or development project. VTuber managers are also welcome.
  • Illustrators with a focus on VTuber fanart are also welcome, as long as it is a significant part of your work and welcome by the VTubers you draw (memes don't count!).

These are not hard rules, and we are open to being flexible as long as you are part of the VTubing community!

In order to prove that you are who you say you are, please add your desired username (@someone@vt.social) to a website or social media page you control, and link it when you request an account on the instance (bio, tweets, subpages, posts, files on a domain, etc. are all fine). When you request an account, please tell us:

  • A little bit about yourself and what you do (just one sentence or two is enough)
  • A link to your verification post/page (you need to mention your VT Social username there!)
  • A link to your existing content
  • If you are a manager or otherwise associated with a VTuber, a link that we can use to verify your relationship

Please post a tweet or make mention of your application on your socials, so we can verify who you are! Something like "I'm joining VT Social at @myusername@vt.social", or even just "I'm applying for a VT Social account!" if you use the same username on both sites is all we need. You can also add your @myusername@vt.social ID to your bio instead. Please link to the post/tweet/bio when you apply, and tell us what you did if it's not obvious, so we can verify you quickly! This helps us make sure the person creating the account is not an imposter claiming to be you.

What if I'm just getting started and I don't have any content yet?

No worries! You can sign up on any other instance, and then, once you have some content, move to VT Social! Mastodon and the Fediverse allow you to move your account over and bring all your old followers, and make sure anyone who lands on your old account gets redirected to your new one.

What about fans?

Thanks to the awesomeness of the fediverse, you can connect with fans hosted on any other instance! We want to focus on the content creators themselves, so that we can help fans discover their content and find new VTubers to follow all in one place, as well as connect together VTubers and artists, modelers, riggers, and more. We think we can do a better job by working to make the best instance for creators, instead of having a general-purpose instance where anyone can sign up.

Federation policy

VT Social federates with everyone by default, and we only preemptively defederate instances in egregious cases (e.g. instances run by known serial harassers or openly hosting and condoning hate groups). However, we do expect all instances to have basic moderation and rules forbidding harassment. If we receive multiple reports from users of an instance, and it does not appear to have such rules nor be moderated appropriately, we will defederate it in order to protect our users. If you admin such an instance and have corrected the situation, please email lina@asahilina.net in order to request to have federation reinstated.

Content legality and CWs

VT Social is hosted in Japan and subject to Japanese law. We recognize that there are certain classes of content on other instances which many users may not wish to see, and which may vary in legality in other countries. For instances which host large amounts of such content without the appropriate CWs or sensitive tags, we may use media restrictions to effectively mark such media as sensitive in public timelines. We plan to work on our own improvements to Mastodon in the future, to provide finer-grained controls so that we can ensure we don't create unnecessary divisions between communities while empowering our users to decide what kinds of content they wish to see, and balance their own risk of exposure to unwanted content. At VT Social, we expect our own users to use sensitive tags and CWs appropriately, and have stricter policies for content on the instance as mentioned above.
Short: The biggest VTuber instance, by VTubers for VTubers and adjacent content creators.

Description: The goal of respublicae.eu is to facilitate the discussion of European Union matters through a privacy-friendly, free and open source software. It uses Mastodon, run on Scaleway infrastructure in the EU. Respublicae.eu is not affiliated to any European Union institution. It's run and funded by private individuals. We may federate with hundreds of other fediverse instances through ActivityPub relays. Join the fediverse to follow updates from respublicae.eu and interact with them! You can find a community to join from joinmastodon.org or fediverse.party.
Short: A Mastodon forum for the discussion of European Union matters. Not run by the EU. Powered by PleromaBot, Nitter and PrivacyDev.net.

Description:
Hypnosis

HypnoGuys is a Mastodon server focused on guys who are into hypnosis, including (but not limited to) erotic applications. This is also commonly known as "erotic hypnosis" or "hypnokink". You do not have to be interested in hypnosis to join this server, but you must understand and accept that hypnosis is the theme of this server.

Gendered Space

HypnoGuys is a gendered space: as the name implies, this server is focused on guys. People of all genders and sexualities are allowed to use this server, as long as they understand that "guys" are the focus here. If you are looking for a Mastodon server focused on hypnosis without this focus on guys, Triggerphrase is an excellent option.

Note that sex and gender discrimination is not allowed on this server. Despite being a gendered space, HypnoGuys does not put down people who are not guys.

Content Warnings (CW)

Mastodon provides a "content warning" feature, where users can gate their posts behind a short piece of text, warning potential readers of what they are about to encounter. Content warnings (or CWs) must be used for content that involves explicit sex, such as fucking.

However, not all erotic content requires a CW on this server. Generally speaking, we follow the example set by the popular woof.group Mastodon server: anything that you might see in a leather bar is perfectly acceptable and does not require a content warning. Flirting, groping, jockstraps, boobs, butts, moderate impact, pup gear: no CW necessary. If you'd take it to the back bar or the playroom, use a CW. Genitals, piss, fucking, fisting, piercing, scat: CW please.

Check out the documentation for woof.group to see more about this policy.

Banned content

You may not post the following content on HypnoGuys:

  • Sexual content involving minors, including artistic depictions
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  • National Socialism
  • Nazism
  • Holocaust denial
  • Racism
  • Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
  • Gender-critical
  • Sex and gender discrimination
  • Transphobia
  • Misogyny
  • Pro-ana / Pro-mia

Banned activities

You may not engage in any of the following activities on HypnoGuys:

  • Automated sharing of third-party content, news sources, websites or social media content that doesn‚Äôt belong to you
  • Repeated trolling, insulting or derogatory comments towards others, even after they ask you to stop
  • Mass following and aggregation of content

Approved content

As long as you don't violate any of the above rules, you may post any content you want on HypnoGuys, whether related to hypnosis or not. In addition, here are some examples that are explicitly approved, and do belong on this server:

  • Discussions of hypnosis, including hypnotherapy and erotic hypnosis
  • Media related to hypnosis (such as spirals, art, photo manipulations, audio, video, etc) that you own, or that the owner has provided written permission for you to post
  • Advertising professional services related to hypnosis
  • Explicit sexual content, with an appropriate content warning
Short: A social network for guys who are into hypnosis.

Description:
We believe in the power of free open source software that is created and maintained by a passion driven community. Therefore we host a Pixelfed instance (server) on this amazingly fitting domain.

Everyone can setup and host their own image sharing community or join an excisting one like ours! With an account on one instance you are able to communicate, follow, like and share posts from people on other instances.

Build on the latest technologies to serve an ad-free platform you are familiar with.
Short: A free open source social media platform without ads or tracking! Connect with millions of people around the world on the Fediverse (Federated Universe).

Description:
Why tribe? Some history.

See also: Neotribalism.

In keeping with the spirit of the original tribe.net experience, anyone can join and moderation won't be heavy-handed.

HOWEVER, anything clearly illegal will be immediately removed and anyone that posts illegal content will be first warned, then suspended. Spammy accounts will also not be tolerated. Accounts that appear to represent businesses and post only ads will be limited to followers-only posting.

This server is located in Germany, so questions of legality will conform to German/EU law.

If I move the server, I'll update this.
Short: Welcome (back) to tribe!

Description:
A friendly space for neurodifferent folks.

This space is designed for ND (dx, self-id/dx, or questioning) folks to find each other and connect in a space that is welcoming.

Please read the rules.

About the server

Who is welcome on Neurodifferent.me?

This space is designed for ND folks to find each other and connect in a safe space that is welcoming.

We support self-identification/diagnosis as these are often inaccessible due to cost, biases and other factors. Questioning people are welcome. Many of us found our way to diagnosis by seeing ourselves reflected back through others experiences.

Note: We are an intersectional space, and just because one may not personally share an experience someone else does, does not give us the right to silence or invalidate others voicing of their own experiences, even if it makes us uncomfortable.

Content Warnings

Content Warnings (CW) are an integrated part of mastodon, and provide a method for people to choose to protect topics that may be sensitive. If you feel that something may be sensitive, or spoil someone's experience (eg. sharing about a TV show), you are encouraged to post using a CW.

Note: Users will not request other users to suppress aspects of their intersectional identities, and related experiences, behind a CW. No user should have to suppress their own identity in order to avoid complaints, reports or harassment by others.

Note: There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one.

Image descriptions

It is an expectation of this instance that you add accurate descriptions to images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is an expectation of this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description.

It is the responsibility of all users to remind each other about descriptive text, so that this is an accessible space for all.

Behaviours that may result in a ban

Racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, queerphobia, able-ism, etc. (may result in a permanent ban, you may not receive a prior warning)

Misuse of reporting mechanisms to target marginalized individuals.

Serious dishonesty that is hurtful to others.

Impersonating other people.

Harassment of any kind.

Accounts that automatically repeat a Twitter account, RSS feed, etc. must post as Unlisted, not Public.

Abuse / Weaponization of moderation/reporting

Do not attempt to weaponize our anti-abuse/reporting tools/policies against other marginalized groups.

We are an intersectional space, and just because we may not personally share an experience someone else does, does not give us the right to silence or invalidate others voicing of their own experiences, even if it makes us uncomfortable.

Attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that Black people put CW's on every discussion of race or a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I dislike straight people".)

Migrating from another instance

Create a new account on the server (neurodifferent.me).

On the new account:

  • Go to preferences -> Moving from a different account.
  • Enter the handle of the old account.
  • Click Create alias.

On your existing account:

  • Go to preferences -> import/export -> data export
  • Download the CSV file called "Follows"
  • Go to preferences -> account -> Move to a different account.
  • Enter the handle of the new account, and current account password.
  • Click Move Followers.

On the new account:

  • Go to preferences -> import/export -> data import.
  • Choose the follows file you downloaded previously.
  • Click Upload.

It will potentially take a little while for all followers to migrate across.

Any questions, please reach out to @squish@neurodifferent.me.
Short: A friendly space for neurodifferent folks.

Description:
Procrastinators and Book Lovers Unite!

Do you have a huge book backlog? Do you avoid doing things just to read? Do you read just to avoid doing things? Bookrastinating is here for you.

Bookrastinating is ad-free, anti-corporate, and federated. You can seamlessly follow and interact with users on other BookWyrm instances, and on services like Mastodon.

Follow us on Mastodon for updates: bookrastinating@citrus.farm
Short: a social book review site for people who procrastinate on reading or procrastinate by reading

Description:
<See English below>

Üdvözlünk a Mastodonon!

Sikeres belépés után felmerül a fejedben, mi is a Mastodon? Minek? Röviden, olyan, mint a Twitter, csak központosított helyett egy föderált platform. Ebb≈ël kifolyólag a Mastodon közösségek kiszolgálókra (vagy instance-okra) vannak osztva, a mi szerverünk a mastodon.elte.hu. Azért gy≈±lünk itt össze, hogy hatékonyan és lényegre tör≈ëen tudjunk megosztani gondolatokat és fontos információkat egymás között, küls≈ë zavaró tényez≈ëk nélkül.

Ismerkedjünk meg a Mastodonnal!

Ha ismered a Twittert, akkor könnyedén fogsz tudni párhuzamot húzni a kett≈ë között. Ha saját gondolatot akarsz megosztani, tülkölsz (tweet), ha tetszik más ember tülkje, megoszthatod a saját id≈ëvonaladon megtolással (retweet), és közölheted is vele tetszésedet egy kedvenccel (csillag). Megjegyzést is f≈±zhetsz egy tülkhöz.

Bal oldalon tudsz saját tülköt írni, 500 karakteres korláttal, alapvet≈ë √©s egyedi emojikkal. Tudsz fájlokat csatolni, szavazást létrehozni, meg tudod jelölni CW-vel (content warning), hogy érzékeny témába tapintasz. Van még ott egy földgömb ikon, mellyel kiválaszthatod, hogy kik láthatják a tülködet. Kiválaszthatod azt is, hogy közvetlen üzenet, ha valakivel privátban akarsz beszélni üzenet formájában. Használd a hashtag rendszert, ha azt akarod, hogy megtalálják a bejegyzéeidet a keres≈ëben. Három id≈ëvonalra van osztva a felület (saját, helyi, föderációs). Helyi id≈ëvonalon az ELTE szerveren belüli felhasználók aktivitását látod, míg a Föderációs id≈ëvonalon a helyi id≈ëvonalbeli tülköket + azok tülkjeit, akit követnek a szerver lakosai.


Szerverünk szabályzata nagy vonalakban

  1. Tartsd be az ELTE Etikai Kódexében foglalt szabályokat! (https://www.elte.hu/file/ELTE_Etikai_Kodex.pdf) 
  2. Ne posztolj olyat, ami mást kellemetlenül érint! (Például pornográf, er≈ëszakos tartalmat)
  3. Ne spamelj, és ne használd a platformot a hallgatói közösség számára irreleváns hirdetésekre!
  4. Profiladatok választásakor is tartsd be ezen szabályokat!
  5. A szenzitív, másokat esetleg felkavaró tartalmakat rejtsd el content warninggal!

Egyéb platformok

Telefonos böngész≈ën keresztül is kényelmesen használható a Mastodon, de ha inkább appon keresztül tülkölnél és tolnál meg tülköket, ajánlott alkalmazásaink: Tusky (Android), Amaroq (iOS)

Most, hogy már ismered az alapokat, állíts be egy felhasználónevet, egy profilképet és fedezd fel Magyarország legnagyobb Mastodon közösséget!




Welcome to Mastodon!

You might scratch your head after logging in, what’s all this? What’s the point? Long story short, it’s just like Twitter, but instead of being centralised it’s a federated platform. Because of this, Mastodon is separated into servers (or so-called instances), our instance is mastodon.elte.hu. We came together in order to efficiently and clearly share our thoughts and important information without anything that might disturb us.

Let’s get to know Mastodon!

If you’re familiar with Twitter, then you’ll find that many things work similarly here. If something is on your mind, you can toot it (tweet), if you like someone’s toot, go ahead and boost it(retweet), and you can also tell the writer that you liked it by marking it as a favourite (star). And yes, obviously you can comment under a toot.

You can compose a toot in the left side of the interface, with a 500 character limit. Make it unique with our basic and custom emojis, it’s fine if you need to attach a file, make a poll, or warn others with CW (Content Warning) that you’re tooting about a sensitive topic. Also there’s a globe icon there which allows you to select who is allowed to see your toot. There you can also choose Direct Message if you want to keep it between two or more people. Use our hashtag system, if you want people to find your post in the search results.The column in the center where you see all the toots, which is filtered by the settings on the right. There are three timelines (home, local, federative). The Home timeline shows content from those tooters and boosters you follow. On Local timeline you will see activity by users within our own ELTE instance, while on the Federated timeline the local toots + those users’ posts, whom our members follow can be seen.

Our rules in a nutshell

  1. Follow the rules stated in ELTE’s Code of Conduct!  (https://www.elte.hu/file/ELTE_Code_of_Conduct.pdf)

  2. Do not post content which makes others uncomfortable! (e.g. pornography, violence)

  3. Do not spam, do not post advertisements irrelevant to our users!

  4. These rules apply even when you are filling out your profile.

  5. When posting sensitive and/or intimidating content, mark it with content warning button, this way it will be hidden!

Please follow these rules for everyone's well being!
 

Other platforms

Mastodon on your own mobile browser is just fine, but if you’d like to use an app for tooting and boosting, Tusky (Android) or Amaroq (iOS) are here for you.

Now that you know the basics, set an username, upload a profile picture, and explore Hungary’s biggest Mastodon community!

For ELTE university people on science, art, profession, hobby, university life...

Description: FEDIsroot - Federated social network powered by Pleroma (open beta)

hcommons.social Code of Conduct

Humanities Commons exists to ensure open discussion and a welcoming environment for all users. As on hcommons.org, we reserve the right to delete any posting or ban any account judged to be inappropriate, obscene, defamatory, libelous, or otherwise illegal or offensive. The following guidelines outline our expectations for appropriate online behavior for all users:

  • Be courteous and respectful. Do not post inflammatory, derogatory, or otherwise inappropriate comments about other users. Respect one another‚Äôs privacy and intellectual property. (See ‚ÄúBehavior that can get you banned‚Äù below.)
  • Know and respect the law. Do not promote, condone, or encourage illegal activity in your postings.

Encouraged uses of hcommons.social

  • Share links to your work and to the work of others -- especially deposits to the Commons repository!
  • Share resources and ideas, and build connections with other members.
  • Discuss in-process work, hold reading groups, and involve others in your projects.
  • Be creative, and bring your whole selves. Non-academic stuff is welcome, as are satire and activism -- but please do bear the server rules in mind.
  • Please use content warnings when posting things that other users might find triggering. Kindness is key.

Behavior that can get you banned

  • Sexually explicit or violent media must be marked as sensitive when posting (pornographic material may not be posted)
  • No incitement of violence or promotion of violent, white supremecist, incel, Holocaust denial, or Nazi ideologies
  • No harassment, dogpiling, or doxxing of other users
  • No sharing of intentionally false or misleading information (this includes COVID-19 and vaccine misinformation)

Moderation policy

  • New accounts must have a verified email address and are subject to moderator approval.
  • Attacks and harassment against other members based on race, gender, identity, religion, or national origin will result in a 48 hour timeout. The second offense will result in a permanent ban.
  • Posts inciting violence or promoting violent, white supremecist, incel, Holocaust denial or Nazi ideologies will result immediately in a permanent ban.
  • Minor initial violations of the code of conduct (discourteous behavior or spamming affiliate links) will result in a warning. A second violation of the same rule will get the user placed in time out for a period of 48 hours. A third violation will result in a permanent ban.
  • Repeated minor violations will result in a ban on the third warning.
  • If you feel that someone was unjustly banned, please contact the Humanities Commons team directly at hello@hcommons.org. Complaints should be made privately, not publicly.
  • We may choose to unban an individual if they express remorse and it was a first offense.
  • Ban evasion accounts will result in further bans when identified.
  • If a member engages in behavior that violates the code of conduct please report the behavior (with links) to hello@hcommons.org.
Short: hcommons.social is a microblogging network supporting scholars and practitioners across the humanities and around the world.

Description:
Astrodon Community Guidelines

This is a Mastodon instance for the discussion of Astronomy and related space-sciences. We welcome all humans with an interest in discovering the nature of the universe, whether you're just starting out on your journey of discovery, whether you have a class of stellar object named after you, or if you're somewhere in between.

Real names and credentials are only recommended if you plan to use your account on this instance for networking purposes; they are absolutely not required.

Encouraged uses of Astrodon Social

  • Share your discoveries.
  • Highlight the beauty and majesty of the cosmos. Awe-inspiring images and media are strongly encouraged, espeically if it's your own work!
  • Ask questions, and answer questions asked. The power of our community is in sharing.
  • Network with other #Astrodons. Collaborate on studies, organise star parties, make friends.

Discouraged uses of Astrodon Social

The following will result in: a warning from a moderator or having offending posts deleted, possibly without prior notice.

  • Providing unsolicited advice to strangers.
  • Inappropriate un-CW'd posts on the Local Timeline (see below for CW policies)
  • Posts with un-described images or video
  • Posts of other people's work without proper attribution
  • Shortened links, e.g. bit.ly, t.ly, tinyurl.com, goo.gl, ift.tt, lnkd.in, is.gd or t.co (These are considered malicious because link-shorteners track users without their consent and obscure the destination address, which also prevents users from being able to decide whether they want to visit the link beforehand)
  • Advertisement or commercial content of any kind.

Content Warnings (CW's)

This community is founded on the principle of using informed consent to allow community members to decide which content they wish to engage with. To help inform others of what your post contains, we use Content Warnings. There is no stigma attached to using content warnings - they're a courtesy to your fellow Astrodons.

Please add CW's (content warnings) that are accurate and descriptive enough to enable reader consent to the following types of posts:

  • strong language,
  • rants,
  • selfies,
  • current events (includes: US or non-US, local, national, international, and should be applied regardless of whether sources are academic or non-partisan),
  • high-conflict or otherwise exhausting issues of popular debate (e.g. techbro billionaires, privacy issues, elections, etc.),
  • mentions of death or violence,
  • references or links to Facebook/Twitter/other big tech companies,
  • spoilers of popular and recent TV shows or other media,
  • ASCII art (this one is important to ensure that someone using a screen reader doesn't have to listen to an attempt to read out a bunch of obscure symbols)
  • stress sources, particularly complaints about personal life, work, academia, and study.
  • anything else where another user might want to decide for themselves whether or when they want to interact with your post.

Established science is not considered triggering or stressful. We welcome posts on any scientific subject, but please use hashtags Content Warnings to help your fellow Astrodons to identify content they want to engage with.

There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one.

Image descriptions

It is an expectation of this instance that you add accurate descriptions to all images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is an expectation of this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description.

It is required that if you are reposting images or media that is not your own, the source is fully attributed both in your post and in the image description.

Posts on the Local Timeline (ones with the "Public" privacy setting) will be checked to ensure that Content Warnings are applied, images are described, and other expectations are followed. Unlisted posts will not be proactively reviewed, but will still be subject to rules regarding abuse and other hate-speech.

NOTE: The "official" Mastodon app is NOT recommended for use on Astrodon Social, as it does not allow for posting using the "Unlisted" privacy setting.

Use a CW if you're not sure that your post is "on-topic." Astrodon Social is not meant to be a current events news aggregator, and if your post seems to fall into this category, you may be asked to delete and re-draft it with a CW or as an Unlisted post. Let's try to avoid turning the Local Timeline into the same rehashing of the outrage-of-the-day that we see on Twitter!

Not every post on the Local Timeline should be CW'd, but most should. Do your best to try to accommodate each other, and try to be understanding when there is a clash of expectations or needs.

Bots and automated accounts

Whilst the community is growing, bots and automated accounts are not allowed on this instance. As the community establishes in the coming weeks this restriction will be reviewed to allow for automated posting.

To be clear: cross-posting from other social media accounts that you use as an individual is perfectly okay, and a good way to manage multiple accounts whilst keeping your sanity.

Regarding attempts to abuse these anti-abuse tools and policies

Do not attempt to weaponize our Community Standards or anti-abuse tools/policies against marginalized groups such as people of colour, women or queer people. Users of Astrodon Social are expected to have the literacy to understand that "reverse discrimination" is not real, and so attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken deliberately in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that people of colour put CW's on every discussion of race; a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I hate straight people" may find their own account suspended.)
Short: A Mastodon community server for anyone interested in astronomy, astrophysics, astrophotography, and adjacent sciences.

Description:
Welcome to Journa.host

Journa.host is the home for working journalists and news outlets on Mastodon. It caters to active & retired journalists, scholars in media studies, and a variety of journalism adjacent professionals.

In October of 2023, the Fourth Estate Public Benefit Cooperative undertook the oversight of Journa.host, ensuring the platform's sustained growth and relevance, while upholding its core values and objectives.

Hosting and management of Journa.host is handled byHoneytree Technologies.

The financial requirements for Journa.host are fulfilled through community support, primarily via crowdfunding on Open Collective, a certified 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

Administrative and supplemental support services are provided by the Fourth Estate PBC.

Journa.host is currently closed to new account registrations.

Journa.host History

Journa.Host started as a community-centric project with initial funding sourced from The Tow-Knight Center for Entrepreneurial Journalism at the Craig Newmark Graduate School of Journalism at CUNY. A dedicated team of journalists meticulously managed it, aiming to benefit the broader news community.

Prominent founding moderators included:

  • Adam Davidson, the genius behind NPR‚Äôs "Planet Money" and former contributor to The New Yorker and The New York Times Magazine. Contact: adamdavidson@journa.host
  • Todd A. Price, a key reporter for the USA Today Network‚Äôs southern division. Email: tprice504@journa.host
  • Evan Urquhart, the brain behind Assigned Media and community manager for Slate. Reach out: e_urq@journa.host
  • Steven I. Weiss, a renowned investigative journalist. Contact: siw@journa.host

Our commitment to truth, dependability, and authenticity remains unwavering. Measures are in place on Journa.host to verify the credentials of journalists. Membership on the platform symbolizes one's status as a verified journalist. Professional journalists looking to join are invited to apply.

Moderation Policy

We have a balanced moderation policy that encourages a free press and free journalistic expression and speech while enforcing rules against extremist, prohibited, and/or illegal content.

Hate speech is not tolerated. This includes racism, misogyny, transphobia, homophobia and religious intolerance such as anti-semitism. This list is illustrative but not exhaustive.

Our aim is to maintain responsible free expression while ensuring a safe and inclusive community for all users. Our moderation approach focuses on behavior that occurs on the journa.host platform.

You can report violations directly from an individual post, image, or profile, including spam, abusive or harmful content, inappropriate ads, self-harm, and impersonation.

When making a report, please make sure to include at least a few posts that demonstrate prohibited behavior. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please include it in the comment as well.

We handle most reports within 72 hours.

Please note that we do not comment on moderation actions, and you will not be notified when a report you have made has led to moderation or other action.

Additionally, not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first-time offenses, we may choose to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures for repeat offenses.

Appeals and feedback channels are available for members.

Credits

Header Attribution "Will AI replace the journalists?" by Patrick Chappatte, Der Spiegel Licensed via Cagle Cartoons

Hosting and technical administration is provided by Honeytree Technologies.
Short: The server for working journalists and news outlets on Mastodon. Home to active & retired journalists, media scholars, and a variety of news and journalism adjacent professionals.  #Newstodon

Description:
Follow @geton@theblower.au for server news, status updates, planned downtimes, etc. DM is currently the preferred method of communication with the staff.

Please read our privacy policy.

If you're able and willing to support us financially, all the ways you can do so are here: chinwag.au/theblower

Eligibility

You must be aged 13 years or older to register for an account. We do not require you to use any particular language whilst using the service.

Brands

The Blower is a community, not a billboard or a bullhorn. As such, we do not allow brands to register accounts. Brands are invited to join another instance or create their own ‚Äì try brands.town. Use these guidelines for what we consider a Brand:

  • If you are a for-profit business, you are a brand
  • If you are a political party, you are a brand

If you are unsure whether you are a brand, please email admin@theblower.au to sort it out before registering.

Bot accounts

Bot accounts (i.e., those with automated posting) are permitted on The Blower under these additional conditions:

  • Post privacy must be set to "unlisted", "followers only" , or "direct"
  • The ‚ÄúThis is a bot account‚Äù checkbox must be set in the profile.
  • The account must identify the bot owner in the bio.
  • Bots must not interact with (mention) other accounts unless those accounts have interacted with the bot first.

We reserve the right to refuse or revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

User Code of Conduct (Rules)

The following types of content will be removed, and will result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service: Registering accounts with inherently malicious intent.

  • Unauthorised distribution of any personal information or data (DOXing).
  • Impersonation: You may not impersonate individuals, groups, or organisations in a manner that is intended to or does mislead, confuse, or deceive others. While you may maintain parody, fan, commentary accounts, you may not do so if the intent of the account is to engage in spamming or abusive behaviour. (Parody accounts must be labelled as such in the bio).
  • Nude or pornographic images, or other content that would be considered "18+" or "adult" by a reasonable person under Australian law
  • Any conduct intended to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed.
  • Racism or advocacy of racism.
  • Queerphobia, or advocacy of queerphobia (comparisons to paedophilia, animals, dehumanising language)
  • Sexism or advocacy of sexism.
  • Anti-sex worker perspectives or advocation against sex workers.
  • Discrimination or advocation against genders and sexual minorities.
  • Homophobia, Biphobia & Transphobia (Trans Rights are Human Rights).
  • Ableism, fatphobia or discrimination against disabled people.
  • Xenophobia and/or violent nationalism.
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions.
  • Promotion or encouragement of suicide or self-harm.
  • Stalking; including advocating any physical, sexual, or emotional harm against individuals or groups.
  • Harassment of any kind, including consistent baiting, bad faith gaslighting, unwanted sexual advances, etc. especially towards marginalised groups.
  • Promotion of scams, including web3/crypto and other ponzi schemes.

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism (Seriously. Absolutely no Nazis!).
  • Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism, or similar content illegal in the state of Victoria, Germany, Switzerland and/or France.
  • Violence: You may not make specific threats of violence or wish for the serious physical harm, death, or disease of an individual or group of people. This includes, but is not limited to, threatening or promoting terrorism. You also may not affiliate with organisations that ‚Äî whether by their own statements or activity both on and off the platform ‚Äî use or promote violence against civilians to further their causes.
  • Child exploitation: You may not post (or promote) suggestive depictions of children in any way (regardless of context). Example: No bath photos

Content Warning (CW) Guidelines

We encourage the use of Content Warnings (aka Content Wrappers, aka Summaries, aka Topics, aka Subject lines, hereafter CWs) on your posts. CWs are a courtesy to your readers and other members of The Blower community. CWs are not self-censorship: they do not suppress the indexing of posts, only their initial visibility.

The Blower believes that CWs are an important tool to support people's self-autonomy, but they can also be used for expression and creativity.

CWs are not expected on posts made by marginalised people about their own marginalisation, though authors may choose to do so.

Safety and Moderation

We strive to be a welcoming, and safe instance. Mastodon has safety features such as word/hashtag filtering to limit visibility to unwanted content, and we encourage the use of block/muting other accounts rather than engaging in vitriolic arguments. Please make use of the ability to report accounts that break the rules.

Please report users who break following the code of conduct, but please do not message people on behalf of the moderation team. Instead, you can scroll on, block, mute, or report to let moderators deal with it.

We will not act on complaints regarding:

  • Criticising racist, sexist, or otherwise oppressive behaviour or assumptions.
  • Good faith and non-malicious conduct whose object is to ameliorate (improve) the conditions of disadvantaged individuals or groups.
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as ‚Äúleave me alone,‚Äù ‚Äúgo away,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not discussing this with you‚Äù.
  • Swearing or profanity.

The Blower is one of many Fediverse communities, each with their own rules, moderation, and ethos. You are able to move servers in the future without losing your followers if this instance turns out to not be the best place for you.

Image Credits

Red Telephone by Julieta Lach Julie from Pixabay Vintage Phone by Alexa from Pixabay
Short:
Do you need to sort it out? Get on The Blower, a public social network site that's part of a global federation! Give it a go!

You don't have to be Australian to post here, but it helps.

Description:
ToadSocial is a free Mastodon instance offered on a good-faith basis. The site rules are simple: don't be a jerk, and model leadership. Anything that we don't like on grounds that it is anti-social or offensive may be summarily banned. You've been warned.

The site is operated by David Troy and is optimized for performance, stability, and civility.

ToadSocial is user-supported. You can help offset our hosting costs by donating here, on a one-time or recurring basis.

Donate Here

ToadSocial is securely hosted on IBM Cloud, using bare-metal servers and cloud object storage for maximum performance.
Short: Mastodon server operated by David Troy, a tech pioneer and investigative journalist addressing threats to democracy. Thoughtful participation and discussion welcome.

Description:
Important

Mastodon is gaining a lot of users, and this server is here provide a friendly place where you can discover and share content about coding, technologies and .NET.

Hope you will find it welcoming and useful. Feel free to collaborate, help and share! The local feed will be a good place for that.

If you want to get more details about this server, administration and moderation, you can look at the GitHub repository: github.com/dotnet-social/community

We have also a discord server where you can discuss about this community and the server: discord.gg/Cn3HHqMyWK

Description:
Mastodon.green

  • Plant trees while you use Mastodon
  • Mastodon.green is a worldwide general-purpose server
  • It's hosted in the EU and running on renewable energy
  • If you want to stay longer than a month you need to get a membership

Trees

20 % of the membership fees goes towards planting trees. You can see how many we've planted in the tree counter. More details can be found in our tree reports.

GreenFedi

Mastodon.green is part of the GreenFedi community. You can find our blog, FAQ and help pages on the community website.

Community guidelines

You can post almost anything you want, but not everything. We expect you to abide by the community guidelines.

Good to know

  • We don‚Äôt allow nudity
  • We have a language policy
  • Our guidelines apply to all content, including content arriving from remote servers.

The following languages are allowed

Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Icelandic, Irish, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Maltese, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, Slovene, Spanish and Swedish.

Getting started

Here's a a guide to mastodon, it's written by @feditips@mstdn.social.

Operated by Albin Social

The server is operated by Johan Empa's company named Albin Social.

Imprint/Impressum

Johan Sundstr√∂m - Albin Social
c/o Grosch Postflex #442
Emsdettener Stra√üe 10
48268 Greven
Germany
E-mail: post@albinsocial.com
Short: Plant trees while you use Mastodon. A server originally for people in the EU, but now open for anyone in the world

Description:
Welcome to NorCal.Social!

This is a Mastodon instance specifically intended for anyone who lives in or has a connection to Northern California.

Getting Started

After you sign up be sure to check for a confirmation email. You have to verify your email address before we can activate your account.

If you are new to Mastodon check out info.norcal.social for some general information on getting started and links to Mastodon documentation.

Contributing

norcal.social is run entirely by volunteers. However hosting requires real world costs. Contributing is always optional and any donations you make here go entirely to hosting fees: opencollective.com/norcalsocial

Rules

In addition to the Server rules listed below NorCal.Social adheres to the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Please report any rule violations or spam you see and a moderator will take appropriate action.

Thanks for being part of NorCal.Social!
Short: Welcome to NorCal.social! This is a Mastodon instance specifically intended for  anyone who lives in or has a connection to Northern California. All are welcome, join today :)

Description:
sunny.garden is a community for indie creators who draw, write, design, program, play, sing or build, their friends and family, and anyone else who thinks that sounds like a nice place to be!

The Sunny Garden Hub has a brief introduction to Mastodon and some tips on getting started.

This server is hosted in Canada üá®üá¶, and operated by Canadians. You don't have to be Canadian to sign up, as long as you are Canadian at heart üçÅ

Staff

  • @brook: Admin / Owner
  • @megan: Admin
  • @ipsquiggle: Admin
  • @Mustbetuesday: Moderator
  • @opal: Moderator
  • @daisy: Moderator

Banner image by @Linlinn

Signing Up

Please keep the following in mind when signing up:

  • Your request should be at least one complete sentence, in English.
  • Indicate why you chose sunny.garden instead of a different server. There are many Mastodon servers available, and they are not all suitable for all users.
  • Ensure that your chosen username is appropriate for the server, this will be your public username, and changing it will require creating a new account.

What to expect:

  • Within a couple of minutes: You should receive a validation email. If you don't see your validation email, check your spam/junk mail folder. Clicking the link in the validation email is required before your application will be processed.
  • Within 12 hours: Requests are processed a couple of times per day, it may take up to 12 hours after validating your email until your request is approved.

If you never receive the validation email, log in to double check that you spelled your email address correctly, or try using an address on a different email host. If all else fails, feel free to reach out to the Admin for assistance.

Community Guidelines

Self Promotion

Self promotion is allowed and welcome!

For example, you are free to announce:

  • sale of prints, pins, or other crafts
  • release of games or albums for sale
  • availability for work commissions
  • crowdfunding campaigns
  • employment opportunities

However, sunny.garden is a place for people, it is not a job network, advertising platform or storefront.

Operate your account as yourself, a human being (probably?), and do not engage in unsolicited or excessive marketing or promotion.

AI Art Policy

"AI Art" refers to images generated using text-to-image models such as Midjourney and Stable Diffusion.

The issue is not with the technology, but with the current implementation of these tools being trained on the works of many artists without their consent, attribution, or compensation.

You may post images containing AI Art for comment, discussion, etc. provided that you:

  • Mark the post with the hashtag #AIArt for clarity and ease of filtering.
  • Mark the media as sensitive, or use a content warning.
  • Do not sell AI art.
  • Do not use AI art as your avatar or profile image.

You are free to post or sell:

  • Art generated with tools such as Processing, fractals, or other types of procedural generation which do not rely on training from existing artwork.
  • Art generated using models trained exclusively on images that you own or are public domain, in which case you should indicate this is the case to avoid confusion.

This policy applies to sunny.garden users only, please do not report users on other servers which may have different policies.

Reporting

If you encounter harassment or inappropriate content, please use the reporting functionality built into Mastodon (click the three dots icon [...] on posts or profiles). Reporting helps the moderators be aware of, and take action against, sources of harassment and unwanted content for the benefit of everyone on the server.

Federation Policy

This server blocks ("Suspends") other servers that allow content -- such as harassment and hate speech -- that violates our rules.

The full list of suspended servers can be viewed at the bottom of the About page, but of particular note:

  • This server blocks Facebook's Threads service.
  • This server has Authorized Fetch enabled.

Reliability

This server commits to the Mastodon Server Covenant

  1. Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia
  2. Daily backups
  3. At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure
  4. Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down

However, there are no guarantees. While our best efforts are made to provide a reliable server, uploaded media and posts may be lost due to technical malfunction, accidental erasure, and so on. Always keep your own backups of any content you wouldn't want to lose.

In the event that the current admin(s) of this server are no longer willing/able to operate the server (due to cost, time, health, lack of interest, etc.) then they will do their best to find a replacement admin with similar values, who is willing to take over the operation of the server, before considering shutting it down.

Customizations

This server runs a mostly standard installation of Mastodon, but there is one functional customization:

  • The maximum length of posts has been increased to 1500 characters, up from the default of 500.

And a couple of cosmetic customizations to the website (not visible in apps or mobile clients):

  • We have a Toot! üêò button instead of a Publish! button
  • A faint dashed red border is displayed around images which do not include alt-text image descriptions.

Donations

By popular request, I've set up a ko-fi account to accept donations toward the operating costs of this server. There is currently no risk of my not being able to cover the hosting costs for the server -- the primary cost to me is my time (and sanity).

Donations are appreciated, but not required! There is no obligation for you to donate in order to use the server, and there are no additional perks for doing so.

  • ko-fi.com/brookmiles

Estimated Monthly Hosting Costs (Feb 2024): $103 CAD

* Donations via PayPal will go to Tentacle Head Games which is also me - @brook
Short: sunny.garden is a community for indie creators who draw, paint, sculpt, write, design, program, play, sing or build, and anyone else who thinks that sounds like a nice place to be.

Artsio is an inclusive community for artists! We welcome illustrators, 3D modelers, game developers, fine artists, dancers, photographers, musicians, writers, sculptors, fiber artists, art lovers, and artists of all kinds.

Description:
Mapstodon.space is a online community dedicated to cartography & geospatial enthusiasts.

Mapstodon.Space Code of Conduct

Our Pledge

We as members and contributors pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.

Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our community include:

  • Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
  • Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
  • Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
  • Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes, and learning from the experience
  • Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the overall community.

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

  • The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances of any kind;
  • Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks;
  • Public or private harassment;
  • Publishing others private information, such as a physical or email address, without their explicit permission;
  • Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting;

Religious proselytizing is not allowed on this instance. Direct advertising for commercial products must remain exceptional.

Enforcement Responsibilities

The instance maintainers are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Instance maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject toots and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation decisions when appropriate.

Scope

This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces. Examples of representing our community include using an official e-mail address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event.

Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the community maintainers at admin@mapstodon.space. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.

All community maintainers are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the reporter of any incident.

Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available here. Translations are available here.
Short: Mapstodon.space is a online community dedicated to cartography & geospatial enthusiasts.
