Hosted by Princeton HCI. Managed by a group of volunteers.

Description:
NNIA stands for Non Normative Identities Alliance, a group for marginalized and stigmatized demographics. The purpose of the movement is promotion of health and support for these people, public awareness in absence of shame and thought policing.

NNIA was introduced as a concept on MAP twitter in 2019, as an attempt to find a common ground between the MAP community, the other paraphiliacs, queer people who don't want to discriminate against others, mentally ill people. We all have to live being stereotyped as predatory and less than human, and it's time to unite and make our voices heard.

The primary purpose of NNIA as a server is to connect people of marginalized identities who are under threat of silencing and erasure on mainstream social media and give them a space to talk and a feeling of stability. This is not a discussion platform between paraphiliacs and antis. However, polite and rational questions from occasional viewers are welcome.

Application rules:

- introduce yourself;

- explain why you're interested in us.

Blank applications and unspecific applications (‚ÄúI want to check it out‚Äù, ‚ÄúI want to meet people‚Äù) will be rejected. This is a site for minorities and supporters of minorities, so please, indicate that you understand it and want to be a part of it.

Things you need to know:

1. Mastodon is a network of servers, each with its own staff, that permits anyone from any server to interact with anyone from any other server. This server is ours. But you can go chat with people from elsewhere.

2. You are going to have 3 timelines. Home timeline will give you everyone you follow, Local will show everyone from NNIA whether you follow them or no (but only original posts, no replies), Federated will give you all content our members interact with, from any Mastodon server.

3. You can regulate the degree of privacy of your posts. The globe icon that appears below the text as you write indicates public posting. You can change it by clicking on it.

4. We as admins have access to everyone‚Äôs emails, and we‚Äôre not going to abuse this knowledge, but we recommend getting separate mails for map activities anyway. We no longer log IPs, but a VPN, such as Proton VPN, or Betternet, is still recommended.

5. There are Mastodon mobile apps. Tusky for Android and Tootle for Apple are the most popular ones.

6. The mod group watches members of other servers that interact with us. In case of any dangerous behavior (attempts to solicit illegal materials, doxxing threats, aggressive bigotry), their accounts will be banned from interacting with this server.

7. Google emojis on this site are modified from Noto Emoji and licensed under the Apache 2.0 License. ¬© 2013 Google, Inc. All Rights Reserved
Short:
This site is for paraphiliacs, allies, and everyone adjacent. It is not for porn.
APPLICATION RULES:
- no NSFW usernames
- explain your interest
Blank or vague applications will be rejected.

Description:
General Information

Mastodon instance for furries of the larger, tubbier persuasion. Generally focused on fatfur and related content, while also just being a place to post whatever you want (within reason naturally).

In an attempt to curb spam accounts the site has been set to require approval for registration. These will be reviewed ASAP.

This is a federated server and is relayed to several other furry Mastodon instances.

Any servers reported as abusive/trolling will be blocked to maintain stability of this instance.

Moderation Team

Wobbl.xyz is moderated by:

  • @tarrien - Admin/Owner
  • @thesammon - Moderator
  • @SnowBlueHusky - Moderator

Content Warnings

Mastodon/Wobbl.xyz does not force the use of content warnings (CWs); however, using them is a cultural norm of the platform. On Mastodon, the words "content warning" don't automatically mean that a post is NSFW and they're not synonymous with "trigger warning." They're just tags which tell people what kind of content is in a post, and they can be better thought of as "spoilers" or "content notices." Mastodon also allows users to filter posts on keywords contained in CWs to avoid certain content, and it indexes CWs for searching. The goal of CWs is to prevent surprises and make posts easier to discover.

Posts from Wobbl.xyz are sent to other federated instances through boosts and the Federated Timeline. An excess of posts without CWs or with vague CWs may cause other instances to defederate (block) us, so please use CWs where appropriate.

Here are some content warning tags that you can use as a starting point:

  • SFW, NSFW

  • Body types like: Fat / Fat Fur, Muscles / Muscular, Thin

  • Sizes like: Blob, Immobile, Hyper

  • Kinks like: Healthplay, Slob, Sweat, Weight Gain, Transformation, etc.

  • Nudity / Genitals (and additional specifics like Bulge, Vagina, Penis, etc.)

  • Furry Art, IRL, Belly Photo, Gainer Talk

Example Content Warning: Furry Art, Fat Fur, SFW

We also ask that posts seeking financial help or donations (such as GoFundMe campaigns) are tagged with the content warning Financial Aid Request or Mutual Aid Request.

This is not an exhaustive list. Fun/silly tagging is allowed and so are other tags not listed above; we just request that you are descriptive about the contents of your posts and be mindful of people who use filters.

AI Art

Wobbl does not allow the posting of AI generated art.

We define AI art as art that is fully or primarily generated by a neural network AI art generator (i.e. DALL-E).

The reason we are choosing to ban AI art is because these platforms generally use scraped art assets and images for their data models without proper copyright attribution or compensation to the original artists. We polled the Wobbl community and received a large response in favor of the ban.

The Wobbl team considers the current iteration of these platforms as theft and plagiarism of copyrighted works of artists, and currently there does not appear to be a way to mitigate this glaring issue. We value the importance of artists in the furry community and choose to support them against this major threat. As technology is always changing, this policy will be updated as necessary.

Notes

  • Our moderation approach for AI art will be to ask the poster to remove it themselves. If further action is needed, we will keep record of such. Multiple infractions without cooperation with the moderation team may lead to suspension.

  • We cannot police the posts of other instances when it comes to things like this. Please don't report posts from other instances with AI art to us.

  • We do not consider the use of AI tools in the creation of art to be an issue (i.e. artists using tools to generate backgrounds, fill spaces, etc.). This ban applies to art that is primarily/completely generated by AI models.

  • As with any other rule or policy, we ask our members to refrain from going after those who do post AI art. If you see it posted to Wobbl, feel free to report it, but there is no reason to demonize people. Doing so is against Rule #5.

  • We understand there is value to AI generated art, the technology does have benefits. We apologize to those who may be impacted by this policy decision, however we refuse to host such content.

FAQ

  • CW Policy FAQs
    • "Why is my topic not listed?"
      • This is a short list of tags most common for this instance, it is not exhaustive. Please feel free to use any other tags that you feel are appropriate to your post.
    • "XYZ shouldn't have to come with a warning, why is it on there?"
      • Please keep in mind that these are for describing and tagging your content more than "warning" about it, this allows users here and elsewhere to view what they specifically want to more easily and filter out what they don't.
    • "What if I don't want to use CWs?"
      • Wobbl.xyz and Mastodon in general don't require CWs, however they are expected and appreciated. If you would rather not tag your posts at all, one option is to change your default posting privacy setting to "Unlisted", so your posts don't get pushed directly to the global timeline.
    • "What if I see a post from Wobbl.xyz that isn't properly tagged?"
      • Please keep in mind this is a community, and behind each user is a person. If you want to civilly and kindly point it out to them, there's nothing wrong with that. If you are not able to do so for whatever reason, or would rather not, you may report the post and the site's admin team will investigate instead. Otherwise you are always free to mute/block them and move on.
    • "What if I see a post from a different instance that isn't properly tagged?"
      • If it bothers you, mute/block and move on. We are all adults on this instance (per the rules), and should be able to compose ourselves as such.
  • General Instance FAQs
    • "What does it mean when you say you're "federated with multiple furry servers"?"
      • Mastodon allows servers to connect to each other so we can interact with people on multiple servers. Federating with furry servers means we have it set up where the public posts from those servers we're connected to, as well as public posts from Wobbl.xyz, all go into a shared "Federated" feed.
    • "Who can I reach out to for assistance?"
      • Anybody listed under the Administered By: section above can assist.
    • "Do I have to sign up to Wobbl.xyz to be able to interact with people on this instance?"
      • No! As long as you have a Mastodon account on a server that we haven't blocked for some reason, or haven't blocked us, you should be able to interact.
    • "If this is just some small community space, what's stopping you from suddenly disappearing and shutting down one day?"
      • Sadly, very little, however Wobbl.xyz has made a committment to offer at least a 30-day warning if we do choose to shut down for some reason.

Donations

The instance is, and will remain, free to use. If you would like to, feel free to help support the instance's upkeep! Any donations go directly to funding the site.

Ko-Fi Patreon

The instance's costs and infrastructure information can be found at @transparency

Attributions

Utilizing the Modern theme from this Git page.

For emoji, this instance uses:

Mutant Standard emoji and Dragn-Emoji - Licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 International License.

Blobhaj emoji

Blobfox by @volpeon@mk.vulpes.one - Licensed under Apache 2.0
Short: Mastodon instance for furries of the larger, tubbier persuasion.

Description:
About the registration process

FediScience is a community for active scientists. Establishing the exact definition of "science" and who is actively contributing to it is a long-standing open problem (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demarcation_problem).

Therefore, we need to fix a criterium. We have opted to assume that researchers currently publishing in scientific journals are active scientists, knowing the potential limitations of this definition. To register on FediScience, you'll need to provide us with evidence that you are working as a publishing scientist or aspiring to be one, by sending us a link to your ORCID, academic web page, or similar where we can see your contributions. We will not save or use this information for anything other than the verification process. For students or junior researchers who have not yet published a paper - no problem! Just explain your situation. It will help us if you can add a link where we can see that you are affiliated with a research institution.

Other edge cases will be moderated on an individual basis. If you really think that you are a good match for the FediScience community, please apply and carefully explain your situation.

About Fediscience.org

FediScience is a social network for publishing scientists. Everyone is welcome to join from PhD student to professor, as well as researchers from outside of academia. You are welcome to stay afterwards, but it is also easy to change to another server.

There will be a lot of science talk on this server, but there is no need to only talk science.

This site is owned and operated by the FediScience association and other volunteers from the FediScience community.

Imprint / Impressum

FediScience (e.V. in Gruendung)
Frank Sonntag
Bahnhofstra√üe 22
85354 Freising
08161 / 2408483
support@fediscience.org

Code of conduct

As many people as possible should feel welcome at FediScience, so please follow the code of conduct.

  • You do not have to give your name, but please tell us about your expertise and interests in your bio and introduce yourself using the #introductions hashtag.
  • Don‚Äôt do anything that‚Äôs illegal in Germany or where you live.
  • We want to be inclusive; do not engage in exclusionary behaviour or language. Consider not only the current interaction, but how it would be if your behaviour were common.
  • Don‚Äôt harass people. Respect it if people want to stop an interaction. Sexual attention can constitute harassment, even if it wasn‚Äôt intended to cause upset.
  • Please relax. Don‚Äôt assume you know better than the person you‚Äôre talking to.

Users violating these rules may have their accounts suspended and will not be welcome to take part any more.

If you are subject to or observe any harassment, or have any other concerns, please report the toot concerned or message a moderator. Reports will be dealt with discreetly and in confidence.

We want everyone to have a great time and treat each other with respect.

Use of the Content Warning (CW) feature

Mastodon has Content Warnings, please use them. They can be used to collapse a long (series) of messages, but also to hide topics some may find upsetting, especially when people would not expect this kind of content in your stream, e.g., when you are not talking about your area of expertise.

At the bottom of the message editor you can click the "CW" button; anything in the small warning field above your larger message editor field will be visible. The reader will have to click on "Show more" to see the full message.

Use of bots and cross-posters

It is fine to use apps or services which generate toots automatically, but please make sure that you have them under control: make sure they are relevant, try to limit it to a few posts a day. Mark the account as bot. When using bots and cross-posters visit FediScience regularly, if only to interact with replies.

Support Mastodon and FediScience

The best way to help is to spread the word! If you starting using Mastodon and find it useful then help out by telling other people about it.

Multiple people have kindly offered to support FediScience financially and since we are getting so many new people onboard that we can make use of the funds to support the infrastructure and moderation costs.


Liberapay is a not-for-profit financed by donations itself.

Patreon
is a for-profit and more expensive, but we offer it for people's convenience
Short: Fediscience is the social network for scientists.

Description:
FAQ

What is Sigmoid Social?

Sigmoid Social is a Mastodon instance for people researching, working on, or just interested in AI. We went live on 11/04/2022.

Who should join Sigmoid Social?

You should join Sigmoid Social if you would like to be part of a Mastodon community primarily focused on discussing AI. We do not gatekeep who can join; it does not matter whether you are a researcher, engineer, hacker, student, artist, or just curious.

Who runs Sigmoid Social?

Sigmoid Social is administered and maintained by The Gradient. The Gradient is a non-profit and volunteer-run organization with the mission of facilitating discussion within the AI community. We were founded in 2017 by a group of students and researchers at the Stanford AI Lab. Our current projects include The Gradient Magazine, The Gradient Podcast, The Update newsletter, and Sigmoid Social.

Should I only post about AI?

You can feel free to toot about anything at all, as long as it complies with the Code of Conduct. We may however ask you to migrate to a different instance if your focus is not AI at all.

Should I only post in English?

This server supports translation, so it is ok to post in other languages than English. But, as English as the primary language here, that should ideally be the primary language you use. If you do post in other languages, please tag your posts with the appropriate language label.

Will you ban me for X?

We will take appropriate moderation measures against any violations of the Code of Conduct. We also reserve the right to take actions in the best interest of the community in situations we deem harmful but do not clearly violate the Code of Conduct. We will generally lean towards promoting free expression and issuing warning and restrictions rather than bans, but this is absolutely not a free-speech-above-all platform.

How can I help cover costs?

You can support us on Patreon or Kofi!

How can I share suggestions for Sigmoid Social?

You can message The Gradient via Mastodon, email, Twitter, or pigeon.

Where is my data stored?

Sigmoid Social is hosted by MastHost, a fully managed Mastodon hosting service provided by WAP ‚Äì Web Access Platforms. WAP is a one-person company 100% owned and administrated by Hugo Gameiro. All data storage and processing is done through MastHost.

What happens if The Gradient can no longer maintain Sigmoid Social?

In the case that our current team can no longer run Sigmoid Social, we will attempt to transfer control of it to another non-profit entity within the AI community. If we are unable to do this, we will announce the closure of Sigmoid Social within at least 30 days to allow users to transfer their accounts to other Mastodon instances.

Can you access my private DMs?

The only way we can access private communications from Sigmoid Social is through exporting the database stored by MastoHost. We will do this periodically for the purpose of storing backups, and in case we have to migrate to another hosting solution. We will not inspect the database for any other reasons. Regardless, we recommend not sharing any private or secure information on this platform.

What is your policy in AI Art and NFTs?

This instance is a great fit for anyone who wants to post AI art - we fully support it. We are also OK with NFT promotion, as long as it relates to AI art and is not spammy.

Why does the banner spell out "Sigmioid"

We generated our banner using MidJourney (a text-to-image AI tool), and intentionally picked out an image that contained a typo as a little in-joke about these tools.

Recommended Practices & Mastodon tips

Here are some recommended practices for helping make Sigmoid Social a great place for everyone here:

  • Browse the local feed when starting out. Mastodon has three types of feeds: home (people or hashtags you follow), local (all posts from this instance), and federated (all posts from this instance and any users from other instances that are follow by anyone on here). Until you follow some people or hashtags, the local feed is your best bet for discovering content.
  • Use hashtags. Mastodon does not have an algorithmic feed, so hashtags are often used for finding content relevant to your interests. So, using hashtags will make it easier for others to find and follow you, and for you to find others as well. We list a set of recommended hashtags below!
  • Use the unlisted privacy setting in replies and threads. The default post privacy in Mastodon is 'global', which gets posted to the local timeline, whereas 'unlisted' is only shown when browsing the replies to a given post. Using unlisted for most replies and threads makes the timeline less cleaner and nicer to browse.
  • Look into the non-official apps for Mastodon. There are some apps not made by Mastodon that provide an arguably better frontend. Examples include Tusky and Toot!
  • Consider using content warnings/content labels. The CW button when writing posts stands for 'content warning', and then you include one in your post only the text for it is shown unless a user presses a button to see the rest of the post. We recommend using it for sensitive content, but you can also use them like a subject line or TLDR as well!
  • Explore Mastodon notification options. Mastodon allows you to mute various types of notifications, which can make it easier to focus on just replies and ignore favorites or boosts if you prefer to do so.
  • Report any content you think might violate the code of conduct. Moderation on Mastodon primarily relies on the users reporting objectionable content, at which point our mods can take care of it. Reporting bad content will make the experience on Sigmoid Social better for everyone!
  • Aim to be generally civil and friendly :)

Hashtags

As is true for Mastodon in general, we recommend you use hashtags in your posts. The following are just some you may want to use:

  • #introduction - for introducing yourself!
  • #ai - for stuff related to AI!
  • #NewPaper - for sharing new papers!
  • #PaperThread - for threads summarizing your or others' papers!
  • #arxiv- for stuff related to arxiv!
  • #SOTA - for stuff related to state of the art!
  • #NLProc - for stuff related to NLP!
  • #CV - for stuff related to computer vision!
  • #RL - for stuff related to reinforcement learning!
  • #genAI - for stuff related to generative AI!
  • #llm - for stuff related to language models!
  • #reviews - for stuff related reviews!
  • #conference - for stuff related to conferences!
  • #deadline - for stuff related to deadlines!
  • #aiart - for AI art!
  • #academia - for stuff related to academia!
  • #industry - for stuff related to industry!
  • #PetPics - for pet pics!
  • #question - for questions!
  • #discussion - for discussions!
  • #announcement - for announcements!
  • #hiring - if you're hiring!
  • #JobHunt - if you're job hunting!
  • #code - for stuff related to code!
  • #news - for news!
  • #interesting - for interesting stuff!
  • #concerning - for concerning stuff!
  • #cool - for cool stuff!
  • #SuperCool - for super cool stuff!
  • #lame - for lame stuff!
  • #SuperLame - for super lame stuff!
  • #funny - for funny stuff!
  • #SuperFunny - for super funny stuff!
  • #MindBlown - for mind blowing stuff!
  • #ethics - for stuff related to ethics!
  • #fun - for fun stuff!
  • #GoodMorning - for wishing everyone a good morning!
  • #GoodNight - for wishing everyone a good night!
  • #serious - for serious stuff!
  • #random - for random stuff!
  • #TIL - for new stuff you've learned!
  • #scifi - for discussing science fiction!
  • #media - for discussion of movies, books, comics, etc
  • #SigmoidSocial - for stuff related to Sigmoid Social
  • #TOOTTOOT - just to add a little fun flair to your toots :P

Code of Conduct

Sigmoid Social is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone.

We want this community to maintain a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. In keeping with these aims, we do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from Sigmoid Social at the discretion of the organizers of the Gradient.

Harassment, including the following activities, will not be tolerated:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, age, race, or religion.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of ‚Äòdead‚Äô or rejected names.
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they‚Äôre not appropriate.
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or ‚Äúbackrub‚Äú) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Stalking or following.
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention.
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others. Sigmoid Social is intended to be a welcoming platform, so while friendships in support of research are encouraged, note that Sigmoid Social is not a dating platform. Flirting or other unprofessional behavior may make someone uncomfortable. If a member requests another member to stop this type of behavior and it continues, it will be considered harassment.
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person‚Äôs identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication.
  • Impersonation with the intent to deceive users (satire is ok).
  • Explicitly rude or degrading remarks in general.

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a user of Sigmoid Social, notice that someone else is being harassed, believe confidentiality has been violated, or have any other concerns, please report this via the standard Mastodon tools. We will respond as promptly as we can.

organizers reserve the right to exclude people from Sigmoid Social based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Sigmoid Social.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we‚Äôve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will increase the safety of the members Sigmoid Social or the general public. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from Sigmoid Social and identification of the participant as a harasser to other members of Mastodon.

Credit and License

This policy is licensed under the Creative Commons Zero license. It was inspired by and parts were copied from the ML Collective Code of Conduct.

Description:
About this Server

Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.

  • You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
  • Read more on post and account visibility here

Social networking, back in your hands

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic‚Äîyou decide who you want to see!

Be sure to check our Terms & Code of Conduct.

Support the community

If you like you can donate to help the core Mastodon project out at Mastodon Sponsors

Staff

SEOCommunity.social's admin and moderation staff include:

  • Natalie Slater
  • Simon Cox
  • Jess Joyce
  • JR Oakes

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Server Info

Location

This server is hosted in Amsterdam by the wonderful team at Ahrefs.

Server Blocks

We are currently blocking other servers found in the official list from Mastodon. Our list may not always be up-to-date from the official version, but that is our goal. If you find harmful or illegal content in your timeline from another domain, please let an admin know.

Server Statistics

  • FediDB.org
  • The-Federation.info
  • Fediverse.Observer

Attributions

The seocommunity.social source code is hosted on GitHub. You can browse and download the full source code here. The instance mascot is designed by @TheCanine.

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, you‚Äôre not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

  • United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
  • Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

Description:
About

Shakedown Social is a community for live music fans with roots in the jam scene. Fans of bands like Phish, Goose, the Grateful Dead, Billy Strings, King Gizzard and the Lizard Wizard, Umphrey's McGee, the Disco Biscuits and more all gather here.

Shakedown is run by a team of volunteers (led by @clifff and @sethadam1) and funded by donations. You can help cover the cost of hosting by donating here. All donations go directly to hosting costs.

Mastodon Server Covenant

We are committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant, which includes:

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia.
  • Our user data is backed up daily.
  • Multiple people have emergency access to the server infrastructure.
  • Users will be provided with at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down.
Short: A community for live music fans with roots in the jam scene. Shakedown Social is run by a team of volunteers (led by @clifff and @sethadam1) and funded by donations.

Description:
h-net.social is a Mastodon community hosted by H-Net: Humanities and Social Sciences Online. We hope to build a community of humanities and social science scholars committed to civil discourse and academic best practices.


H-Net's Mastodon instance will always be free and open for users.


As the server grows, however, so will our technological needs and associated costs. We are a 501(c)(3) academic non-profit, so we do appreciate support from those who benefit from our services.


You can make a tax-deductible contribution to support the server here:


https://donorbox.org/h-net-mastodon-server-support

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

About
Êó•Êú¨Ë™û

Aethy is a safe haven for creative and unique people and communities to flourish! This server is for people to be able to express themselves by sharing their creations, talk about their interests, or just be themselves in an environment that doesn't allow harassment to flourish. In contrast to other environments online, we also want to be a safe space for marginalized individuals including queer folks, people of color, and women by disallowing hateful speech and ideals.

As advertisers become prevalent in online spaces, many sites limit what type of content is allowed in order to appease them. From banning nudity all the way to banning strange and niche kinks! By contrast, Aethy embraces and loves the human body! We love when adults get kinky and sometimes downright strange with their sexuality! We don't believe in regressive ideologies that limit creative speech and content between consenting adults. With that belief in mind, we made Aethy. The policies were envisioned and sculpted by people who've dealt with hate all their lives, as well as experiencing mental, physical, and sexual abuse (both as minors and as adults). It's extremely important to us that we create a safe space for our community so we've built the site on the principles of inclusion and consent.

Instead of continuing to be squeezed out of spaces because perhaps we're too weird, too queer, or too kinky... we've made our own space! We don't think there's any wrong way to express ourselves as long as we adhere to the principles of consent and inclusion! We no longer want to inhabit spaces where we're beholden to advertisers, puritans and those that wish to spread hate!

Check out our Matrix Space!

FAQ

Content Warnings

What is a or "CW?"

or a "CW" is short for "Content Warning". When a user is making a post, they have the option to click a button that has a symbol. This is used to warn other users about content they might not wish to see (such as sexual or violent content).

What content needs a ?

Public and Unlisted Posts that contain sexual themes, gore, and depictions/discussions of sensitive topics require warnings. Any media where the intent is to arouse is included in this (even if a censor bar or a blur effect is applied). This also includes images where the subject is posed in a sexual manner, or if a body part is framed in an attempt to be arousing. Light blood doesn't require a but beyond that, a is most likely required. Finally, sensitive topics include politics, religion, spirituality, niche belief systems, abuse (including relationship which would be abusive in reality), current events and other topics that could potentially upset someone.

Just do your best though! No one is gonna get in trouble unless they're intentionally trying to upset other users!

What happens if I forget to add a ?

The best thing to do is to quickly edit your post and add one. Otherwise, you'll receive a reminder from a staff member reminding you to add one provided the post content isn't deemed to be too upsetting! Staff members will also typically give suggestions as to what tags may be appropriate. However, if the lack of a on a post could be extremely distressing to viewers, the post may be deleted and need to be redrafted from your email. Accounts that ignore staff warnings may also be Limited so the posts don't appear in public timelines and all images will be marked as "sensitive". To have the Limited status removed, simply edit your posts to include a and then appeal the Limited status. Punitive action will never be taken, we will simply put measures in place to protect other users from content they may wish to avoid!

What if my s aren't good enough?

Try your best! If the s aren't comprehensive enough, the staff's course of action will be similar to the above. As a general rule of thumb, try to avoid simply marking a post as "NSFW" or something similar. Ask yourself why it's NSFW and list those reasons in the CW. Also avoid overly broad CWs such as "Nudity", "Age Gap", "Dead Dove", etc. Be specific about the subjects and what content is involved!

What's an example of a ?

Examples for sexual content are "Kink", "Sex", "Sexual Nudity", "Boner", "Erection", "Het", "GL", ‚ÄúBL‚Äù, ‚ÄúMLM‚Äù, ‚ÄúAnal‚Äù, ‚ÄúBlowjob‚Äù, ‚ÄúBoner‚Äù, ‚ÄúBlood‚Äù, ‚ÄúGore‚Äù, ‚ÄúVore‚Äù, ‚ÄúMacro‚Äù, "Age gap", ‚ÄúUnderage‚Äù, "Shota", "Loli", ‚ÄúMinor/Adult‚Äù, "Teen/Adult", etc.

An example for a heavier topic could include "Politics", "Hate Speech", "Harassment", "Discourse", "Syscourse", etc.

When it comes to religion, spirituality and niche belief systems and frameworks, some examples are "Spirituality, "Religion", "Otherkin", "Therian", "Christian", "Jesus", etc.

Basically, the more specific you can get, the better! But you also don't have to make an essay out of it! However, please avoid using loaded words that can be used synonymously with real abuse as s. s are meant to allow people to avoid content they don't wish to see and should do so without causing distress to others.

Does simple nudity require a ?

Nope! Content warnings are not required for non-sexual nudity (e.g. images that don't feature close-ups of genitals, boners, or sex acts). Basically, if it's an image you'd find in an art museum or if the intention of the content isn't to arouse, it doesn't need a . This policy doesn't discriminate against age or body type either. If the subject is a real adult and has consented, or if it's a fictional drawing, then nudity is no different than if the subject is clothed! This also means images that contain nudity can be used in profile icons and banners!

You‚Äôre still free to use content warnings when they‚Äôre not required, however!

What counts as sexual or erotic?

Any image where the intent is to arouse or where the subjects featured are engaged in a sexual act. This may even include images that don't feature sexual nudity such as images that contain bodily fluids or where the subject(s) are posed in a sexual nature. It also includes images that attempt to censor the sexual content (e.g. placing a bar over a boner or blurring it). Basically, if it's obvious what's going on, it needs a !

Can I boost content from another server that doesn't have a ?

Yes! We don't want to discourage interacting with other servers even when their policies relating to s differ from ours. Users are encouraged to proceed with caution when viewing posts from other servers. However, if a post isn't marked as "sensitive" when it would be required to have a on Aethy, please report it so we can mark it ourselves!

Acceptable Content

Can I post content I don't own the rights to?

This isn't legal advice but typically screenshots, cropped comic panels, clips from television, etc. fall under Fair Use in the United States. This also includes fan art, fan fiction, and other such content. Staff members will not typically remove content from mass media properties that we believe to fall under Fair Use. However, if a user uploads full television episodes or movies, copyrighted music, and other such content, it will be removed and the user suspended as it is not Fair Use. Also, when it comes to independent creators, we ask that you do not repost their creations (e.g. artwork, photos, videos, etc.) without the creator's permission. We also ask that you don't include their characters in your creations in a way that could cause duress (e.g. drawing sexual imagery of someone's mascot character without their permission).

Can I upload works created with AI?

Yes but it must be disclosed. AI assisted works (such as art where background elements are created by AI) simply require disclosure of the tool used in the post body. However, when posting works created entirely (or nearly entirely) by AI, a must be added indicating that it's AI generated and what tool was used to create it. However, works that were created by directly modifying someone else's copyrighted content may not be posted unless the original content falls under Fair Use. The AI used must also have been trained in a clean room environment that wasn't trained using real human subjects. Especially in the case of pictures featuring underage characters.

Policies

Our policies are available on our Policies page. There you can find our:

  • Privacy Policy
  • Acceptable Use Policy
  • Law Enforcement and Legal Compliance
  • Copyright Enforcement

Financials

Here's the cost breakdown for running Aethy:

  • Server hosting: $72 per month
  • Domain name: $14.76 per year
  • Email: $48 per year
  • Storage: ~$12 per month
  • Translation Services: ~$25 per month
  • CDN: $280 per year
  • PO Box (DMCA Requirement): $166 per year

Servers who block us

Servers on the fediverse generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are a few of the larger servers that have made an exception for us and have disallowed all interactions from our users. This is typically due to our stance on creative fiction and kink. Nothing can be done to re-enable access from our end so if you have friends on these servers, we suggest either reaching out to the admin of the server they're on or requesting your friend move to a less restrictive server.

Description:
This mastodon instance is a Community driven effort to unite people interested in AWS (Amazon Web Services), so that they may share thoughts, ideas and knowledge about AWS. It is not in any way funded by amazon or officially endorsed by them.

You can find the code of conduct we adhere to here: https://github.com/richarvey/mastodon/blob/main/coc.md
Short: AWS (Amazon Web Services) Community-Focused Mastodon Server bringing together a global user group. Not affiliated with Amazon, but interested in AWS Technology.

Description:
Civil discourse and free exchange of ideas.

Follow the Non-Aggression Principle.

Zero-tolerance for trolls, oversensitive snowflakes, nor adult / NSFW content.

No spam accounts, no auto-bots, no excessive advertising (where first toot is an ad == excessive), no SEO bots - all affected accounts will be suspended.
Short: Clean, civil, clueful Mastodon instance for easyDNS members, techies and weirdos. SPAM BOTS WILL BE SUSPENDED

Description:
zeroes.ca Code of Conduct

Who, What, Where, Why

zeroes.ca is a COVID-aware community built on Mastodon and connected to the fediverse. We're hosted on servers in Canada, operated by admins who live in Canada, and open to people from anywhere in the world. We are not a commercial website; we have no financial interest in your data or activity. This is a volunteer-run, voluntary service. We're here for dissemination of science, experiences, information, and ideas; conversation and discussions; questions and answers -- a safe, good faith, and censorship-free space for any and all COVID-related topics. Misinfo, disinfo, and other unlawful, harmful, and/or bad faith content is not permitted.

Moderation

Our goal is to provide an environment conducive to community and communication and hostile to anything unlawful, malicious, and/or synonymous with bullying. We reserve the right to remove any accounts, content, or federated servers that are detrimental to this community and the above goal. We realize you're human and we are too, so we'll do our best to be fair yet protective. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to admins/mods.

Reporting

When reporting accounts, please include posts that show rule-breaking behaviour (when applicable). Detailed context in the comment will help us fully understand the situation and take appropriate action. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks. We endeavour to handle all reports within 24 hours. Bear in mind that you are not notified of punitive actions pursuant to any reports you make. Also, not all punitive actions are externally visible.

Funding

Donations toward infrastructure/hosting costs can be made through Ko-fi or Liberapay.

Transparency

We have not received any warrants from law enforcement, nor participated in any discussions covered by an NDA.
Short: COVID-aware Twitter escapees ‚ô•Ô∏è COVID content, science, resources, advocacy, social, meetup, chat, etc.

Description:
THIS SERVER WILL CLOSE 2024-12-31

Please sign up on climatejustice.social instead.

climatejustice.rocks was created during a time, when a lot of people were joining the Fediverse and quitting Twitter/X. The existing server climatejustice.social couldn't handle the load anymore.
Now there is no need for separate servers anymore.

Everybody who is on .rocks, please move!

Note: climatejustice.global will remain a separate server, as that one is specifically for groups.

ABOUT THIS SERVER

This is a Fediverse/Mastodon instance for climate justice activists and everybody who feels they belong to the climatejustice movement and follows our rules and principles as described below.

WHO WE ARE

"We" is currently basically just Paula (@PaulaToThePeople@climatejustice.social), who owns the server.
It is hosted locally in Vienna, Austria via the Fediverse Foundation. The server is NOT officially part of the Fediverse Foundation though.

PRINCIPLES

We stand for climate justice, which includes justice for all marginalized people as well as other living beings and we stand against discrimination and exploitation.

We are allies to disabled people, queer and lgbtqia* people, BIPoC, women, poor people, kids and future generations as well as other vulnerable groups including animals, plants and all living beings. We might be critical to religion in general, but stand up against antisemitism, islamomisia and other forms of discrimination due to religious background. We acknowledge our own privileges and work on our own unintentionally discriminatory behaviors. We are all part of an exploitative system and it's impossible to live within that system without harming anyone. We are aware of that and try to work against it, but we are not all fossil free and vegan and that's okay. We don't exclusively post about climate justice, but at least some of our posts should be about climate justice.

We consider ourselves on the left side of the political spectrum and stand up against right wing ideologies.

We have different political views, but are all on the left side or at least are left-open, but right-closed centrists. We stand together against capitalism and fascism and even if we disagree on important issues we don't loose sight of our common goals.

We believe the Fediverse should be a place for respectful discourse and we stand against harassment, trolling and spam.

Everybody's boundaries are to be respected.

We stand up for peace and against violence, oppression and authoritarianism.

We are pacifists, but acknowledge that when attacked, people have the right to defend themselves following international law. We may be critical of states in general, but we never deny any country their statehood. We condemn violence against innocent people and always show solidarity with victims of violence. We don't promote violence in protest, but peaceful sabotage against oppressors is not violence.

We stand behind the science and against fake-news & propaganda.

We are not all scientists ourselves and experts in every field we post about, but we try not to spread any false information. If possible we provide reliable sources. We don't spread unverified rumors.

RULES

  • follow Austrian and EU law
  • don't post pornography

GUIDELINES

Try to always:

  • provide media descriptions
  • use CamelCase in hashtags
  • not overdo it with emojis
  • use content warnings when appropriate
  • hide sensitive media
  • avoid links to privacy violating sites if possible

DISCLAIMER

Principles, rules and guidelines may change at any time and sanctions may be applied according to rules that have not been written yet at that time, but of course never without justification. Appeal is always possible.

MODERATION POLICIES

These are just examples for further clarification. Our principles, rules and guidelines above are what you have to stick to.

What will get you banned immediately:

  • open discrimination
  • right wing ideologies
  • harassment, trolling, spam and porn
  • calls for violence
  • sympathy for oppression
  • pro-authoritarianism
  • spreading of anti-science stances, fake news or propaganda
  • breaking the law drastically or repeatedly

When will we ask you to leave our instance:

  • when you don't align with our principles
  • when you follow our rules, but post almost nothing related to climate justice
  • when you appear more critical of other leftists than the people on the right
  • when we recorded multiple strikes against you
  • when you show a pattern of failing to condemn violence or show unreflected solidarity with a violent, oppressive or authoritarian group of people
  • when you do things that break Austrian law, but are okay somewhere else
  • when even after multiple hints you completely disregard our guidelines

What will get your post deleted and a strike recorded against you:

  • likely unintentional discriminatory behavior or wording
  • likely unintentional behavior that doesn't respect someone else's bondaries
  • likely unintentionally posting something that could lead to violence
  • likely unintentional spreading of false or unverified information
  • when you post something that we fear might get us in trouble with the law

When will we ask you to edit your post and/or consider something for the future:

  • clearly unintentional inconsiderate or unreflective behavior or wording

IMPRINT

Paula Kreuzer
Sillerplatz 8, 1130 Wien
Austria
Short: Welcome to this official Fediverse instance for climate justice activists.

Description:
Actualizado por √∫ltima vez no 9 de maio de 2023

Benvide a mastodon.gal, a instancia para a comunidade galega do fediverso en mastodon.

Gu√≠a de uso

En mastodon.help tes unha gu√≠a de uso de mastodon bastante completa de como funciona m√°stodon, que aplicaci√≥ns existen e como migrar a tua conta dende unha instancia distinta.

Patrocinadores

Preguntas frecuentes (FAQ)

  • Qu√© √© mastodon.gal?

    mastodon.gal √© unha instancia independiente e autoadministrada de mastodon, unha rede social de c√≥digo aberto e descentralizada. Est√° pensada principalmente para a comunidade galega, polo que usamos unicamente o galego coma l√≠ngua de comunicaci√≥n oficial.

    Adem√°is, somos unha instancia antifeixista, feminista, que apoia ao colectivo LGBTIQ+, e, principalmente, cun sentimento identitario galego no que facemos principal fincap√© na promoci√≥n da cultura e da lingua propia da Galiza.

    Es admins da instancia son @nekerafa e @lucycoella.

    Para apoiar a esta instancia, tes os seguintes enlaces:

    • LiberaPay: https://liberapay.com/mastodon.gal/donate
    • Ko-fi: https://ko-fi.com/mastodongal

    Toda esta informaci√≥n a tes resumida na conta de @moderacion.

  • Non son galego/non sei falar galego, poder√≠a entrar?

    Claro, estamos abertos para todas as galegas, usen ou non o galego coma lingua principal, as√≠ coma a todas as persoas que queiran participar na nosa comunidade. Iso si, moitas das nosas usuarias falan galego principalmente, polo que te√±a en conta que moitas non queiran mudar a sua lingua se fala outra distinta (coma poder ser o castel√°n).

  • O contido publicado nesta instancia a quen pertence?

    Ainda que o espazo en disco duro nos pertenza, o contido que est√° subido en todo momento pertence a usuaria que o sobeu. Nos non po√±emos limitaci√≥ns de subir contido con copyright, sempre e cando sexas a persona dona do contido ou te pertenza (calquera contido con copyright de terceiros pode ser eliminado sen previo aviso). Como suxesti√≥n, o mellor e subir contido sen copyright, ou podes indicar cal e a licencia do contido no texto alternativo da imaxe.

  • Toda a infraestructura de mastodon.gal e propia?

    Non. O noso dominio est√° comprado en Dinahosting, que √© o noso patrocinador actualmente da infraestructura (ofr√©cennos unha m√°quina virtual con Debian 11 correndo con 3 vCPU con 6GB de RAM e 60GB de SSD). Ademais, nos usamos un provedor de servizos na nube (DigitalOcean) no que temos o servizo de DNS e o espacio en disco para multimedia nun servicio S3-like. Para o servizo de mail, temos contratado un provedor de mail (SendInBlue).

  • Podo utilizar este servidor para crear unha conta de bot?

    Non. Os bots est√°n prohibidos nesta instancia, xa que os tratamos coma contas de spam. Para tratar bots podes usar a instancia de bots.automatica.dev.

C√≥digo de conduta

Como paso antes de facerse unha conta, recomendamosche ler Netiqueta, que son as regras b√°sicas polas que unha usuaria da Internet debe comportarse con outras usuarias. O resumo das mesmas est√° no apartado de abaixo desta p√°xina.

Atribuci√≥ns

Esta instancia usa o pack de emoticonas Mutant Standard emoji, o cal est√° baixo licencia Creative Commons Atribuci√≥n-Non comercial-Compartir igual 4.0 Internacional.

Tam√©n usa o pack de emoticonas Blobhaj de Heatherhorns, o cal est√° baixo licencia Creative Commons Atribuci√≥n 4.0 Internacional.

O resto dos emotes pertencen aos seus respectivos donos.
Short: mastodon.gal √© unha instancia en galego de Mastodon para a comunidade galega.

Description:
Livello Segreto √® un'oasi social incentrata sul rispetto e la libert√†.

La comunit√† √® nata per parlare di videogiochi, fumetti, musica, diritti, underground, controcultura, arte. LS √® uno spazio senza pubblicit√†, annunci commerciali e gossip. Pi√π che un'istanza generalista, √® un'istanza nata intorno agli interessi e ai valori della sua comunit√†. Frequentatela e scopritela!

*non ci piacciono i bot che si limitano semplicemente a seguire automaticamente hashtag o utenti senza aggiungere qualit√† o contenuti interessanti a Livello Segreto. Troviamo per√≤ che i bot in generale abbiano davvero tanto potenziale quindi se hai un progetto che vorresti integrare con Livello Segreto scrivici: se si tratta di migliorare questo posto siamo sempre disponibilissimi!
Se vuoi contribuire a rendere Livello Segreto un posto migliore puoi farlo in modo semplicissimo:

  • Usa un linguaggio inclusivo sfruttando questo programmino per poter scrivere in modo veloce la schwa
  • Segnala bug o miglioramenti sul nostro bugtracker
Short: Livello Segreto √® il social etico che ha rispetto di te e del tuo tempo.

Description:
Welcome to Typo.social!‚òùÔ∏é

This can be a home for type designers, typographers, letterers, fontworkers, calligraphers, tool builders, foundries, historians, scholars, students and enthusiasts. Run by a federation of international independent typo communities and stammtisches. If your community or organisation wants to help, support or join please let us know!

At this moment these are:

  • Typographische Gesellschaft M√ºnchen (admin @typographische)
  • TypeMedia.org, The Hague (admin @letterror)
  • letterspace.amsterdam (admin @eWalthert)
  • Tiro Typeworks (admin @TiroTypeworks & @ampersand)
  • Fonts In Use (admin @MatthijsSluiter)

Our server is hosted by wwcom in Switzerland and is running on 100% renewable energy. Big thanks to Pirmin Walthert for setting this up.

We hope this place (a mastodon instance) can host some of the community discourse. We rented the server space and registered a domain. Whether all of it works out depends mostly on you! We have appointed moderators and will try to keep an eye on things. By joining our community you agree to follow the Typo.social code of conduct.

We decided to close the registration after the first weeks to keep spamers and trolls out. Yet we are not gatekeeping, anyone who is interested in our community and follows the rules is welcome to join.
Please explain, why you are particularly interested in joining this instance.

Terms of Service‚òùÔ∏é

Terms of Service

Imprint:‚òùÔ∏é

1016 RR Amsterdam

Our admin's posts with #KindSocialMod are used to better inform users about moderation and administration decisions for the server.

PS: if you're interested in contributing to our administration costs, here's the best way: https://ko-fi.com/kindsocial Whether one-time or monthly, all the help is appreciated and meaningful.

Description:
Opalstack

Mastodon for Professionals and Brands

Managed Hosting tailored for developers, entrepreneurs, and businesses. Benefit from our industry-leading support and focus on your market without the hassles of administration or content moderation.

Rules

We rigorously adhere to the Mastodon Server Covenant. The admin team actively addresses reports, offering guidance and, if necessary, immediate intervention in cases of abuse.

English Language Only

Effective from September 2023, accounts with non-English information in their profiles will be suspended. This measure addresses the surge of fake accounts promoting SPAM in other languages. Our admin team is proficient in English moderation, making it the exclusive language for our platform.

Server Blocking

We block instances promoting extreme political views (both far-right and far-left) due to their potential for abusive tactics and hate speech promotion. Additionally, instances with incompatible rules or technical issues that affect our server's functionality are subject to blocking. This includes, but is not limited to, kink, porn, anti-crypto, and anti-capitalist themed servers.

SPAM

Strictly prohibited. Accounts suspected of SPAM will be banned immediately. Maintaining the server's reputation is paramount. We emphasize personal interactions and robust moderation to prevent SPAM, which is detrimental to our and your reputation. Brand awareness works on Mastodon through one on one interactions and genuine content, not SPAM advertising.

Prohibition of Gambling and Betting Activities

We enforce a strict ban on all forms of gambling, gaming for money, betting, or related activities. This encompasses sharing links to gambling sites, discussing or promoting betting strategies, organizing betting pools, and any advertisements or sponsorships related to gambling. Violations may lead to warnings or bans, depending on the severity.

New Rule: Regulation of SPAM Content for Brands and Professionals

Link posting SPAM bots will not be tolerated. It doesn't work here. It harms the server. Build your own server or add ActivityPub to your website if you want this kind of engagement. This is an exploit pure and simple and we do not tolerate it.

Engagement and Authenticity

  1. Purposeful Engagement: Content must engage the Mastodon community or use the ActivityPub protocol. Purely promotional content without meaningful interaction is SPAM.

  2. Authenticity and Relevance: Posts should be authentic, relevant, and add value. Repetitive, irrelevant, or solely promotional content is considered SPAM.

  3. Community Standards: Brands and professionals should foster community by participating in discussions, responding to feedback, and sharing content that reflects the interests and values of the Mastodon community.

  4. Closed Enrollment Policy: To maintain quality and community engagement, open enrollment is closed. New members are selectively admitted based on alignment with community values and standards.

Non-compliance may lead to content removal, warnings, or account suspension. These rules aim to balance professional and brand contributions with the ethos of Mastodon and ActivityPub.
Short: For professionals and brands. Focus on your market, not administration.

Description: An instance for blobcats (blobfoxes are ok too)

Code of Conduct

Version: 1.4

Last updated: 2022-12-22

TLDR:

Historians Social has a zero-tolerance policy for racism, antisemitism, Islamophobia, xenophobia, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, and other forms of discriminatory and bigoted conduct.

Sexually graphic and violent imagery without specific historical context and discussion is not permitted on historians.social.

Harassment of other Fediverse users is not permitted on historians.social.

Harmful and false content (for example, ‚Äú5G causes coronavirus‚Äù or ‚Äúvaccines cause autism‚Äù) is not allowed, will be removed, and may result in an account suspension.

  • Sexual harassment is an instant ban.

  • Transphobic content is an instant ban.

We reserve the right to suspend your account at any time.

Updates to this Document

We may update this document from time to time for reasons including:

  • clarifying terms,
  • addressing new forms of harassment, or
  • addressing harmful community behaviors.

In the event of any changes to this policy, we will notify you via an announcement posted through the Mastodon administration system.

Any changes to the Code of Conduct come into force immediately.

The Long Version

Moderation

Historians.social is a community run by humans for humans. All social media struggles with moderation. Moderators and site admins will use their best judgment to enforce these rules and policies fairly to create an open and safe space for frank and vigorous exchange.

Membership

Historians.social is open to all historians, history educators, history practitioners, museums, history organizations, people working in history-adjacent fields, people interested in history, history-related organizations, friends, and allies. Content posted on historians.social need not be entirely, or even majority, history-related.

Unacceptable Content

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

Nudity that has not been: * Appropriately tagged, and * Masked behind a Content Warning.

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline and may be removed entirely:

  • Excessive advertising, and
  • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources.

The following types of content will be removed and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

  • Any pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions,
  • Any gore and/or extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions, extremely graphic imagery, and posts advocating violence.
    • We welcome documentation of events, like clashes that break out at protests, but require the use of content warnings on that content,
  • Racism or the advocation of racism,

  • Sexism or the advocation of sexism,

  • Content harmful to the public good, examples including:

    • ‚Äú5G causes coronavirus‚Äù
    • ‚ÄúVaccines cause autism‚Äù (or, for clarity, any other anti-vaccine content)

  • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism.

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in permanent revocation of access to the service:

  • Sexual harassment,
  • Content discriminating against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof,
  • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism

Harassment

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from utilizing the service, degrade the performance of the service, or incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service and/or referral to the appropriate law enforcement agency, at our discretion.

Harassment includes the following behaviors:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion,
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment,
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of ‚Äòdead‚Äô or rejected names,
  • Simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like ‚Äúhug‚Äù or ‚Äúbackrub‚Äù in a context that can be harassing, think before you post.) without consent or after a request to stop,
  • Threats of violence,
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm,
  • Deliberate intimidation,
  • Stalking or following,
    • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes,
  • Sustained disruption of discussion,
  • Unwelcome sexual attention,
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease,
  • Deliberate ‚Äúouting‚Äù of any aspect of a person‚Äôs identity without their consent,
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication,
  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed,
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (doxing or dropping dox),
  • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (brigading or dogpiling).

Historians.social will be attentive to and careful with the safety of marginalized people. As a result, we will not act on complaints regarding, but not limited to:

  • ‚ÄòReverse‚Äô -isms, including ‚Äòreverse racism,‚Äô ‚Äòreverse sexism,‚Äô and ‚Äòcisphobia,‚Äô
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as ‚Äòleave me alone,‚Äô ‚Äògo away,‚Äô or ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not discussing this with you,‚Äô
  • Communicating in a ‚Äòtone‚Äô you don‚Äôt find congenial, and
  • Criticizing racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions.

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a user of historians.social or notice someone else is being harassed, please report using the ‚ÄòReport‚Äô feature in the application.

This Code of Conduct applies to historians.social, but if you are being harassed by a user of historians.social outside of the Service, we still want to know about it.

We will take all good-faith reports of harassment by historians.social members seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment that took place at any point in time. Historians.social moderators reserve the right to exclude people from historians social based on their past behavior, including behavior outside of historians.social spaces and behavior towards people who are not users of historians.social.

Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted without response.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Meta

We used and adapted the Code of Conduct of cloudisland.nz with permission. Rules based on hachyderm.io.

Service Level Objective (SLO)

We aim to review new account requests every 2-4 hours throughout the day but are likely to do less review during the United States overnight.

We aim to review all content reports ASAP, but ask that you give us at least 24 hours to respond, particularly overnight.
Short: Historians.social is open to all who are interested in history.

Description:
A social space for BTS ARMY and KPop fans. To find out more visit: apobangpo.website.

Please note: We are actively moderating membership applications to avoid spam. Make sure you include some useful information when you signup, so we can identify you as a real BTS / KPop fan.

Be Positive. Be Kind. Spread Joy. Borahae! üíú

Please note:

  • You MUST be over 18 years to join this space.
  • Remember the Tannie Rule: Assume that Namjoon, Jin, Yoongi, Hobi, Jiminie, Tae and Jungkookie are reading everything you post ‚Ä¶ make them proud!
  • When you join the Apobangpo.Space server, you agree to abide by our Community Charter, Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
  • We have a BTS focus, but members are welcome to discuss anything that takes their fancy - especially Kpop, Music, Art, Books, FanFiction and Pop Culture.
  • Antis, solo stans, sasaengs, mantis and serious shippers are not welcome on the Apobangpo.space server.
  • Do not post airport photos, fansite photos, or images that violate the Tannies‚Äô privacy.

Our Community Charter (https://apobangpo.website/server-rules/) guides how our server is managed. Please read it before joining. Our main aim is to maintain a positive and inclusive vibe for everyone.

When signing up to Apobangpo.Space, you must read the Terms of Use (https://apobangpo.website/terms-of-use/), and the Privacy Policy (https://apobangpo.website/privacy-policy/) which explain your legal rights and responsibilities.

Apobangpo is run by Pixelcats aka Jo Kay with help from the #FediArmy community. You can find out more about the project at: https://apobangpo.website/about/.
Short: A fediverse home for BTS ARMY and KPop Fans. All welcome! Share your favourite Korean music, scream for your favourite Idol(s), learn together. All fun and no drama. Bangtan Forever, ARMY forever.

Description:
Care to donate?

If you'd like to donate towards the operating costs of this instance, you're welcome to make a tax-deductible donation at https://opencollective.com/pnwzone

Who are we?

PNW.Zone is a decentralised, free and open alternative to Twitter based on Mastodon. Part of the Fediverse.

This instance is a casual place for those that live in or enjoy the Pacific Northwest (US/Canada). We're chill here, so come join us and share your experiences. This is a general topic instance, but you may find we enjoy #Photography #Nature #Technology and the like.

Looking for a hyper-local Seattle or Portland instance? You may also be interested in social.seattle.wa.us or pdx.social.

I'm new to Mastodon and the Fediverse. Who can I talk to on this instance?

If you're coming from Twitter, you may be wondering why you need to "pick" an instance or server. The Mastodon service is hosted by thousands of interconnected servers - rather than being run by one entity. But don't fear, each administrator has connected their instance to all the other instances so everyone can communicate in one big "Fediverse".

Want to learn more? Here's this massive list of resources related to the #MastodonMigration.

Mastodon Server Covenant

We follow the Mastodon Server Covenant which is a set of minimalistic guidelines to provide the best possible experience for our members.

Registration is Currently Open!

If you‚Äôre new to Mastodon please consider signing up, we‚Äôd love to have you. If you‚Äôre on another instance and want to move closer to your home in the Pacific Northwest, sign up and we can assist! We‚Äôd encourage you to look over our code of conduct and our server rules first, to make sure our moderating style suites your needs.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of pnw.zone; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
  1. Excessive commercial advertising or commercial posts not related to the Pacific Northwest
  2. Bots: Uncurated bots posting from third-party sources must first obtain approval from administration
  3. Nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
  4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
  1. Racism or advocation of racism
  2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
  3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  4. Timeline Flooding: Continuous posting of content or reposting of external content within a short time without intent of engaging in a conversation is not allowed.
Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
  1. Sexual depictions of children
  2. Content illegal in the United States (where pnw.zone is hosted)
  3. Holocaust denial, Nazi symbolism, or conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
  1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
  3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment. These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user‚Äôs access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Where are we hosted?

We're hosted on AWS in the Oregon region. Media is replicated to caching endpoints around the world. Local laws apply.

DMCA

To submit a copyright claim, visit the DMCA Policy page on our community hub.
Short: Come join the Pacific Northwest (US/Canada) Community! A regional instance for anyone that lives in or enjoys the PNW.

Description:
Welcome to Lounge Town! Feel free to explore Mastodon from here, get settled and comfortable, and make new friends.

This instance, while chill and all, is actively moderated against racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, and other forms of abuse. No nazis, no "free speech" dog whistling. No asshats.

You must read and follow The Rules.

We welcome LGBTQ+, disabled, Black, indigenous, and all historically excluded communities.

Most posts are expected to be in English to allow for enforcement of content moderation.

Daily backups are created every night (UTC), and instance status can be found here.

Mayor's office available at mayor.lounge.town.
Short: A chill server for folks to hang out.

Description:
ArsenalFC.Social is the world's first dedicated Arsenal FC Mastodon Server. This server is the brainchild of 3 Gooners from around the world (US, UK, India) who have pooled their resources, skillsets, and funds to create something that will hopefully become a "home" for Gooners around the world.

Mastodon is a new, growing social media tool that combines some of the best elements of Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, and Instagram and allows a very customisable environment for you to "live" in. Please enjoy your time here and tell your friends!
Short: ArsenalFC.social is the world's FIRST and ONLY Arsenal Football Club-specific Mastodon Server - run BY Gooners FOR Gooners.

About Persians Mastodon server

Greetings to you who are reading this text.

 

Summary about this server (instance)

This server is built under Mastodon and is for the communication of Farsi (Persian) speakers all over the world.

Registration for this instance is open to the public.

We have no interference in the original Mastodon codes and we follow exactly the original version.

We will not sell your information and will not hand it over to any organization or government.

We do not support any party or group, so the presence of people from any group, party, race, religion, etc has nothing to do with the server administrators.

We do not have any servers in Iran and we will not have any.

We do not and will not have any ads.

The cost of maintaining the server is currently personal and if needed, it will be in the form of public donations.

Any financial and technical assistance to us will not affect our policy.

The presence of the national flag of Iran next to the main logo has nothing to do with political orientation and is simply the national flag of Iran.

 

Our Commitments

Our first and most important commitment is the commitment to freedom of expression on this server. So the server administrators will only monitor public information without any direction in this server, which is only under public rules.

We are committed to taking daily backups of server data. So, if anything happens to the server, our best efforts will be to save your information.

If we decide to shut down the server, we undertake to inform the users of the server at least three months in advance through email and messages on the server, so that you have the opportunity to migrate your account to another instance.

We are committed that we will not have any access to your personal messages, but keep in mind that the messages in Mastodon are not two-way encrypted, so if you are currently in Iran For your own safety, we suggest you refrain from sending important messages here.

 

Users

Please be sure to use the CW content warning option if your image or content contains things such as violence or other graphics.

Adding virus and malware files to mislead or steal users' data is prohibited and will be removed without prior warning.

 

Our suggestions for using Mastodon

Our main suggestion is to use the Mastodon web version on mobile and PC. Because we use encrypted security keys for your connection with the server, and this puts your security at the highest possible level.

Using unofficial apps is not as secure as the web version. Convert the web to a personal app on mobile Click here to convert the web version to a mobile app on Android and click here to convert the web version to an iPhone app. Note that in this method you are in the highest security mode as in the web version.

 

Bots

If you create a bot account, be sure to set the posts of the bot account to "Unlisted" by default, so that all the content is published "unlisted" by the robot.

 

Contact us

To communicate with us, you can send a message to the manager's account or send an email to the email indicated at the top of the page.

 

Our other services

Our team also provides other services for communication on other platforms. For example:

 Pixelfed

Pixelfed is a decentralized platform like Mastodon based on Fediverse, which is a service similar to Instagram for sharing photos and videos. You can click on the link below to join our server (Iranian FedEx).

https://persians.life
Short:
Persians communities all around the world.
